children.name: B Cohort
children.NodeDescription:
///t
B. Cohort assembly
t///

children.name: BA MS patients from hosp
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BA MS diagnosis from hospital*/
/*
[_RD]
B. Cohort assembly.
B.A Get data for MS diagnosis from hospitalization files.

From the raw files of hospitalization data, get records between the inclusion start date and inclusion end date period. Keep all fields.
Save as data set _BAA.

From data set _BAA, concatenate hospitalization records if matching the criteria in Appendix ?.
Keep all fields, add two fields to define the rearranged dates of admission and discharge (i.e., date_epiAdm, date_epiDschg).
Save the results in data set _BAB.

From the data set _BAB, select records with an MS-specific ICD codes in any of the 25 diagnosis fields.
Keep distinct records with the fields of patient id, date_epiAdm, date_epiDschg.
Also create two new fields, namely, the field 'SRC' for source of diagnosis, the field 'DXDate ' for date of diagnosis.
Let SRC='h' (i.e., MS diagnosis from hospital). Let DXDate = date_epiAdm. Save the selected records in data set _BA.

*/
%put &entryStartDate;
%put &entryEndDate;
%let inclusionStartDate= '01jan1996'd;
%let inclusionEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;


data _null_;run;
/*BAA0. unzip the master data of hospitalization records*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_hosp.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_hosp.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=master_hosp);*/

/*BAA.
From the raw files of hospitalization data, get records between the inclusion start date and inclusion end date period. Keep all fields.
Save as data set _BAA.
*/
data _BAA;
    set master_hosp;
    where
        adm_date between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate
        or
        dschg_date between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate
        or
        adm_date < &inclusionStartDate and dschg_date > &inclusionEndDate
    ;    
run;
/*%minmax(data=_baa, target=test, var=adm_date, format=date9.);*/

/*BAB, make hospitalization episodes as defined in protocol:
    
    The following situations will be considered a part of the same [episode of hospitalization]:
    1) short hospital visits within longer hospital visits,
    2) overnight hospital stays within a day of the last separation date,
    3) visits that have an admission date before the last separation date
        Examples, the following hospitalization intervals will be counted as 1 hospital claim
            ADMDATE SEPDATE CODE
            July 5, 2010 to July 20, 2010 Dx: MS [340/G35]
            July 10, 2010 to July 11, 2010 Dx: MS [340/G35]
            July 21, 2010 to August 4, 2010 Dx: MS [340/G35]
            August 1, 2010 to August 7, 2010 Dx: MS [340/G35]
            August 7, 2010 to August 10, 2010 Dx: MS [340/G35]
*/
%cleanHNew(
        data=_BAA,
        target=_BAB1,
        MaxGap=1,
        incldHN=0,
        startD=adm_date,
        endD=dschg_date,
        studyID=Key_hsn,
        keep=, inst_num=, keepTMP=,
        debug=1
        );

    /*rename the radm_date to epiAdm_date, rdschg_date to epiDschg_date*/
    data _BAB;
        set _BAB1;
        rename
            radm_date = epiAdm_date
            rdschg_date = epiDschg_date;
            HRecID=_N_;
    run;

/*_BAC*/
    /* BAC1 From _BAB, select all ICD_Codes matching the study ICDs*/
    data _BAC1;
        set _BAB;
        src='h';
        array dxs $ dx_code_1 - dx_code_25;
        array cdxs $ conv_dx_code_1 - conv_dx_code_25;
        format type $5.;
        format code $10.;
        do i = 1 to 25;
                if dxs(i) in: ('G35') then do;
                    type='dx';
                    dxN=i;
                    code=dxs(i);
                    output;
                end;
                if cdxs(i) in: ('340') then do;
                    type='cdx';
                    dxN=i;
                    code=cdxs(i);
                    output;
                end;
        end;
        keep HRecID key_hsn type dxN code adm_date dschg_date src epiAdm_date epiDschg_date;
    run;

    /*BAC2, from _BAC1, get a distinct list of patients, with patientID, epiAdm_date, epiDschg_date, and source indicator (src='h');
        the target file _BA is a list of MS diagnosis from hospital episodes, each patient may have multiple dx,each for a different episode
    */
    %distinct(data=_BAC1, target=localt._BA, vars=%str(key_hsn, epiAdm_date, epiDschg_date, src, epiAdm_date as dxDate));


s///
t///

children.name: BC Combine Dxs from Hosp and Physician
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BC. Combina Dxs from Hosp and Physician*/

data _null_;run;

/*
[_RD]
Merge data set _BA and data set _BB. Sort by patient ID and DXDate.
Keep distinct patient IDs with 3 or more records in the merged file.
see P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\Tremlett - Study Population Detailed Description_DRUMSv014.doc
*/

%let theStudyID=key_hsn;

/*BC1. combine _BA and _BB*/
data _BC1;
    set localt._BA localt._BB;
    Disease='MS';
    keep &theStudyID DxDate Src Disease;
run;

/*BC2. select qualified MS cases*/
%CaseDefV2(
    data=_BC1,
    target=localt._BC,
    studyID=&theStudyID,
    dxDateCol=dxDate,
    nDX=3,
    DxYears=,
    DxGapDays=,
    DQDateOrder=,
    theDiseaseCol=Disease,
    sameDxcode=,
    debug=
);
/*%freq(data=localt._BC, table=src);*/
/*%print(data=localt._BC);*/

s///
t///

children.name: Q_AC1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
QuestionsIn AB, hospital records since 1993, physician service data since 1994, which means that the dx from physician services for 1993 is missing. How does this affect the missing of cases, or the miscalculation of dx dates?
t///

children.name: AC.QTest1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
AC.Q11.1a.1.3.QTest1Tests for Q_AC1[Why]Missing of data in a particular time period(e.g., missing physician service data in 1993) may have impact to MS case identification. The types of impact include:1) Unaffected, even without the data source, yet the case was determined by other sources (e.g., hospitalizaiton events, or pharmacy claims) of the same year. The first_admin_code_date remains the same2) Still can be determined by other sources, but of a delayed first_admin_code_date (could be in the same year, or in a year following)3) Still can be determined by the physician service files of the following years (and collectively with data of other sources), but of a delayed first_admin_code_date4) Cannot be identified by any sources of the following years.Despite of the various patterns, the interest rests on the following:1) whether the patient can still be identified2) is the first_admin_code_date changedFor these two measures, the idea is to compare the difference between two scenarios of a selected calendar year:1) with all data sources (physician service, hospitalizaiton, pharmacy claims)2) with data source but physician service records. The analysis is repeated for calendar years (for SK, from 1996 to 2018), such to illustrate the impact by different years. [End of why]0. Cases identified by all sources as if the data starts from the specified year (e.g., 1997)0.0.Create an empty dataset (ACA) to store the final results.data localt.ACA;runɎ.1. From Hospitalization (AA) and Physician service data (AB), take out those MS related dx records with a servedate earlier than the specified year 1996.0.1.1. combine AA and AB, select dx records since the specified calendar year0.1.2. select qualified MS cases0.2. From ms_DMD related pharmacy claims(AD1, prepared in program AD), select those individuals receiving DMD0.2.1. From above, select distinct records of patientID, DIN and serveDate0.2.2. From above, select distinct records of patientID, serveDate, and src0.2.3. From above, select the earliest servedate by patient, and indicate the date as the dxDate0.2.4. Select those in ACA_0B3 but not in ACA_0A. Those are MS cases only can be identified from the dispensation claims0.3 Combine ACA_0A and ACA_0B, to have the cohort identified from sources other than the physician service of the year0.3.1, combine ACA_0A and ACA_0B, drop the col 'disease'. For those missing value of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN (from hospitalor physician service claims), indicate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=00.3.2. Determine the First_admin_code_date by linking the first date of DMD (in ACA_0B3) to the cases in ACA_0C1Note. It could be that MS cases were identified from the hospital/physician service records, while also receiving MS medications (DMD), and the date of the first dispensation of DMD is earleir than any dxDates from the hospitalor physician service file. In that case, the First_admin_code_date = the first First_admin_code_date ??? need to check0.3.3 From above, drop the colum firstRxDate, indicate the calendar yearthe data set ACA_0C contains cases idenfied from all sources as if the data starts from the sepcified yearadd the number of cases (by complete data) into the final report data0.3.4 Exlcuding patients not in data set CA (those not having sex or coverage info)0.4 add the number of cases (by complete data) into the final report data1. Cases identified by sources without physician service data since the specified year (e.g., 1997)1.1. From Hospitalization (AA) and Physician service data (AB), take out those MS related dx records with a servedate in the specified year 1996.1.1.1. combine AA and AB, select dx records not in the specified calendar year1.1.2. select qualified MS cases1.2. From ms_DMD related pharmacy claims(AD1, prepared in program AD), select those individuals receiving DMD1.2.1. From above, select distinct records of patientID, DIN and serveDate1.2.2. From above, select distinct records of patientID, serveDate, and src1.2.3. From above, select the earliest servedate by patient, and indicate the date as the dxDate1.2.4. Select those in ACA_1B3 but not in ACA_1A. Those are MS cases only can be identified from the dispensation claims1.3 Combine ACA_1A and ACA_1B, to have the cohort identified from sources other than the physician service of the year1.3.1, combine ACA_1A and ACA_1B, drop the col 'disease'. For those missing value of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN (from hospitalor physician service claims), indicate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=01.3.2. Determine the First_admin_code_date by linking the first date of DMD (in ACA_1B3) to the cases in ACA_1C1Note. It could be that MS cases were identified from the hospital/physician service records, while also receiving MS medications (DMD), and the date of the first dispensation of DMD is earleir than any dxDates from the hospitalor physician service file. In that case, the First_admin_code_date = the first First_admin_code_date ??? need to check1.3.3 From above, drop the colum firstRxDate, indicate the calendar year1.3.4 exlcuding patients not in data set CA (those not having sex or coverage info)2.compare the cases identified in step 1 (ACA_1C) with cases identifed from all sources (ACA_0C)indicate those only identified when not missing physician service data of the year2.1.1 compare the two data sets (ACA_1C is from data missing physician service data of the year, ACA_0C is from datanot missing physician service data of the year)2.1.2 count # patient missing because of abense of physician service data of the year3.compare the cases identified in step 1 (ACA_1C) with cases identifed from all sources (ACA_0C)indicate those with a different First_admin_code_date3.1 select cases in both ACA_1C and ACA_0C, indicate whether or not having the same First_admin_code_date3.2 estimate the mean, median of First_admin_code_date days changed because of absence of the physician data3.2.1the mean and STD of days delayed3.2.2 the median and IQR of days delayed3.2.4 the number of cases with exactly the median days-delayed3.2.5 Putting the stats together4.Merge the stats of a specific year into the final data set with all years (the table is named 'ACA')
t///

children.name: ACA QTest1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*
AC.Q
1.1a.1.3.QTest
Tests for Q_AC

[Why]
    Missing of data in a particular time period(e.g., missing physician service data in 1993) may have impact to MS case identification. The types of impact include:
    1) Unaffected, even without the data source, the cases were able to be determined by other sources (e.g., hospitalizaiton events, or pharmacy claims) of the same year. The first_admin_code_date remains the same
    2) Still can be determined by other sources, but of a delayed first_admin_code_date (could be in the same year, or in a year following)
    3) Still can be determined by the physician service files of the following years (and collectively with data of other sources), but of a delayed first_admin_code_date
    4) Cannot be identified by any sources of the following years.

    Despite of the various patterns, the interest rests on the following:
    1) whether the patient can still be identified
    2) is the first_admin_code_date changed

    For these two measures, the idea is to compare the difference between two scenarios of a selected calendar year:
    1) with all data sources (physician service, hospitalizaiton, pharmacy claims)
    2) with data source but physician service records.
    The analysis is repeated for calendar years (for SK, from 1996 to 2018), such to illustrate the impact by different years.
[End of why]
*/

data _null_;run;

%let theStudyID=&theStudyID;
%let theCohortReportPath=%str(P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports);
%let theCohortReportFile=%str(Cohort-characteristics-DRUMS-Aug2018v10-SK.xlsx);

%let theSheet=%str(Missing Physician Data);
%let CloseXls=;

%macro test_MissingPhysicianData(debug=);
    %local theYear debug;
                    /*0. Cases identified by all sources as if the data starts from the specified year (e.g., 1997)*/
                    /*
                    0.1. From Hospitalization (AA) and Physician service data (AB), take out those MS related dx records with a servedate
                    earlier than the specified year 1996.
                    */
                    /*%print(data=localt.AA);*/
                    /*%print(data=localt.AB);*/

/*0.0.Create an empty dataset (ACA) to store the final results.*/
    data localt.ACA;
    run;
    %do theYear = 1996 %to 2018;

                    /*0.1.1. combine AA and AB, select dx records since the specified calendar year*/
                    data ACA_0A1;
                        set localt.AA localt.AB;
                        Disease='MS';
                        if year(dxDate) ge &theYear;
                        keep &theStudyID DxDate Src Disease;
                    run;

                    /*0.1.2. select qualified MS cases*/
                    %CaseDefV2(
                        data=ACA_0A1,
                        target=ACA_0A,
                        studyID=&theStudyID,
                        dxDateCol=dxDate,
                        nDX=3,
                        DxYears=,
                        DxGapDays=,
                        DQDateOrder=,
                        theDiseaseCol=Disease,
                        sameDxcode=,
                        debug=
                    );

                    /*%freq(data=ACA_0A, table=src);*/

                    /*
                    0.2. From ms_DMD related pharmacy claims(AD1, prepared in program AD), select those individuals receiving DMD
                    */
                    /*0.2.1. From above, select distinct records of patientID, DIN and serveDate*/
                    %let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
                    %distinct(data=localt.AD1, target=ACA_0B1, vars=%str(&theStudyID, DIN, &theServeDate), filters=%str(year(&theServeDate) GE &theYear));

                    /*0.2.2. From above, select distinct records of patientID, serveDate, and src*/
                    %distinct(data=ACA_0B1, target=ACA_0B2, vars=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate),
                                    orderby=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate));

                    /*0.2.3. From above, select the earliest servedate by patient, and indicate the date as the dxDate*/
                    data ACA_0B3;
                        set ACA_0B2;
                        by &theStudyID &theServeDate;
                        if first.&theStudyID;
                        rename &theServeDate = dxDate;
                        src='m';
                    run;

                    /*0.2.4. Select those in ACA_0B3 but not in ACA_0A. Those are MS cases only can be identified from the dispensation claims*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_0B3,
                        target=ACA_0B,
                        vars=%str(t1.*, 1 as Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN),
                        filters=%str(&theStudyID not in (select &theStudyID from ACA_0A))
                    );

                    /*0.3 Combine ACA_0A and ACA_0B, to have the cohort identified from sources other than the physician service of the year*/

                    /*0.3.1, combine ACA_0A and ACA_0B, drop the col 'disease'. For those missing value of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN (from hospital
                        or physician service claims), indicate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0*/
                    data ACA_0C1;
                        set ACA_0A ACA_0B;
                        drop disease;
                        if Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=. then Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0;
                    run;
                    /*%freq(data=ACA_0C1, table=src * Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN);*/

                    /*0.3.2. Determine the First_admin_code_date by linking the first date of DMD (in ACA_0B3) to the cases in ACA_0C1
                        Note. It could be that MS cases were identified from the hospital/physician service records, while also receiving
                            MS medications (DMD), and the date of the first dispensation of DMD is earleir than any dxDates from the hospital
                                or physician service file. In that case, the First_admin_code_date = the first First_admin_code_date
                        ??? need to check
                    */
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_0C1,
                        t2=ACA_0B3,
                        target=ACA_0C2,
                        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.dxDate as firstRxDate_Ever,
                                            case
                                                when t2.dxDate=. then t1.dxDate
                                                when t2.dxDate ne . and t1.dxDate <= t2.dxDate then t1.DxDate
                                                when t2.dxDate ne . and t1.dxDate > t2.dxDate then t2.dxDate
                                            end
                                            format date9. as First_admin_code_date
                                    ),
                        jtype=left,
                        jvars=&theStudyID
                    );

                    /*0.3.3 From above, drop the colum firstRxDate_Ever, indicate the calendar year
                        the data set ACA_0C contains cases idenfied from all sources as if the data starts from the sepcified year*/
                    data ACA_0C3;
                        set ACA_0C2;
                        First_admin_code_Year=year(First_admin_code_date);
                        drop firstRxDate_Ever dxDate;
                    run;

                    /*0.3.4 exlcuding patients not in data set CA (those not having sex or coverage info)*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_0C3,
                        target=ACA_0C,
                        vars=*,
                        filters=%str(&theStudyID in (select &theStudyID from localt.CA))
                    );

                    /*0.4 add the number of cases (by complete data) into the final report data*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_0C);
                    data ACA_0D;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        theCat='N_completeData';
                        N_completeDATA=&nobs;
                        theStat=strip(put(N_completeDATA, comma8.));
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    %let nobs=;

                    /*1. Cases identified by sources without physician service data since the specified year (e.g., 1997)*/
                    /*
                    1.1. From Hospitalization (AA) and Physician service data (AB), take out those MS related dx records with a servedate in the specified year 1996.
                    */
                    /*%print(data=localt.AA);*/
                    /*%print(data=localt.AB);*/

                    /*1.1.1. combine AA and AB, select dx records not in the specified calendar year*/
                    data ACA_1A1;
                        set localt.AA localt.AB;
                        Disease='MS';
                        if not (src='p' and year(dxDate) = &theYear ) and year(dxDate) ge &theYear;
                        keep &theStudyID DxDate Src Disease;
                    run;

                    /*1.1.2. select qualified MS cases*/
                    %CaseDefV2(
                        data=ACA_1A1,
                        target=ACA_1A,
                        studyID=&theStudyID,
                        dxDateCol=dxDate,
                        nDX=3,
                        DxYears=,
                        DxGapDays=,
                        DQDateOrder=,
                        theDiseaseCol=Disease,
                        sameDxcode=,
                        debug=
                    );

                    /*%freq(data=ACA_1A, table=src);*/

                    /*
                    1.2. From ms_DMD related pharmacy claims(AD1, prepared in program AD), select those individuals receiving DMD
                    */
                    /*1.2.1. From above, select distinct records of patientID, DIN and serveDate*/
                    %let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
                    %distinct(data=localt.AD1, target=ACA_1B1, vars=%str(&theStudyID, DIN, &theServeDate), filters=%str(year(&theServeDate) GE &theYear));

                    /*1.2.2. From above, select distinct records of patientID, serveDate, and src*/
                    %distinct(data=ACA_1B1, target=ACA_1B2, vars=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate), orderby=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate));

                    /*1.2.3. From above, select the earliest servedate by patient, and indicate the date as the dxDate*/
                    data ACA_1B3;
                        set ACA_1B2;
                        by &theStudyID &theServeDate;
                        if first.&theStudyID;
                        rename &theServeDate = dxDate;
                        src='m';
                    run;

                    /*1.2.4. Select those in ACA_1B3 but not in ACA_1A. Those are MS cases only can be identified from the dispensation claims*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_1B3,
                        target=ACA_1B,
                        vars=%str(t1.*, 1 as Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN),
                        filters=%str(&theStudyID not in (select &theStudyID from ACA_1A))
                    );

                    /*1.3 Combine ACA_1A and ACA_1B, to have the cohort identified from sources other than the physician service of the year*/

                    /*1.3.1, combine ACA_1A and ACA_1B, drop the col 'disease'. For those missing value of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN (from hospital
                        or physician service claims), indicate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0*/
                    data ACA_1C1;
                        set ACA_1A ACA_1B;
                        drop disease;
                        if Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=. then Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0;
                    run;
                    /*%freq(data=ACA_1C1, table=src * Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN);*/

                    /*1.3.2. Determine the First_admin_code_date by linking the first date of DMD (in ACA_1B3) to the cases in ACA_1C1
                        Note. It could be that MS cases were identified from the hospital/physician service records, while also receiving
                            MS medications (DMD), and the date of the first dispensation of DMD is earleir than any dxDates from the hospital
                                or physician service file. In that case, the First_admin_code_date = the first First_admin_code_date
                        ??? need to check
                    */
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_1C1,
                        t2=ACA_1B3,
                        target=ACA_1C2,
                        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.dxDate as firstRxDate_Ever,
                                            case
                                                when t2.dxDate=. then t1.dxDate
                                                when t2.dxDate ne . and t1.dxDate <= t2.dxDate then t1.DxDate
                                                when t2.dxDate ne . and t1.dxDate > t2.dxDate then t2.dxDate
                                            end
                                            format date9. as First_admin_code_date
                                    ),
                        jtype=left,
                        jvars=&theStudyID
                    );

                    /*1.3.3 From above, drop the colum firstRxDate_Ever, indicate the calendar year*/
                    data ACA_1C3;
                        set ACA_1C2;
                        First_admin_code_Year=year(First_admin_code_date);
                        drop firstRxDate_Ever dxDate;
                    run;
                    /*1.3.4 exlcuding patients not in data set CA (those not having sex or coverage info)*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_1C3,
                        target=ACA_1C,
                        vars=*,
                        filters=%str(&theStudyID in (select &theStudyID from localt.CA))
                    );
                    /*%freq(data=ACA_1C, table=src*Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN);*/

                    /*2.compare the cases identified in step 1 (ACA_1C) with cases identifed from all sources (ACA_0C)
                        indicate those only identified when not missing physician service data of the year
                    */
                    /*2.1.1 compare the two data sets (ACA_1C is from data missing physician service data of the year,
                        ACA_0C is from data not missing physician service data of the year)*/
                    %compAB(a=ACA_0C, b=ACA_1C, target=ACA_2A1, vars=&theStudyID);
                    /*2.1.2 count # patient missing because of abense of physician service data of the year*/
                    %freq(data=ACA_2A1 noprint, table=compAB, option=%str(out=ACA_2A2));
                    data ACA_2A;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_2A2;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        if compAB='InA';
                        theCat='N_Missing';
                        theStat=strip(put(count,comma8.)) || "(" || strip(put(percent/100, percent8.1)) || ")";
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_2A);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_2A;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='N_Missing';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;
                    data ACA_2B;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_2A2;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        if compAB='Both';
                        theCat='N_NotMissing';
                        theStat=strip(put(count,comma8.)) || "(" || strip(put(percent/100, percent8.1)) || ")";
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_2B);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_2B;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='N_NotMissing';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;

                    /*3.compare the cases identified in step 1 (ACA_1C) with cases identifed from all sources (ACA_0C)
                        indicate those with a different First_admin_code_date*/
                    /*3.1 select cases in both ACA_1C and ACA_0C, indicate whether or not having the same First_admin_code_date*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=ACA_0C,
                        t2=ACA_1C,
                        target=ACA_3A1,
                        vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t2.src,
                                        t2.First_admin_code_date - t1.First_admin_code_date as First_admin_code_date_diff),
                        jtype=inner,
                        jvars=&theStudyId
                    );
                    data ACA_3A;
                        set ACA_3A1;
                        if First_admin_code_date_diff >0 then First_admin_code_date_change=1;
                        if First_admin_code_date_diff <0 then First_admin_code_date_change=-1;
                        if First_admin_code_date_diff =0 then First_admin_code_date_change=0;
                    run;
                    %freq(data=ACA_3A noprint, table=First_admin_code_date_change, option=%str(out=ACA_3A2));
                    data ACA_3A3;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_3A2;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        if First_admin_code_date_change=0;
                        theCat='First_admin_code_date_not_changed';
                        theStat=strip(put(count,comma8.)) || "(" || strip(put(percent/100, percent8.1)) || ")";
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_3A3);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_3A3;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='First_admin_code_date_not_changed';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;
                    data ACA_3A4;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_3A2;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        if First_admin_code_date_change=1;
                        theCat='First_admin_code_date_changed';
                        theStat=strip(put(count,comma8.)) || "(" || strip(put(percent/100, percent8.1)) || ")";
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_3A4);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_3A4;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='First_admin_code_date_changed';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;
                    /*3.2 estimate the mean, median of First_admin_code_date days changed because of absence of the physician data*/
                    %GetMeanStats(
                            data=ACA_3A,
                            where=First_admin_code_date_change ne 0,
                            groupVars=,
                            theVar=First_admin_code_date_diff,
                            theStats=mean median,
                            target=ACA_3B1,
                            debug=
                        );
                    /*the mean and STD of days delayed*/
                    data ACA_3B2;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_3B1;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        theCat='Mean_days_changed';
                        theStat=strip(put(mean,comma8.)) || byte(177) || strip(put(std/100, comma8.));
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_3B2);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_3B2;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='Mean_days_changed';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;
                    /*the median and IQR of days delayed*/
                    data ACA_3B3;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_3B1;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        theCat='Median_days_changed';
                        theStat=strip(put(median,comma8.)) || "(" || strip(put(std/100, comma8.)) || ")";
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*if the above data set is empty, create a dummy and make theStat=0. This is to ensure that in
                            the later combined summary table, the statistics about the current measure is not skipped*/
                    %nobs(data=ACA_3B3);
                    %if &nobs=0 %then %do;
                        data ACA_3B3;
                            theYear=&theYear;
                            theCat='Median_days_changed';
                            theStat='0';
                        run;
                    %end;
                    %let nobs=;
                    /*the number of cases with exactly the median days-delayed*/
                    data ACA_3B4;
                        theYear=&theYear;
                        set ACA_3B1;
                        format theCat $100. theStat $100.;
                        theCat='N_Median';
                        theStat=strip(put(N_Patients_median,comma8.)) ;
                        keep theYear theCat theStat;
                    run;
                    /*Creat a row for the specified year*/
                    data ACA_3B5;
                        format theStat $100.;
                        theStat=strip(put(&theYear, 8.));
                    run;
                    /*Putting the stats together*/
                    data ACA_3B6;
                        set
                        ACA_3B5
                        ACA_0D
                        ACA_2A
                        ACA_2B
                        ACA_3A3
                        ACA_3A4
                         ACA_3B2
                        ACA_3B3
                        ACA_3B4
                        ;
                        keep theStat;
                        rename theStat = theStat_&theYear;
                    run;
                    /*Merge the year specific data into the final dataset*/
                    data localt.ACA;
                        merge localT.ACA ACA_3B6;
                    run;

                    %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
                        proc datasets nolist;    
                            delete ACA_:;
                        run;
                    %end;

        %end; /*end of loop for years*/

    /*report*/
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=localt.ACA,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=3,
                cellCol=%eval(1996 - 1981),
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

%mend test_MissingPhysicianData;
%test_MissingPhysicianData(debug=);
s///
t///

children.name: BB MS patients from physician file
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BB, MS diagnosis from physician service claims*/

data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
From the raw files of physician service data, get records between the inclusion start date and inclusion end date period.
Keep all fields, and save as data set _BBA.

From the data set _BBA, select records of MS-specific ICD codes from any diagnosis fields. Save the selected records in data set _BBB.

From data set _BBB, remove records with an MS related hospitalization (in data set _BA).
Create a new field called 'DxDate'. Let DXDate = Date of service. Also create a field 'SRC'. Let SRC='p'.
Keep fields of patient ID, DXDate , and SRC. Keep distinct values of the selected fields. Save the result as data set _BBC.
*/

%let theStudyID=key_hsn;
%let theDxCol=diag;
%let theServeDate=dos;
%let msICD9CodeList = '340';
%let inclusionStartDate= '01jan1996'd;
%let inclusionEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;




/*BB0. unzip the master data of physician service records*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_MSB.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_MSB.sas7bdat)
);

/*_BBA
From the raw files of physician service data, get records between the inclusion start date and inclusion end date period.
Keep all fields, and save as data set _BBA.
*/
data _BBA;
    set master_MSB;
    where &theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate;
run;


/*_BBB.
From the data set _BBA, select records of MS-specific ICD codes from any diagnosis fields. Save the selected records in data set _BBB.
*/
data _BBB;
    set _BBA;
    if &theDxCol in: (&msICD9CodeList);
    code=&theDxCol;
run;

/*BBC*/
/*BBC1. From above, remove those physician service claims within any hosptial episodes that have MS diagnosis(AA)
    Note, a physician service is not to be removed, if it is within a hospitalization episode that does not have MS diagnosis
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_BBB,
    t2=localt._BA,
    target=_BBC1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t1.Code, 'p' as src, t1.&theServeDate as dxDate),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(
                        Not (t1.&theServeDate between t2.epiAdm_date and t2.epiDschg_date )
                        )
);

/*BBC2. From above, select the distinct combination of studyID dxDate and src
    Note. This step is actually not necessary as there is only one ICD-9 code
*/
%distinct(data=_BBC1, target=localt._BB, vars=%str(&theStudyID, dxDate, src));

s///
t///

children.name: BD MS patients from Pharmacy claims
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BD. MS Patients identified from Pharmacy Claims*/

/*
[_RD]
From the raw files of pharmacy claim data, get records between the data start date and data end date period.
Keep all fields, and save as data set _BDA.

From the data set _BDA, select records of MS-specific medication claims. Save the selected records in data set _BDB.

From data set _BDB, Create a new field called 'DxDate'. Let DXDate = Date of service. Also create a field 'SRC'. Let SRC='m'.
Keep fields of patient ID, DXDate , and SRC. For each distinct patient ID, keep the earliest DXDate. Save results in data set _BDC.

For records in data set _BDC, indicate patients who could only can be identified from the dispensation claims, i.e.,
Add a field Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN. For records in data set _BDC3 with patient ids that cannot be found in data set _BC, let Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=1

[_Note]
data set _BD (dx from pharmacy) contains records of patients who can also be identified from the hosptial/physician files. It could be that
a patient can be identified from any of the pharmacy file/hospital/physician files. It was just that the DXDate from pharamcy file is earlier.
In that case, it would be wrong if the patient's pharamcy records were removed, as the earliest DXDate (from the pharmacy file) would be overlooked.

*/


data _null_;run;

%let theStudyID=Key_hsn;
%let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
%let inclusionStartDate= '01jan1996'd;
%let inclusionEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;

/*BD0. Unzip the benefit and nonbenefit drug claims*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_benefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_benefit.sas7bdat)
);

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_nonbenefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_nonbenefit.sas7bdat)
);
data _BD0a;
    set master_dp_benefit;
    dpSrc='be';
    where &theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate;
run;
data _BD0b;
    set master_dp_nonbenefit;
    dpSrc='nb';
    where &theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate;
run;
data _BDA;
    set _BD0a _BD0b;
run;

/*%print(data=localT.A6_DINDX);*/
/*BDB. From above, select claims with a DIN in the MS-DMD din list (localT.a6_DINDx, which was saved by prog A)*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_BDA,
    t2=localT.a6_dindx,
    target=localt._BDB,
    vars=*,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=DIN
);


/*BDC1. From above, select distinct records of patientID, DIN and serveDate*/
%distinct(data=localt._BDB, target=_BDC1, vars=%str(&theStudyID, DIN, &theServeDate));


/*BDC2. From above, select distinct records of patientID, serveDate, and src*/
%distinct(data=_BDC1, target=_BDC2, vars=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate), orderby=%str(&theStudyID, &theServeDate));

/*BDC3. From above, select the earliest servedate by patient, and indicate the date as the dxDate*/
data _BDC;
    set _BDC2;
    by &theStudyID &theServeDate;
    if first.&theStudyID;
    rename &theServeDate = dxDate;
    src='m';
run;

/*_BDD. For records in data set _BDC3, indicate patients who could only can be identified from the dispensation claims, i.e.,
    Add a field Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN. For records in data set _BDC3 with patient ids that cannot be found in data set _BC, let Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=1
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_BDC,
    t2=localt._BC,
    target=localt._BD,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.&theStudyID = "", 1, 0) as Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);


s///
t///

children.name: BE MS from all sources
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BE. Making the raw cohort (MS patients identified from hospital, physician, and pharmacy files) */
/*
[_RD]
Combine records in data set _BC and data set _BD. For those missing Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN values (i.e., records from _BC),
    let Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0.
Sort records by Patient ID, DXDate, and Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN.

For each distinct Patient ID, keep the record with the earliest DXDate.
Create a field 'First_admin_code_date'.
Let First_admin_code_date=DXDate. Also create a field 'First_admin_code_Year'.
Let First_admin_code_Year= the year of 'First_admin_code_date'.
Save the results into data set _BE.

[_Note]
It is important to include the sorting of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN. That way, the records from hospital/physician files will come first.
For same-date records from physician, and pharmacy files, the one from physician file will be kept, with Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0.

The result data set _BE is called 'raw file', as none of the exclusion criteria(e.g., years of coverage, etc) has been applied .

*/
data _null_;run;

%let theStudyID =key_hsn;

/*%print(data=localt._BC);*/
/*%print(data=localt._BD);*/

/*Combine records in data set _BC and data set _BD. For those missing Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN values (i.e., records from _BC),
    let Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0.*/
data _BE1;
    set localt._BC localt._BD;
    if Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=. then Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0;
run;

/*Sort records by Patient ID, DXDate, and Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN.
[_Note]
It is important to include the sorting of Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN. That way, the records from hospital/physician files will come first.
For same-date records from physician, and pharmacy files, the one from physician file will be kept, with Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0.
*/
%sort(data=_BE1, sorter=&theStudyID DXdate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN);

/*For each distinct Patient ID, keep the record with the earliest DXDate.
    Create a field 'First_admin_code_date'.
    Let First_admin_code_date=DXDate. Also create a field 'First_admin_code_Year'.
    Let First_admin_code_Year= the year of 'First_admin_code_date'.
    Save the results into data set _BE.
*/
data localt._BE;
    set _BE1;
    by &theStudyID DXdate Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN;
    if first.&theStudyID;
    drop disease;
    rename DXDate=First_admin_code_date;
    First_admin_code_Year=year(dxdate);
run;
/*%freq(data=localt._BE, table=src * Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN);*/


s///
t///

children.name: BF get Sex Birth
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*BF, get patient's sex and birth data. */
/*
[_RD]
From the master registry file, get sex, year of birth, and month of birth. Create a variable 'Birth' for the date of birth,
    assuming day 15 is the birthday.
Create a variable 'Age_First_admin_code_date', to determine age on the First_admin_code_date.
Create a variable 'StudyStartDate'. If Age_First_admin_code_date< 18, let StudyStartDate= the 18th birthday; otherwise let StudyStartDate= First_admin_code_date.
Save results to data set _BF.
*/
data _null_;run;
/*From the master registry file, get sex, year of birth, and date of birth. Create a variable 'Birth' for the date of birth,
    assuming day 15 is the birthday.*/
%let theStudyID =key_hsn;
%let dayOfBirth=15;

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_phrs_info.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_phrs_info.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=master_phrs_info);*/

/*For patients in _BE, from the master registry file, get sex, year of birth, and date of birth. Create a variable 'Birth' for the date of birth,
    assuming day 15 is the birthday.Also create a variable 'Age_First_admin_code_date', to determine age on the First_admin_code_date.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._BE,
    t2=master_phrs_info,
    target=_BF1,
    vars=%str(
                    t1.*,
                    t2.sex_desc as sex,
                    mdy(t2.born_month, &dayOfBirth, t2.born_year) format date9. as Birth,
                    int(yrdif(mdy(t2.born_month, 15, t2.born_year), t1.First_admin_code_date, 'AGE')) as Age_First_admin_code_date
                    ),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);
/*Check if there are patients younger than 18 on first_admin_code_date
    data test;
        set _BF1;
        if Age_First_admin_code_date < 18;
    run;
    There are such patients.
*/


/*Create a variable 'StudyStartDate'. If Age_First_admin_code_date< 18, move the studystartdate to the 18th birthday. Save results to data set _BF */
data localt._BF;
    set _BF1;
    if Age_First_admin_code_date < 18 then StudyStartDate = mdy(month(birth), day(birth), year(birth)+18);
    else StudyStartDate = First_admin_code_date;
    format StudyStartDate date9.;
run;
s///
t///

children.name: BG excld by FollowupEnddate
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*_BG. Exclude patients included after the follow up end date*/
data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
From data set _BF, exclude patients who had a StudyStartDate after the followupend date.
*/


%let FollowUpEndDate='31Mar2018'd; /*changed here*/

data localt._BG;
    set localt._BF;
    if StudyStartDate <= &FollowUpEndDate;
run;
s///
t///

children.name: BH Coverage
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*_BH. Get coverage data, excluding patients not fully covered within 365 days prior to the StudyStartDate*/

/*
[_RD]
For patients in data set _BF, from the master file with registry data, get health care entrollment, and gap periods within
    365 days prior to (exclusive) the studyStartDate.
Exclude patients not fully enrolled within 365 days prior to (exclusive) the studyStartDate. Fully enrolled is defined as:
    1. not having a cumulative unregistered days of ??.
    2. not having a continuous break of ?? days.
Save results in _B. (Is it the final cohort?)
*/
data _null_;run;

%let theStudyID =key_hsn;
%let Days_cover=365;
%let Days_maxGap=int(365*.9);/*new protocol changed to > 90% of days within 1 year before the entry date*/
%let coverageVar=cumuCoverGap; /*or MaxCoverGap*/
%let FollowUpEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;

/*For patients in data set _BF, from the master file with registry data, get health care entrollment, and gap periods within
    365 days prior to (exclusive) the studyStartDate.*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_phrs_cov.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_phrs_cov.sas7bdat)
);

%getCoverGAPs(
        rawfile=master_phrs_cov,
        ptFile=localt._BG,
        theCovXtrc=,
        start=%str(StudyStartDate-365),
        end= %str(StudyStartDate-1),
        target=_BH1,
        cohortgroup=,
    debug=1
);

/*_BH1 contains multiple records for each patient. The vars 'start' and 'end' indicate the whole look back period
    (i.e., studystartDate-365 to studyStartDate -1).The vars 'coverstart' and 'coverend' indicate each coverage/gap interval.
    (e.g., covered for an interval of 30 days, followed by a gap of 335 days).
*/


/*Option 1: if the requirment is to exclude patients with a cumulative gap of ?? days*/
/*sum days covered within the specified period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_BH1,
    target=_BH2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, sum(days) as days_covered),
    groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID)
);
/*from above, select patients satisfying the length of cumulative coverage*/
data _BH3;
    set _BH2;
    if days_covered ge &days_cover;
run;

/*link back to _BF, indicate those having full registry (not having a cumulative gap of ?? days)*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._BF,
    t2=_BH3,
    target=_BH4,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.&theStudyID ="", 1, 0) as cumuCoverGap),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

/*Option2: if the requirment is to exclude patients with a gap of ?? days*/
/*Get records with a gap greater than ?? days*/
Data _BH5;
    set _BH1;
    if gaps >= &Days_maxGap;
run;
/*link back to _BH4, indicate those having full registry (not having a gap > ?? days)*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_BH4,
    t2=_BH5,
    target=_BH6,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.&theStudyID ="", 0, 1) as MaxCoverGap),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

/*Option3: cumulatively covered for > 90% in 365 days prior the studystartdate
    AND,
    if not satisfied, shift the study start date in time until the condition is satisfied
*/
/*need to start from 1995, a year before the first study start date*/
%getCoverGAPs(
        rawfile=master_phrs_cov,
        ptFile=localt._BG,
        theCovXtrc=,
        start='01jan1995'd,
        end= '31mar2018'd,
        target=_BH11,
        cohortgroup=,
    debug=1
);

data _bh12;
    set _bh11;
/*    drop First_admin: cohort: age_first: sex src birth ;*/
    if days >0;
    drop start end coverPCT gapPCT days gaps ;
run;


data _BH13;
    set _bh12;
    by key_hsn coverstart coverend;
    format newIndex_date date9.;
    array covered_currentday[8491] _temporary_; /*it starts from covered_currentday[1], not covered_currentday[0]*/
    /*the temporary array values are automatically retained*/
    do i = 1 to 8491; /*8491 are days between '01jan1995' and '31mar2018'd, has to start from 1
                                    as for studyStartDate ='01jan1996', it'll need to caculate covering days since '01jan1995'*/
        if first.key_hsn then covered_currentday[i] =0;
        currentday = '31dec1994'd + i; /*between '01jan1996' and '31mar2018'd*/
        if covered_currentday[i] ne 1 then do; /*if the value is already 1 (covered), do not change it*/
            if coverstart                 covered_currentday[i]=1;
            end;    
        end;
        if currentday >= StudyStartDate then do; /*only starting to look back the cumulative covering days since the index_date*/
            sumcoverdays = 0;
            do j = i-365 to i-1;
                sumcoverdays=sumcoverdays + covered_currentday[j]; /*calculate the cumulative covering days within 365 days prior to the current day*/
            end;
            /*if the number cumulative covering days is greater than 90% of a year (365 days), the currentday is the earliest
                    date of the new index_date*/
            if sumcoverdays > &Days_maxGap then do;
                newIndex_date = currentday;
                leave;
            end;
        end;
    end;
    drop i j currentday sumcoverdays;
run;

data _BH14;
    set _BH13;
    by key_hsn coverstart coverend;
    if last.key_hsn;
    if newIndex_date ne .;
run;


data localt._B;
    set _BH14;
    drop StudyStartDate;
    rename newIndex_date= StudyStartDate;
    drop coverEnd coverstart;
run;


s///
t///

children.name: C StudyEnd
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*
CA Determine the date of the deceased
*/
data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
Determine the date of the deceased.
For individuals in data set _B, and according to the master mortality file, select individuals deceased between StudyStartDate,
and &FollowUpEndDate.
Create two varaibles, StudyEndDate, and ExitType.
Let StudyEndDate be the day of death. Let the ExitType be 'deceased'.
Save results in data set _CA.

For individuals in data set _B, and according to the master coverage file, select individuals who lost health insurance coverage (but not
    deceased) between StudyStartDate, and &FollowupEndDate. Lost of health insurance is defined as the date after which there is a gap
    of coverage for &Days_maxGap or more days. For patients with multiple gaps >= &Days_maxGap days, keep the first one.
Let StudyEndDate be the day right before the start date of the gap. Let the ExitType be 'emigration'.
Save results in data set _CB.

For patients in data set _B, indicate the StudyEndDate, and ExitType, according to data set _CA, and data set _CB.
For individuals not in data set _CA, and data set _CB, let StudyEndDate = the FollowUpEndDate, let ExitType = 'studyend'.
Save results in data set _CC.

From data set _CC, exclude those with with a StudyEndDate before the StudyStartDate.
Save results in _C.

[_Note]
    For coverage gaps within &Days_maxGap days prior to the FollowUpEndDate, there is no way to determine whether
    or not the real gap is less or more than &Days_maxGap days. In that case, the gaps will be treated as gaps < &Days_maxGap days.

    Data set _CC may contain individuals with a StudyEndDate before the StudyStartDate. This is because patients had a coverage gap
    of &Days_maxGap+ days right on the StudyStartDate. These patients should be excluded.


*/


%let theStudyID=key_hsn;
%let FollowUpEndDate='31Mar2018'd;
%let Days_maxGap = 90; /*changed to 90 days by the new proposal 2019-0628*/

/*CA0 unzip the mort file*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_verif_mort.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_verif_mort.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=master_verif_mort);*/
/*
_CA
For individuals in data set _B, and according to the master mortality file, select individuals deceased between StudyStartDate,
and &FollowUpEndDate.
Create two varaibles, StudyEndDate, and ExitType.
Let StudyEndDate be the day of death. Let the ExitType be 'deceased'.
Save results in data set _CA.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._B,
    t2=master_verif_mort,
    target=_CA,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t2.ddt_novit as StudyEndDate, 'deceased' as ExitType length=15),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=key_hsn,
    filters=%str(t2.ddt_novit ne . and t2.ddt_novit between t1.studystartdate and &FollowUpEndDate)
);


/*
_CB
For individuals in data set _B, and according to the master coverage file, select individuals who lost health insurance coverage (but not
    deceased) between StudyStartDate, and &FollowupEndDate. Lost of health insurance is defined as the date after which there is a gap
    of coverage for &Days_maxGap or more days. For patients with multiple gaps >= &Days_maxGap days, keep the first one.
Let StudyEndDate be the day right before the start date of the gap. Let the ExitType be 'emigration'.
Save results in data set _CB.

[_Note]
    For coverage gaps within &Days_maxGap days prior to the FollowUpEndDate, there is no way to determine whether
    or not the real gap is less or more than &Days_maxGap days. In that case, such gaps will be treated as gaps < &Days_maxGap days.
*/

/*CB0
unzip the master coverage file
*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_phrs_cov.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_phrs_cov.sas7bdat)
);

/*For patients in data set _B, from the master file with registry data, get health care entrollment, and gap periods between
    the studyStartDate, and &FollowUpEndDate.*/
%getCoverGAPs(
        rawfile=master_phrs_cov,
        ptFile=localt._B,
        theCovXtrc=,
        start=%str(StudyStartDate),
        end= &FollowUpEndDate,
        target=_CB1,
        cohortgroup=,
        debug=1
);

/*_CB1 contains multiple records for each patient. The vars 'start' and 'end' indicate the whole look back period
    (i.e., studystartDate to &FollowUpEndDate).The vars 'coverstart' and 'coverend' indicate each coverage/gap interval.
    (e.g., covered for an interval of 30 days, followed by a gap of 335 days).
*/
/*_CB2 Get records with a gap equal to or greater than &Days_maxGap days*/
Data _CB2;
    set _CB1;
    if gaps >= &Days_maxGap;
    keep &theStudyID coverstart coverEnd;
run;
/*_CB3, For the above records, the variable 'coverstart' is indeed the start date of gap >= &Days_maxGap.
    As a patient may have multiple gaps, and each gap is >= &Days_maxGap. The following is to sort by the start dates and
    keep the first record (i.e., the earliest gap of &Days_maxGap days or more)
*/
%sort(data=_CB2, sorter=&theStudyID coverstart);
data _CB3;
    set _CB2;
    by &theStudyID coverstart;
    if first.&theStudyID;
run;
/*_CB4. The above patients include those deceased. The following is to exclude the patient who deceased within the study period (in _CA)*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_CB3,
    target=_CB4,
    vars=%str(t1.*),
    filters=%str(&theStudyID not in (select &theStudyID from _CA))
);

/*_CB5. For the above patients, the last date of coverage is the date right before the coverstart (indeed the gap start date).*/
data _CB;
    set _CB4;
    format StudyEndDate date9. ExitType $15. ;
    StudyEndDate = coverstart-1;
    ExitType='emigration';
    drop coverstart coverEnd;
run;

/*_CC
For patients in data set _B, indicate the StudyEndDate, and ExitType, according to data set _CA, and data set _CB.
For individuals not in data set _CA, and data set _CB, let StudyEndDate = the FollowUpEndDate, let ExitType = 'studyend'.
Save results in data set _CC.
*/

/*_CC1. Combine _CA and _CB. */
data _CC1;
    format ExitType $15.;
    set _CA _CB;
run;
/*_CC2. Line the above to _B. For those not in _CC1, let StudyEndDate = the FollowUpEndDate, let ExitType = 'studyend'*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._B,
    t2=_CC1,
    target=_CC2,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.StudyEndDate, t2.ExitType length =15 ),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);
data _CC;
    set _CC2;
    if StudyEndDate=. then StudyEndDate = &FollowUpEndDate;
    if ExitType="" then ExitType = 'studyend';
run;

/*_CD.
From data set _CC, exclude those with with a StudyEndDate before the StudyStartDate.
Save results in _C.
[_Note]
Data set _CC may contain individuals with a StudyEndDate before the StudyStartDate. This is because patients had a coverage gap
    of &Days_maxGap+ days right on the StudyStartDate. These patients should be excluded.
*/
Data localt._C;
    set _CC;
    if not (StudyEndDate < StudyStartDate);
run;

s///
t///

children.name: D Exposure Segments
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*_D. Exposure segments*/
data _null_;run;


/**/
/*proc import datafile="&sampleRx"*/
/*    DBMS=excel*/
/*    out=tmp*/
/*    replace*/
/*    ;*/
/*getnames=yes;*/
/*sheet="sheet1";*/
/*run;*/
/*data sampleRx;*/
/*        format &theStudyID $11. */
/*                StudyStartDate date9. */
/*                StudyEndDate date9. */
/*                DIN $8.*/
/*                &theServeDate date9.*/
/*                Class $20. */
/*                Generation $20.*/
/*                Description $100.; */
/*    set tmp;*/
/*    StudyStartDate ='01Jan1996'd;*/
/*    StudyEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;*/
/*    supplydays=30;*/
/*Run;*/

%let theStudyID=Key_hsn;
%let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
%let inclusionStartDate= '01jan1996'd;
%let inclusionEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;

/*_DA0. Unzip the benefit and nonbenefit drug claims*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_benefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_benefit.sas7bdat)
);

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_nonbenefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_nonbenefit.sas7bdat)
);
/*get the MS drug claims*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_dp_benefit,
    t2=localT.a6_dindx,
    target=_DA0a,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t2.*, 'dp' || strip(put(monotonic(), 20.)) format $22. as RxOBS),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=DIN,
    filters=%str(&theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate),
    orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t1.DIN)
);
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_dp_nonbenefit,
    t2=localT.a6_dindx,
    target=_DA0b,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t2.*, 'nb' || strip(put(monotonic(), 20.)) format $22. as RxOBS),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=DIN,
    filters=%str(&theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate),
    orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t1.DIN)
);
data _DA0c;
    set _DA0a _DA0b;
run;

/*from above, select claims within study period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    t2=_DA0c,
    target=_DA,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.studyStartDate, t1.studyEndDate, t2.*),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.&theServeDate between t1.StudyStartDate and t1.StudyEndDate)
);
%print(data=_DA);


/*_DB Determine the supply days.
    For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation, except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.    
*/

/*Comments added on 2019-08-12:

Based on the word file:
"If multiple dispensations (i.e. same DINs or different DINs but same drug class) on the same day, the 30-day supply for
each dispensation will be added up. "
[1]------ for drugclaims on the same day, multiple the # of claims by 30 days to have new days' supply

From the mail from Huah Shin on 2019-08-09:

(1)If there is an overlap between the same drugs, we dont consider the overlap period.
For example, in your first slide.
IFNB dispensed on 1-Jan-2000 for 30 days then the next IFNB dispensed on 20-Jan-2000 for 30days. There was an overlap of 11 days between the first and second supply.
The exposure duration will be calculated from 1-Jan-2000 to 19-Jan-2000 (i.e. 19 days) then 20-Jan-2000+30 days = total of 49 days

If there is an overlap between the different drug, we also dont consider the overlap period. We assume the first drug was stopped before the second drug was started.
IFNB dispensed on 1-Jan-2000 for 30days then switch to glatiramer on 20-Jan-2000 for 30 days.
The exposure duration for IFNB will be calculated from 1-Jan-2000 to 19-Jan-2000 (i.e. total 19 days);
then glatriamer will be calculated from 20-Jan-2000 + 30days = 30 days.


Summary of the exposure period 2nd slide (in case my explanation just now wasnt clear enough):
(2) For the second slides:
There is a small gap (as long as its < 90 days), we consider the drug as being continued.
IFNB dispensed on 1-Jan-2000 for 30 days. A small gap here before the next IFNB dispensed on 1-Mar-2000 for 30 days. There are no further supply of IFNB for the subsequent 90 days.
The exposure duration for IFNB will be calculated from 1-Jan-2000 to 1-Mar-2000 + 30 days supply + 30 days grace-period.

We defined the discontinuation as being >=90days between the gap. The grace-period is only added to the last supply of the drug.

------ Overlapping claims truncate the previous supply period
------ grace only add at the end of a connected period
------ all periods (depending on definitions, e.g., by class, by generation, any) with a gap < 90 days
            are considered continuously exposed
------ period is specific for different definition (e.g., by class, by generation, any).
            
*** in addition, there were medication claims prior to the index date, therefore the calculation should be started as early as possible
------ include all MS DMT claims as early as we have.
*/

/*from above, select ALL claims as early as we have, adding the study start dates

*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    t2=_DA0c,
    target=_DA,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.studyStartDate, t1.studyEndDate, t2.*),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);
%print(data=_DA);

/*Note: the DMT claims are NOT earlier than 01Jan1996 (in fact the earliest is 02Dec1997)*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_DA,
    target=test,
    vars=min(rx_ddddd) format date9. as min
);



/*_DB Determine the supply days.
    For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation, except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.    
*/
/*_DB1,
For records in data set _DA, add a variable 'SupplyDays'. For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation,
except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.
[Note:] For Alemtuzumab, it is tricky. Patients may have up to 10 dispensations on the same day, or multiple dispensations
within a few consecutive days after the first dispensation.
"(a)Alemtuzumab: as 1 year drug exposure (the numbers of supply may vary from 1 to 5 supplies within one year period.
Regardless of the numbers of supply an individual receives within the one year period,
it will be calculated as 1 year drug exposure from the date of 1st supply of the year)."

Hypothetically, a patient may receive 2 dispensations daily between 01jan2001 to 04jan2001, and then refilled
    within 01dec2001 and 04dec2001
Note 01jan2001 and 01dec2001 (the two starting dates) are within one year, but obviously for two annual administrations

It seems that Alemtuzumab, and Ocrelizumab should be treated separately from the other DMT claims.
1) check the gaps between claims (so as to determine the length of a gap that are good enough to split the two annual admissions)
or
        index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'ocrelizumab') ne 0;
*/
data _DB1a1;
    set _DA;
    if index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'alemtuzumab') ne 0 ;
    keep &theStudyID Class_short Generation_short DIN &theServeDate StudyStartDate StudyEndDate DIN ;
run;
%sort(data=_DB1a1, sorter=&theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate);
/*get the gaps between 2 dispensations*/
data _DB1a2;
    set _DB1a1;
    lagRxDate = lag(Rx_ddddd);
    by &theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate;
    if first.key_hsn then lagRxDate=Rx_ddddd;
    gap=Rx_ddddd - lagRxDate;
run;
/*distribution*/
Proc univariate data = _DB1a2;
    histogram gap /normal;
run;
%freq(data=_DB1a2, table=gap);
/*It shows that if the gap between 2 dispensations were polarized between 0 to 4, and 328 to 399
As such, if a gap is beyond 180 days, it'll be fills for another year
*/
data _DB1a3;
    set _DB1a2;
    by &theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate;
    if first.key_hsn then periodN=1;
    else do;
        if gap > 180 then periodN +1;
    end;
run;
data _DB1a;
    set _DB1a3;
    by &theStudyID periodN;
    if first.periodN;
    SupplyDays=365;
    drop lagRxDate gap periodN;
run;

/*should apply the similar approach to Ocrelizumab. It is just that there is no Ocrelizumab claims within the study period*/
data _DB1b;
    set _DA;
    if index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'ocrelizumab') ne 0 ;
    keep &theStudyID Class_short Generation_short DIN &theServeDate StudyStartDate StudyEndDate DIN ;
run;

/*For the rest of the claims:
Handle the first point [1]
------ for drugclaims on the same day, multiply the # of claims by 30 days to have new days' supply
*/
/*a. sort data by patient id, class, and service date*/
data _DB1c1;
    set _DA;
    if index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'alemtuzumab') = 0 and index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'ocrelizumab') =0 ;
    keep &theStudyID Class_short Generation_short DIN &theServeDate StudyStartDate StudyEndDate DIN ;
run;
%sort(data=_DB1c1, sorter=&theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate);
/*b. add a number to count the same-day claims of the same class*/
data _DB1c2;
    set _DB1c1;
    lastRxDate = lag(&theServeDate);
    by &theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        lastRxDate=&theServeDate;
        nRx=1;
    end;
    else do;
        if     lastRxDate = &theServeDate then nRx +1;
        else nRx=1;
    end;
run;



                    /*the max nRx?*/
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=_DB1c2,
                        target=test,
                        vars=max(nRx) as max
                    );
                    /*10? really?*/
                    data test2;
                        set _DB1c2;
                        if nRx>5;
                    run;
                    %sqljoinv2(
                        t1=_DB1c2,
                        t2=test2,
                        target=test3,
                        vars=%str(t1.*),
                        jtype=inner,
                        jvars=&theStudyID
                    );
                    /*there are yet patients with 5-10 claims on the same day...*/

data _DB1c;
    set _DB1c2;
    by &theStudyID Class_short &theServeDate;
    if last.&theServeDate;
    SupplyDays = 30* nRx;
    drop lastRxDate nRx;
run;
%freq(data=_DB1c,table=Class_short * SupplyDays);

/*Putting together*/
data _DB1;
    set _DB1a _DB1b _DB1c;
    drop din; /*the DIN is kind of misleading
                    if there are multiple claims of the same class on the same date, the DIN is of the medication
                    of the LAST claim. DINS of other same-date claims have been ignored in previous steps
                    As such, the column DIN is removed so as to avoid misleading*/
run;

/*Now that all exceptions have been treated.
    The next step is to clean up the overlaps,
1. indicate the gaps (90 days?), and redefine the interval stop
    (extend if a gap < 90 or add grace period if a gap >=90)
    also, if the gap between the last claim and the study end date is < 90, extend the stop to the studyenddate
     (this should be done before adjusted for others. avoid adjusting for multiple times)
2. cleaning overlap, i.e., adjust the stop date to be at least 1 day earlier then the next claim (lagstartdate).
(what if there were 2 claims of diff classes on the same day: (what if there were 2 claims of diff classes on the same day: see step 4)
3. further truncate the interval end if it exceed the follow up end date
4. If there were multipe claims with the same adjusted start dates, take the one with the longest exposure period
*/

/*1. indicate the gaps (90 days?), and redefine the interval stop
    (extend if a gap < 90 or add grace period if a gap >=90) */

/*add the interval end according to the days of supply*/
data _Db2a;
    set _DB1;
    start=Rx_ddddd;
    stop = Rx_ddddd + SupplyDays -1;
    format start date9. stop date9.;
run;
/*determine the gaps between two consecutive claims*/
%sort(data=_Db2a, sorter=%str(&theStudyID descending start descending stop));
data _Db2b;
    set _Db2a;
    lagstart=lag(start);
    by &theStudyID descending start descending stop;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        lagstart = start;
        gap=StudyEndDate - stop -1;
    end;
    else do;
        gap = lagstart - stop -1;
    end;
    format lagstart date9.;
run;
/*if a gap is between 0 and 89, extend the stop date by + 89 days
    if a gap is 90 or more, add a grace period by + 30 days
    [Comment]
        There might be a potential problem here. Is it fair that
            - for a gap within 90 days, add 89 days (treat as continuously covered)
            - for a gap of 90 days and beyond, add 30 days (grace period)
    hypothetically:
    patient A: 01jan2001, 01Apr2001 (90 days apart)
        the exposed periods are:
        01jan2001 to 02Mar2001 30 days of supply + 30 days grace period
            unexposed period: 03Mar2001 to 31Mar2001
        01Apr2001 to 31May2001 (30 days supply + 30 days grace period)
    patient B: 01jan2001, 31Mar2001 (89 days apart)
        the exposed period is 01jan2001 to 30apr2001 (nogaps + 30 grace period)
*/
data _db2c;
    set _db2b;
    adj_stop=stop;
    if 0 <= gap < 90 then do;
        adj_stop = stop + 89;
    end;
    else do;
        if gap ge 90 then do;
            adj_stop = stop + 30;
        end;
    end;
    format adj_stop date9.;
run;

/* 2. cleaning overlap, i.e., adjust the stop date to be at least 1 day earlier then the next claim (lagstartdate).
(what if there were 2 claims of diff classes on the same day: see step 4)
*/
data _db2d;
    set _db2c;
    by &theStudyID descending start descending stop;
    if not first.&theStudyID then do; /*the first record should not be changed*/
        if adj_stop >= lagStart then do;
            adj_stop = lagStart -1;
        end;
    end;
run;

/*3. further truncation:
    remove periods stopped before the studystart date, and those started after the studyenddate
    if the interval start is earlier than the studystart date, let the interval start = the studystartDate
    if the interval stop is later than the studyenddate, let the interval stop = the studyenddate*/
data _db2e;
    set _db2d;
    adj_start=start;
    format adj_start date9.;
    if adj_stop < studystartdate then delete;
    if start > studyenddate then delete;
    if start < studystartdate then adj_start = studystartdate;
    if adj_stop > studyenddate then adj_stop = studyenddate;
    drop start stop lagstart gap;
run;

/*4. If there were multiple claims with the same adjusted start dates, take the one with the longest exposure period*/
%sort(data=_db2e, sorter=%str(&theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop));
data _db2;
    retain
    key_hsn
    StudyStartDate
    StudyEndDate
    RX_DDDDD
    Class_Short
    Generation_short
    SupplyDays
    adj_start
    adj_stop
    ;
    set _db2e;
    by &theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;
    if first.adj_start;
run;

/*Next is to insert unexposed periods between:
    1. studystartdate and the first claim,
    2. the last claim and the studyenddate
    3. two claims with gaps
*/
/*1. insert unexposed periods between: studystartdate and the first claim*/
%sort(data=_db2, sorter=%str(&theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop));
data _db3a;
    set _db2;
/*    if key_hsn = '06335354647';*/
    by &theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;
    output;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        /*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studyenddate and the stop of current claim (which is the last within the study period)*/
        if adj_stop < studyEndDate then do;
            adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/
            adj_stop = studyEndDate;
            Rx_ddddd =.;
            Class_short ='null';
            generation_short='null';
            supplydays=.;
            exposure_status='t';
            output;
        end;
    end;
run;
/*2. insert unexposed periods between: the last claim and the studyenddate*/
%sort(data=_db3a, sorter=%str(&theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop));
data _db3b;
    set _db3a;
    by &theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;
    output;
    if last.&theStudyID then do;
        /*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studystartdate and the start of current claim (which is the first within the study period)*/
        if adj_start > studyStartDate then do;
            adj_stop = adj_start -1; /*calculate adj_stop first, as the adj_start value will be changed*/
            adj_start = studyStartDate;
            Rx_ddddd =.;
            Class_short ='null';
            generation_short='null';
            supplydays=.;
            exposure_status='h';
            output;
        end;
    end;
run;

/*3. inseart an unexposed period between two claims with gaps*/
%sort(data=_db3b, sorter=%str(&theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop));
data _db3c;
    set _db3b;
    lagAdjSart = lag(adj_start);
    by &theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        lagAdjSart = adj_start;
        output;
    end;
    else do;
        output;
        /*if there is a gap between adj_stop and the next claim's adj start (preAdjStart)
            insert an unexposed period*/
        if lagAdjSart -adj_stop > 1 then do;
            adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/
            adj_stop = lagAdjSart -1;
            Rx_ddddd =.;
            Class_short ='null';
            generation_short='null';
            supplydays=.;
            exposure_status='u';
            output;            
        end;
        lagAdjSart=adj_start;
    end;
    format lagAdjSart date9.;
run;

%sort(data=_db3c, sorter=%str(&theStudyID adj_start adj_stop));

data _db3;
    set _db3c;
    drop SupplyDays rx_ddddd lagAdjSart;
run;

/*to this step, those ever had a DMT within study period are captured in _db3
    However, there are patient not exposed to any DMT at all
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    distinct=1,
    target=_db4a,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate, t1.StudyEndDate),
    filters=%str(t1.&theStudyID not in (select &theStudyID from _db3))
);

data _db4b;
    set _db4a;
    class_short='null';
    generation_short='null';
    adj_start=studyStartDate;
    adj_stop=studyEndDate;
    format adj_start date9. adj_stop date9.;
    exposure_status='w';
run;

data _db4;
    set _db3 _db4b;
    if exposure_status = '' then exposure_status='d';
run;
%sort(data=_db4, sorter=%str(&theStudyID adj_start adj_stop));
/*concatenate the exposure periods
    Note: such concatenate is specific by any DMT, same class, and same generation, respectively
*/

/*Intervals exposed/unexposed to Any DMT*/
%sort(data=_db4, sorter=%str(&theStudyID adj_start adj_stop));
data _db5a;
    set _db4;
    lag_exposure_status=lag(exposure_status);
    retain extend_adj_start;
    by &theStudyID adj_start adj_stop;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        extend_adj_start = adj_start;
        lag_exposure_status=exposure_status;
        NSeg = 1;
    end;
    else do;
        if exposure_status = 'd' and lag_exposure_status ne 'd'
            or
            exposure_status ne 'd' and lag_exposure_status = 'd'
            then do;
            NSeg +1;
            extend_adj_start=adj_start;
        end;
    end;
