    format extend_adj_start date9.;
run;

%sort(data=_db5a, sorter=%str(&theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop));
data _db5;
    retain &theStudyID studyStartDate studyEndDate NSeg exposure_status extend_adj_start adj_stop;
    set _db5a;
    by &theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop;
    if last.extend_adj_start;
    drop adj_start Class_Short Generation_short lag_exposure_status;
    rename extend_adj_start = segStartDate adj_stop = segEndDate;
    format exposeGroup $10.;
    exposeGroup = 'any';
run;


/*Intervals exposed/unexposed to a class of DMTs*/
%sort(data=_db4, sorter=%str(&theStudyID adj_start adj_stop));
data _db6a;
    set _db4;
    lag_exposure_status=lag(exposure_status);
    lag_class=lag(class_short);
    retain extend_adj_start;
    by &theStudyID adj_start adj_stop;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        extend_adj_start = adj_start;
        lag_exposure_status=exposure_status;
        lag_class=class_short;
        NSeg = 1;
    end;
    else do;
        if exposure_status = 'd' and lag_exposure_status ne 'd'
            or
            exposure_status ne 'd' and lag_exposure_status = 'd'
            or
            class_short ne lag_class
            then do;
            NSeg +1;
            extend_adj_start=adj_start;
        end;
    end;
    format extend_adj_start date9.;
run;

%sort(data=_db6a, sorter=%str(&theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop));
data _db6;
    retain &theStudyID studyStartDate studyEndDate NSeg exposure_status extend_adj_start adj_stop class_short;
    set _db6a;
    by &theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop;
    if last.extend_adj_start;
    drop adj_start lag_exposure_status lag_class;
    rename extend_adj_start = segStartDate adj_stop = segEndDate;
    format exposeGroup $10.;
    exposeGroup = 'class';
run;


/*Intervals exposed/unexposed to a class of DMTs*/
%sort(data=_db4, sorter=%str(&theStudyID adj_start adj_stop));
data _db7a;
    set _db4;
    lag_exposure_status=lag(exposure_status);
    lag_generation=lag(generation_short);
    retain extend_adj_start;
    by &theStudyID adj_start adj_stop;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        extend_adj_start = adj_start;
        lag_exposure_status=exposure_status;
        lag_generation=generation_short;
        NSeg = 1;
    end;
    else do;
        if exposure_status = 'd' and lag_exposure_status ne 'd'
            or
            exposure_status ne 'd' and lag_exposure_status = 'd'
            or
            generation_short ne lag_generation
            then do;
            NSeg +1;
            extend_adj_start=adj_start;
        end;
    end;
    format extend_adj_start date9.;
run;

%sort(data=_db7a, sorter=%str(&theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop));
data _db7;
    retain &theStudyID studyStartDate studyEndDate NSeg exposure_status extend_adj_start adj_stop generation_short;
    set _db7a;
    by &theStudyID extend_adj_start adj_stop;
    if last.extend_adj_start;
    drop adj_start class_short lag_exposure_status lag_generation;
    rename extend_adj_start = segStartDate adj_stop = segEndDate;
    format exposeGroup $10.;
    exposeGroup = 'generation';
run;


data _db8;
    set _db5 _db6 _db7;
run;

/*Note: the dataset _D contains periods of three different exposure settings
    in the future, only one exposure setting should be used to account for baseline and statistics
*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    t2=_DB8,
    target=_D,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=_D.zip,
    srcFile=_D.sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

%beep;



s///
t///

children.name: E_any_ Outcome
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*E. Measuring outcome, i.e., number of encounters with phycisians*/
data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
_EA,
For patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
Save results in data set _EA.
_EB.
For service records in data set _EA, exclude those falling into the following criteria:
1) visiting a neurologist, i.e., with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK').
[_Note]
These codes are specific for SK database. CK = paediatrics neurology; DK = internal medicine neurology; .
2) visiting a doctor for pregnancy, i.e., with a &DiagICDCol value in (ICD-10 codes: O00-O08, O10-O16, O20-O29, O30-O48, O60-O75, O80-O84, O85-O92, O94-O99, Z32-Z39;
ICD-9 codes: 630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39; or BC specific codes: 07A, 08A, 17B, 19B, 20B, 30B, 31B, 32B, 33B, 34B, 35B, 36B, 37B, 38B ).
[_Note] In SK physician service file, there is only one field with 3-digit ICD-9 codes.
Save results in data set _EB.
_EC
For records in data set _EB, determine the specialty categories according to the categories defined in (appendix ??).
Save results in data set _EC.
[_Note] A mapping file 'SPECMAP' has been prepared by the program 'SPECMapping'. It is specifically for SK data.
_ED
For records in _EC, get encounters, which are defined as distince records by patient id, diagnosis code, date of service, and physician ID.
Create a variable for unique order numbers of encounters ('EncounterID').
Save results in data set _ED.
_EE
With data in data set &DData, and data set _ED, count number of encounters per period.
_EF.
Link period-specific countings of total and specialty-specific number of encounters to records in data set &DData.
Save results in data set _E.
[_Note] Data set _EE only contains periods with encounters. For periods in &DData that not having encounters, let N_Encounters=0.
*/

%let theStudyID=KEY_HSN;
%let DiagICDCol= diag;
%let DocServeDate = dos;
%let theDOCID = key_doc_num;

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\_D.zip),
    srcFile=%str(_D.sas7bdat)
);

/*Note: the dataset _D contains periods of three different exposure settings
    in the future, only one exposure setting should be used to account for baseline and statistics
*/
%let DData=_E0;
%let ETarget=_E_any;
data &DData;
    set _D;
    if exposegroup='any';
run;

/*%print(data=&DData);*/
/*_EA,
For patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
Save results in data set _EA.*/
/*EA0, unzip the raw file*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_msb.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_msb.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=master_msb);*/
/*EA1.
for patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_msb,
    t2=localt._c,
    target=_EA,
    vars=t1.*,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(&DocServeDate between studyStartDate and studyEndDate)
);

/*_EB.
For service records in data set _EA, exclude those falling into the following criteria:
1) visiting a neurologist, i.e., with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK').
[_Note]
These codes are specific for SK database. CK = paediatrics neurology; DK = internal medicine neurology.
2) visiting a doctor for pregnancy, i.e., with a DIAG value in (ICD-10 codes: O00-O08, O10-O16, O20-O29, O30-O48, O60-O75, O80-O84, O85-O92, O94-O99, Z32-Z39;
ICD-9 codes: 630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39; or BC specific codes: 07A, 08A, 17B, 19B, 20B, 30B, 31B, 32B, 33B, 34B, 35B, 36B, 37B, 38B ).
[_Note] In SK physician service file, there is only one field with 3-digit ICD-9 codes.
Save results in data set _EB.
*/

/*_EB1, from data set _EA, remove records with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK'). If the SPEC value is missing, let SPEC = '_'
    also remove those with a SPEC indicated to exclude in
    P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\Copy of SPECGrouping.xlsx
*/
data _EB1;
    set _EA;
    if SPEC not in ('CB', 'CB', 'CC', 'CD', 'CB', 'CF', 'CG', 'CH', 'CB', 'CK', 'CL', 'CB', 'CB', 'CR', 'CB', 'DK', 'WB', 'WC', 'WE', 'WD', 'WF', 'WM', 'WP');
    if SPEC ne "" ;
run;

/*_EB, from data set _EB1, remove records with a diagnostic code in (630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39).
*/
data _EB;
    set _EB1;
    if not(
        '630' <= &DiagICDCol <= '679'
        or
        'V22' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V24'
        or
        'V27' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V28'
        or
        'V30' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V39'
    );
run;
/*%freq(data=_EB2, table=&DiagICDCol);*/

/*_EC
For records in data set _EB, determine the specialty categories according to the categories defined in (appendix ??).
Save results in data set _EC.
[_Note] A mapping file 'SPECMAP' has been prepared by the program 'SPECMapping'. It is specifically for SK data.
*/
/*_EC1, link data set _EB to data set SPECMAP, add the variable 'SPECCAT" from the data set SPECMAP*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_EB,
    t2=localD.SpecMap,
    target=_EC,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.SPECCat),
    jtype=left,
    jterm= %str(strip(t1.SPEC) = strip(t2.SPEC))
);
/*test:
    In _EC, none of SPECCat value should be missing
    data test;
        set _EC;
        if SPECCat="";
    run;
    confirmed, none is missing value of SPECCat.
*/

/*_ED
For records in _EC, get encounters, which are defined as distince records by patient id, diagnosis code, date of service, and physician ID.
Create a variable for unique order numbers of encounters ('EncounterID').
Save results in data set _ED.
*/
%distinct(
    data=_EC,
    target=_ED1,
    vars=%str(&theStudyID, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, &theDOCID, SPECCat),
    orderby=%str(&theStudyID, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, &theDOCID, SPECCat)
);
/*
[_Note]
It could be that there are two records of the same patient, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, and doc ID, but of different SPECcat.
    The following is to select the first record of such kind.
*/
Data _ED;
    set _ED1;
    by &theStudyID &DiagICDCol &DocServeDate &theDOCID SPECCat;
    if first.&theDOCID;
    EncounterID=_n_;
run;


/*_EE
With data in data set &DData, and data set _ED, count number of encounters per period.
*/
/*_EE1
Join data set &DData, and data set _ED,
*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1= &DData,
    t2=_ED,
    target=_EE1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t2.EncounterID, t2.SpecCat),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.&DocServeDate between t1.SegStartDate and t1.SegEndDate)
);

                /*test: the EncounterID should not be repeated in _EE
                    %distinct(data=_EE, target=test, vars=EncounterID);
                    Confirmed. Both _EE and test have the same number of observations.
                */
/*_EE2, count total number of encounters (i.e., EncounterID) by each period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE1,
    target=_EE2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, count(t1.EncounterID) as N_Encounters_Total),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate)
);
/*_EE3, count number of encounters by each specialty category, and each period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE1,
    target=_EE3a,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate,
                    'N_Encounters_' || scan(SpecCat, 1, "__") format $20. as SpecCat_Short,
                        count(t1.EncounterID) as N_Encounters
                ),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate,SpecCat_Short),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, SpecCat_Short)
);

/*[Note]:there is a problem here that some category like 'NUS__Neurosurgeon' did not appear in any claims.
    The counting above does not contain countings for the NUS category. It'll be missing
*/

/*have a distinct list of specialty categories, and rename it following the same rules as in _EE3a*/
%distinct(data = localD.SpecMap, vars=%str('N_Encounters_' || scan(SpecCat, 1, "__") as SpecCat_Short length=20), target=_EE3b);

/*also to create a list of distinct patient-segstart-segend*/
%distinct(data=&DData, vars=%str(&theStudyID, SegStartDate, SegEndDate), target=_EE3c);

/*create a cross join table to have complete combination of patient, segments, and specialties*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE3b,
    t2=_EE3c,
    target=_EE3d,
    vars=*,
    jtype=cross
);

/*left join the above _EE3a (MSB claims) and _EE3D (patient, seg, and spec), to having N encounters by a complete list of specialities in SpecCat_Short*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE3d,
    t2=_EE3a,
    target=_EE3e,
    vars=%str(
                        t1.SpecCat_Short,
                        t1.&theStudyID,
                        t1.SegStartDate,
                        t1.SegEndDate,
                        ifn(t2.N_Encounters =., 0, t2.N_Encounters) as N_Encounters
                ),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate SpecCat_Short,
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t1.SpecCat_Short),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t1.SpecCat_Short)
);



/* Transpose to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_EE3e,
    target=_EE3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate,
    colhead = SpecCat_short,
    contents=N_Encounters
);

/*_EF.
Link period-specific countings of total and specialty-specific number of encounters to records in data set &DData.
Save results in data set _E.
[_Note] Data set _EE only contains periods with encounters. For periods in &DData that not having encounters, let N_Encounters=0.
*/

    t1=&DData,

);

%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_EF1,
    t2=_EE3,
    target=_EF2,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);
/*Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data &ETarget;
    set _EF2;

    do i = 1 to dim(NENCNTS);

    end;

    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=&Etarget..zip,
    srcFile=&ETarget..sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

children.name: E_Generation_ Outcome
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*E. Measuring outcome, i.e., number of encounters with phycisians*/
data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
_EA,
For patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
Save results in data set _EA.
_EB.
For service records in data set _EA, exclude those falling into the following criteria:
1) visiting a neurologist, i.e., with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK').
[_Note]
These codes are specific for SK database. CK = paediatrics neurology; DK = internal medicine neurology; .
2) visiting a doctor for pregnancy, i.e., with a &DiagICDCol value in (ICD-10 codes: O00-O08, O10-O16, O20-O29, O30-O48, O60-O75, O80-O84, O85-O92, O94-O99, Z32-Z39;
ICD-9 codes: 630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39; or BC specific codes: 07A, 08A, 17B, 19B, 20B, 30B, 31B, 32B, 33B, 34B, 35B, 36B, 37B, 38B ).
[_Note] In SK physician service file, there is only one field with 3-digit ICD-9 codes.
Save results in data set _EB.
_EC
For records in data set _EB, determine the specialty categories according to the categories defined in (appendix ??).
Save results in data set _EC.
[_Note] A mapping file 'SPECMAP' has been prepared by the program 'SPECMapping'. It is specifically for SK data.
_ED
For records in _EC, get encounters, which are defined as distince records by patient id, diagnosis code, date of service, and physician ID.
Create a variable for unique order numbers of encounters ('EncounterID').
Save results in data set _ED.
_EE
With data in data set &DData, and data set _ED, count number of encounters per period.
_EF.
Link period-specific countings of total and specialty-specific number of encounters to records in data set &DData.
Save results in data set _E.
[_Note] Data set _EE only contains periods with encounters. For periods in &DData that not having encounters, let N_Encounters=0.
*/

%let theStudyID=KEY_HSN;
%let DiagICDCol= diag;
%let DocServeDate = dos;
%let theDOCID = key_doc_num;

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\_D.zip),
    srcFile=%str(_D.sas7bdat)
);

/*Note: the dataset _D contains periods of three different exposure settings
    in the future, only one exposure setting should be used to account for baseline and statistics
*/
%let DData=_E0;
%let ETarget=_E_Generation;
data &DData;
    set _D;
    if exposegroup='generation';
run;

/*%print(data=&DData);*/
/*_EA,
For patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
Save results in data set _EA.*/
/*EA0, unzip the raw file*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_msb.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_msb.sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=master_msb);*/
/*EA1.
for patients in _C, get all physician visits from the raw physician service file between the studystartdate and studyenddate.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_msb,
    t2=localt._c,
    target=_EA,
    vars=t1.*,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(&DocServeDate between studyStartDate and studyEndDate)
);

/*_EB.
For service records in data set _EA, exclude those falling into the following criteria:
1) visiting a neurologist, i.e., with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK').
[_Note]
These codes are specific for SK database. CK = paediatrics neurology; DK = internal medicine neurology.
2) visiting a doctor for pregnancy, i.e., with a DIAG value in (ICD-10 codes: O00-O08, O10-O16, O20-O29, O30-O48, O60-O75, O80-O84, O85-O92, O94-O99, Z32-Z39;
ICD-9 codes: 630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39; or BC specific codes: 07A, 08A, 17B, 19B, 20B, 30B, 31B, 32B, 33B, 34B, 35B, 36B, 37B, 38B ).
[_Note] In SK physician service file, there is only one field with 3-digit ICD-9 codes.
Save results in data set _EB.
*/

/*_EB1, from data set _EA, remove records with a specialty in ('CK', 'DK'). If the SPEC value is missing, let SPEC = '_'
    also remove those with a SPEC indicated to exclude in
    P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\Copy of SPECGrouping.xlsx
*/
data _EB1;
    set _EA;
    if SPEC not in ('CB', 'CB', 'CC', 'CD', 'CB', 'CF', 'CG', 'CH', 'CB', 'CK', 'CL', 'CB', 'CB', 'CR', 'CB', 'DK', 'WB', 'WC', 'WE', 'WD', 'WF', 'WM', 'WP');
    if SPEC ne "" ;
run;

/*_EB, from data set _EB1, remove records with a diagnostic code in (630679, V22-V24, V27-V28, V30-V39).
*/
data _EB;
    set _EB1;
    if not(
        '630' <= &DiagICDCol <= '679'
        or
        'V22' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V24'
        or
        'V27' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V28'
        or
        'V30' <= &DiagICDCol <= 'V39'
    );
run;
/*%freq(data=_EB2, table=&DiagICDCol);*/

/*_EC
For records in data set _EB, determine the specialty categories according to the categories defined in (appendix ??).
Save results in data set _EC.
[_Note] A mapping file 'SPECMAP' has been prepared by the program 'SPECMapping'. It is specifically for SK data.
*/
/*_EC1, link data set _EB to data set SPECMAP, add the variable 'SPECCAT" from the data set SPECMAP*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_EB,
    t2=localD.SpecMap,
    target=_EC,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.SPECCat),
    jtype=left,
    jterm= %str(strip(t1.SPEC) = strip(t2.SPEC))
);
/*test:
    In _EC, none of SPECCat value should be missing
    data test;
        set _EC;
        if SPECCat="";
    run;
    confirmed, none is missing value of SPECCat.
*/

/*_ED
For records in _EC, get encounters, which are defined as distince records by patient id, diagnosis code, date of service, and physician ID.
Create a variable for unique order numbers of encounters ('EncounterID').
Save results in data set _ED.
*/
%distinct(
    data=_EC,
    target=_ED1,
    vars=%str(&theStudyID, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, &theDOCID, SPECCat),
    orderby=%str(&theStudyID, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, &theDOCID, SPECCat)
);
/*
[_Note]
It could be that there are two records of the same patient, &DiagICDCol, &DocServeDate, and doc ID, but of different SPECcat.
    The following is to select the first record of such kind.
*/
Data _ED;
    set _ED1;
    by &theStudyID &DiagICDCol &DocServeDate &theDOCID SPECCat;
    if first.&theDOCID;
    EncounterID=_n_;
run;


/*_EE
With data in data set &DData, and data set _ED, count number of encounters per period.
*/
/*_EE1
Join data set &DData, and data set _ED,
*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1= &DData,
    t2=_ED,
    target=_EE1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t2.EncounterID, t2.SpecCat),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.&DocServeDate between t1.SegStartDate and t1.SegEndDate)
);

                /*test: the EncounterID should not be repeated in _EE
                    %distinct(data=_EE, target=test, vars=EncounterID);
                    Confirmed. Both _EE and test have the same number of observations.
                */
/*_EE2, count total number of encounters (i.e., EncounterID) by each period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE1,
    target=_EE2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, count(t1.EncounterID) as N_Encounters_Total),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate)
);
/*_EE3, count number of encounters by each specialty category, and each period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE1,
    target=_EE3a,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate,
                    'N_Encounters_' || scan(SpecCat, 1, "__") format $20. as SpecCat_Short,
                        count(t1.EncounterID) as N_Encounters
                ),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate,SpecCat_Short),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, SpecCat_Short)
);

/*[Note]:there is a problem here that some category like 'NUS__Neurosurgeon' did not appear in any claims.
    The counting above does not contain countings for the NUS category. It'll be missing
*/

/*have a distinct list of specialty categories, and rename it following the same rules as in _EE3a*/
%distinct(data = localD.SpecMap, vars=%str('N_Encounters_' || scan(SpecCat, 1, "__") as SpecCat_Short length=20), target=_EE3b);

/*also to create a list of distinct patient-segstart-segend*/
%distinct(data=&DData, vars=%str(&theStudyID, SegStartDate, SegEndDate), target=_EE3c);

/*create a cross join table to have complete combination of patient, segments, and specialties*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE3b,
    t2=_EE3c,
    target=_EE3d,
    vars=*,
    jtype=cross
);

/*left join the above _EE3a (MSB claims) and _EE3D (patient, seg, and spec), to having N encounters by a complete list of specialities in SpecCat_Short*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _EE3d,
    t2=_EE3a,
    target=_EE3e,
    vars=%str(
                        t1.SpecCat_Short,
                        t1.&theStudyID,
                        t1.SegStartDate,
                        t1.SegEndDate,
                        ifn(t2.N_Encounters =., 0, t2.N_Encounters) as N_Encounters
                ),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate SpecCat_Short,
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t1.SpecCat_Short),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t1.SpecCat_Short)
);



/* Transpose to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_EE3e,
    target=_EE3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate,
    colhead = SpecCat_short,
    contents=N_Encounters
);

/*_EF.
Link period-specific countings of total and specialty-specific number of encounters to records in data set &DData.
Save results in data set _E.
[_Note] Data set _EE only contains periods with encounters. For periods in &DData that not having encounters, let N_Encounters=0.
*/
/*Get the total number of encounters per period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=&DData,
    t2=_EE2,
    target=_EF1,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);
/*Get the specialty category specific number of encounters per period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_EF1,
    t2=_EE3,
    target=_EF2,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);
/*Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data &ETarget;
    set _EF2;
    array NENCNTS N_Encounters:;
    do i = 1 to dim(NENCNTS);
        if NENCNTS(i) =. then NENCNTS(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;

%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=&Etarget..zip,
    srcFile=&ETarget..sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

    target=_EE3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate,
    colhead = SpecCat_short,
    contents=N_Encounters
);

/*_EF.
Link period-specific countings of total and specialty-specific number of encounters to records in data set &DData.
Save results in data set _E.
[_Note] Data set _EE only contains periods with encounters. For periods in &DData that not having encounters, let N_Encounters=0.
*/
/*Get the total number of encounters per period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=&DData,
    t2=_EE2,
    target=_EF1,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);
/*Get the specialty category specific number of encounters per period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_EF1,
    t2=_EE3,
    target=_EF2,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);
/*Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data &ETarget;
    set _EF2;
    array NENCNTS N_Encounters:;
    do i = 1 to dim(NENCNTS);
        if NENCNTS(i) =. then NENCNTS(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;

%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=&Etarget..zip,
    srcFile=&ETarget..sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);


s///
t///

children.name: D Exposure Segments - backup old
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*_D. Exposure segments*/
data _null_;run;
/*
[_RD]
For patients in data set _C, get drug claims the study medications within the study period (from studystartdate to studyenddate).
Keep Patient ID, StudyStartDate, StudyEndDate, Service Date (Date of dispensation), DIN, Supply Days, Generic name, Class, and Generation.
Save results in data set _DA.

For records in data set _DA, add a variable 'SupplyDays'. For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation,
except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.
Also add a variable for days of carry over (CarryOverDays). Let CarryOverDays=30.
Save results in data set _DB.

For records in data set _DB, add two variables.
Let 'MedStartDate' = the service date; let 'MedEndDate' = the service date + supply days + carry over days -1.
Truncate the MedEndDate. Specifically, for the same individual, if the MedEndDate (of the current claim) is on or later than the
MedStartDate of the next claim, let the MedEndDate (of the current claim) = theMedStartDate of the next claim +1.

[_Note]
Although such algorithm can be achieved by leap methods, it will be time and resource consuming. An alternative method is to sort
    data in descending order by MedStartDate. That way, the lag() function can be used to get MedEndDate of the previous claims

[_DCBA]This part is kept for handling multiple claims on the same date
For now, keep the claim of the multiple claims on the same date if
1) with the latest MedEndDate;
2) if of the same MedEndDate, keep the first claim.

By patient ID, determine the MedStart/End dates in the next claim
[_Note]
    This part has to be done after removing records in _DCBA.
    With/without removied records will end up with different Next_values;
If the Next_MedStartDate (which is of a later claim) is earlier than the current MedEndDate,
    let adj_MedEndDate = Next_MedStartDate.
    otherwise let adj_MedEndDate=MedEndDate.
_DCC. Insert Gap Periods between the Current MedStartDate and the previous adj_MedEndDate

For each patient, get the previous adj_MedEndDate
If there are > 1 days between the Current MedStartDate and the previous adj_MedEndDate,
    insert a gap period:
        let adj_MedStartDate = pre_adj_MedEndDate +1;
        let adj_MedEndDate = MedStartDate -1;
        let DIN, Class, and generation values be 'null';
    drop MedStartDate, pre_adj_MedEndDate;

    If the first adj_MedStartDate - studyStartDate > 1, insert a gap.
    Also, if the studyEndDate - the last adj_MedEndDate > 1, insert a gap.
    That way, all time segments between dataStartDate and DataEndDate are marked, either covered by an MS medication, or being a gap.
DCE For individuals in _C but not in _DCD, make a null exposure period from StudyStartDate to StudyEndDate.
    These are MS patients who were diangosed by hospital or physician data, but never received MS medications.
_DCF.
all segments (covered or gaps) of exposure to MS medications.
Putting data set _DCD and _DCE together
_DCG Merge? Should the segments of the same exposure status be merged? If so, there will be different merging patterns
    by the 3 methods (yes/no, same generation, same class)
    for now, leave it unmerged
    Saver results in data set _DC.

_DD
    Link records in _DCG to _C. These will be segment-specific data for future analyses. Save results in _D.
*/

/*_DA0, get the master drug claim file*/

/*_DA
For patients in data set _C, get drug claims the study medications within the study period (from studystartdate to studyenddate).
Keep Patient ID, StudyStartDate, StudyEndDate, Service Date (Date of dispensation), DIN, Supply Days, Generic name, Class, and Generation.
Save results in data set _DA.
*/



%let theStudyID=Key_hsn;
%let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
%let inclusionStartDate= '01jan1996'd;
%let inclusionEndDate = '31Mar2018'd;

/*_DA0. Unzip the benefit and nonbenefit drug claims*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_benefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_benefit.sas7bdat)
);

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_dp_nonbenefit.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_dp_nonbenefit.sas7bdat)
);
/*get the MS drug claims*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_dp_benefit,
    t2=localT.a6_dindx,
    target=_DA0a,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t2.*, 'dp' || strip(put(monotonic(), 20.)) format $22. as RxOBS),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=DIN,
    filters=%str(&theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate),
    orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t1.DIN)
);
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_dp_nonbenefit,
    t2=localT.a6_dindx,
    target=_DA0b,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t2.*, 'nb' || strip(put(monotonic(), 20.)) format $22. as RxOBS),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=DIN,
    filters=%str(&theServeDate between &inclusionStartDate and &inclusionEndDate),
    orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.&theServeDate, t1.DIN)
);
data _DA0c;
    set _DA0a _DA0b;
run;
/*from above, select claims within study period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    t2=_DA0c,
    target=_DA,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.studyStartDate, t1.studyEndDate, t2.*),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.&theServeDate between t1.StudyStartDate and t1.StudyEndDate)
);
%print(data=_DA);


/*_DB Determine the supply days.
    For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation, except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.    
*/
/*_DB1,
For records in data set _DA, add a variable 'SupplyDays'. For SK, assuming 30 days supply for each dispensation,
except that assuming 365 days for Alemtuzumab, and 180 days for Ocrelizumab.
Also add a variable for days of carry over (CarryOverDays). Let CarryOverDays=30.
Save results in data set _DB
*/
data _DB;
    set _DA;
    SupplyDays = 30;
    if index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'alemtuzumab') ne 0 then SupplyDays=365;
    if index(strip(lowcase(generic_name)), 'ocrelizumab') ne 0 then SupplyDays=180;
    CarryOverDays=30;
run;
/*%freq(data=_DB, table=generic_name*RxSrc);*/

/*_DC Determine the exposure periods */
/*_DCA
For records in data set _DB, add two variables.
Let 'MedStartDate' = the service date; let 'MedEndDate' = the service date + supply days + carry over days -1.

*/
data _DCA;
    set _DB;
    format MedStartDate date9. MedEndDate date9.;
    MedStartDate = &theServeDate;
    MedEndDate = MedStartDate + SupplyDays + CarryOverDays -1;
    keep
        &theStudyID StudyStartDate StudyEndDate MedStartDate MedEndDate DIN Class_Short Generation_short
        RxOBS
    ;
run;

/*_DCB
Truncate the MedEndDate. Specifically, for the same individual, if the MedEndDate (of the current claim) is on or later than the
MedStartDate of the next claim, let the MedEndDate (of the current claim) = theMedStartDate of the next claim +1.

[_Note]
Although such algorithm can be achieved by leap methods, it will be time and resource consuming. An alternative method is to sort
    data in descending order by MedStartDate. That way, the lag() function can be used to get MedEndDate of the previous claims
*/

/*sort records by patient ID, and decsending MedstartDate*/
%sort(Data=_DCA, sorter=&theStudyID descending MedStartDate descending MedEndDate);

                /*test _DCBA, are there mulitiple claims of MS medications on the same date*/
                data _testDCBA0;
                    set _DCA;
                    Next_MedStartDate=lag(MedStartDate);
                    Next_MedEndDate = lag(MedEndDate);
                    Next_DIN=Lag(DIN);
                    Next_Class_short=Lag(Class_Short);
                    Next_Generation_Short=lag(Generation_Short);
                    Next_RxOBS=lag(RxOBS);
                    format Next_MedStartDate date9. Next_MedEndDate date9.;
                    by &theStudyID descending MedStartDate descending MedEndDate;
                    if first.&theStudyID then do;
                            Next_MedStartDate=.;
                            Next_MedEndDate=.;
                            Next_DIN="";Next_Class_short="";Next_Generation_Short="";Next_RxOBS="";
                    end;
                run;

                data _testDCBA1;
                    set _testDCBA0;
                    if MedStartDate= Next_MedStartDate and Next_MedStartDate ne . ;
                run;
                /*Of different generation?*/
                data _testDCBA2;
                    set _testDCBA1;
                    if Next_Generation_Short ne Generation_short;
                run;
                /*Of different class?*/
                data _testDCBA3;
                    set _testDCBA1;
                    if Next_Class_Short ne Class_short;
                run;
                /*Of different DINs*/
                data _testDCBA4;
                    set _testDCBA1;
                    if Next_DIN ne DIN;
                run;

/*_DCBA, This part is kept for handling multiple claims on the same date
For now, keep the claim of the multiple claims on the same date if
1) with the latest MedEndDate;
2) if of the same MedEndDate, keep the first claim.
*/
Data _DCBA;
    set _DCA;
    by &theStudyID descending MedStartDate descending MedEndDate;
    if last.MedStartDate;
run;

/*_DCBB. By patient ID, determine the MedStart/End dates in the next claim
[_Note]
    This part has to be done after removing records in _DCBA.
    With/without removed records will end up with different Next_values;
*/
data _DCBB;
    set _DCBA;
    Next_MedStartDate=lag(MedStartDate);
    Next_MedEndDate = lag(MedEndDate);
    Next_DIN=Lag(DIN);
    Next_Class_short=Lag(Class_Short);
    Next_Generation_Short=lag(Generation_Short);
    Next_RxOBS=lag(RxOBS);
    format Next_MedStartDate date9. Next_MedEndDate date9.;
    by &theStudyID descending MedStartDate descending MedEndDate;
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
            Next_MedStartDate=.;
            Next_MedEndDate=.;
            Next_DIN="";Next_Class_short="";Next_Generation_Short="";Next_RxOBS="";
    end;
run;

/*_DCBC.
    If the Next_MedStartDate (which is of a later claim) is earlier than the current MedEndDate,
    let adj_MedEndDate = Next_MedStartDate.
    otherwise let adj_MedEndDate=MedEndDate.
*/
Data _DCB;
    set _DCBB;
    by &theStudyID descending MedStartDate descending MedEndDate;
    if Next_MedStartDate ne . and Next_MedStartDate <= MedEndDate then adj_MedEndDate = Next_MedStartDate -1;
    else adj_MedEndDate = MedEndDate;
/*    if first.&theStudyID then adj_MedEndDate = MedEndDate;*/
    format adj_MedEndDate date9.;
    drop Next_: MedEndDate;
run;

/*_DCC. Insert Gap Periods between the Current MedStartDate and the previous adj_MedEndDate*/
%sort(data=_DCB, target=_DCC1, sorter=&theStudyID MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate);
/*For each patient, get the previous adj_MedEndDate*/
data _DCC2;
    set _DCC1;
    pre_adj_MedEndDate = lag(adj_MedEndDate);
    by &theStudyID MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate;
    if first.&theStudyID then pre_adj_MedEndDate=.;
    format pre_adj_MedEndDate date9.;
run;
/*

If there are > 1 days between the Current MedStartDate and the previous adj_MedEndDate,
    insert a gap period:
        let adj_MedStartDate = pre_adj_MedEndDate +1;
        let adj_MedEndDate = MedStartDate -1;
        let DIN, Class, and generation values be 'null';
    drop MedStartDate, pre_adj_MedEndDate;
    
*/
                        /*the following is wrong. The output statement is tricky.!!!*/
                        %macro notrun;
                            Data _DCC3;
                                set _DCC2;
                                if pre_adj_MedEndDate ne . and MedStartDate - pre_adj_MedEndDate > 1 then do;
                                    output; /*out put the current line*/
                                    /*also insert a line*/
                                        adj_MedStartDate = pre_adj_MedEndDate +1;
                                        adj_MedEndDate = MedStartDate -1;
                                        din='null';
                                        class_short='null';
                                        generation_short='null';
                                        RxOBS='null';
                                        MedStartDate=.;
                                        pre_adj_MedEndDate=.;
                                        output;
                                    /*****************************************/
                                end;
                                else do;
                                    adj_MedStartDate= MedStartDate;
                                    output;
                                end;
                                format adj_MedStartDate date9.;
                            run;
                        %mend notrun;


Data _DCC;
    set _DCC2;
    adj_MedStartDate= MedStartDate;
    output;
    if pre_adj_MedEndDate ne . and MedStartDate - pre_adj_MedEndDate > 1 then do;
        /*insert a line for the gap period*/
            adj_MedStartDate = pre_adj_MedEndDate +1;
            adj_MedEndDate = MedStartDate -1;
            din='null';
            class_short='null';
            generation_short='null';
            RxOBS='null';
            MedStartDate=.;
            pre_adj_MedEndDate=.;
            output;
        /*****************************************/
    end;
    format adj_MedStartDate date9.;
    drop MedStartDate pre_adj_MedEndDate;
run;

/*_DCD,
    If the first adj_MedStartDate - studyStartDate > 1, insert a gap.
    Also, if the studyEndDate - the last adj_MedEndDate > 1, insert a gap.
    That way, all time segments between dataStartDate and DataEndDate are marked, either covered by an MS medication, or being a gap.
*/
/*_DCD1, as there are gaps inserted, the data set _DCC should be sorted again*/
%sort(data=_DCC, target=_DCD1, sorter=&theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate);
/*_DCD2, If the first adj_MedStartDate - studyStartDate > 1, insert a gap.*/
data _DCD2;
    set _DCD1;
    by &theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate;
    output; /*again, output is tricky, and should be done before inserting new rows.*/
    if first.&theStudyID and adj_MedStartDate - studyStartDate > 1 then do;
        /*insert a line for the gap period*/
            adj_MedEndDate = adj_MedStartDate -1; /*tricky.adj_MedEndDate must be defined first, as the adj_MedStartDate will be overwritten in the next line */
            adj_MedStartDate = studyStartDate;
            din='null';
            class_short='null';
            generation_short='null';
            RxOBS='null';
            output;
        /*****************************************/
    end;
run;
/*_DCD3 After inserting the heading gap (between studyStartDate, and StudyEnd Date), the data set _DCD2 should be sorted again*/
%sort(data=_DCD2, target=_DCD3, sorter=&theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate);
/*_DCD4, if the studyEndDate - the last adj_MedEndDate > 1, insert a gap.*/
data _DCD4;
    set _DCD3;
    by &theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate;
    output; /*again, output is tricky, and should be done before inserting new rows.*/
    if last.&theStudyID and studyEndDate - adj_MedEndDate > 1 then do;
        /*insert a line for the gap period*/
            adj_MedStartDate = adj_MedEndDate +1; /*tricky.adj_MedStartDate must be defined first, as the adj_MedEndDate will be overwritten in the next line */
            adj_MedEndDate = studyEndDate;
            din='null';
            class_short='null';
            generation_short='null';
            RxOBS='null';
            output;
        /*****************************************/
    end;
run;
/*_DCD5 After inserting the heading gap (between studyStartDate, and StudyEnd Date), the data set _DCD4 should be sorted again*/
%sort(data=_DCD4, target=_DCD, sorter=&theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate);

/*DCE For individuals in _C but not in _DCD, make a null exposure period from StudyStartDate to StudyEndDate.
    These are MS patients who were diangosed by hospital or physician data, but never received MS medications.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    target=_DCE1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(&theStudyID, studyStartDate, studyEndDate),
    filters=%str(&theStudyID not in (select &theStudyID from _DCD))
);
Data _DCE;
    set _DCE1;
    format RxOBS $ 22. adj_MedEndDate date9. adj_MedStartDate date9. DIN $8. Class_Short $15. Generation_short $ 6. ;
    DIN='null';
    Class_Short ='null';
    Generation_short='null';
    adj_MedStartDate=studyStartDate;
    adj_MedEndDate=studyEndDate;
    RxOBS='null';
run;

/*_DCF.
all segments (covered or gaps) of exposure to MS medications.
Putting data set _DCD and _DCE together*/
Data _DCF;
    set _DCE _DCD; /*_DCE is put ahead, so that the columns will follow orders in _DCE*/
run;
%sort(data=_DCF, sorter=studyStartDate studyEndDate &theStudyID adj_MedStartDate adj_MedEndDate);

/*_DCG Merge? Should the segments of the same exposure status be merged? If so, there will be different merging patterns
    by the 3 methods (yes/no, same generation, same class)
    for now, leave it unmerged
*/
data _DCG;
    set _DCF;
    rename adj_medStartDate =SegStartDate
            adj_medEndDate=SegEndDate;
run;

/*_DD
    Link records in _DCG to _C. These will be segment-specific data for future analyses
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._C,
    t2=_DCG,
    target=_D,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=_D.zip,
    srcFile=_D.sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

%beep;



s///
t///

children.name: Copy cohort file to Remote Server
F_R incqtl at remote
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
data _null_;run;
%print(data=remotes._C);
%put >>> &PHRS_Resi_cleanFile;

/*1. income quintile on the study start date*/
%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =remotes._C,
    ds_out=_F_R1a,
    strt_dt_var=studyStartDate,
    end_dt_var=studyStartDate,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );

%freq(data=_F_R1a, table=incqtl, title = on studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T1*/
data _F_T1;
    set _F_R1a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
run;


/*2. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within one year prior to the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R1*/
data _F_R1 ;
    set _F_R1a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate-365;
    lookend = studyStartDate -1;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R1,
    ds_out=_F_R2a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );
    
%freq(data=_F_R2a, table=incqtl, title = within 1 years prior to studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T2*/
data _F_T2;
    set _F_R2a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;

/*3. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within one year since the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R2*/
data _F_R2 ;
    set _F_R2a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate+1;
    lookend = studyStartDate +365;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R2,
    ds_out=_F_R3a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );
    
%freq(data=_F_R3a, table=incqtl, title = within 1 years since studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T3*/
data _F_T3;
    set _F_R3a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;


/*4. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within two year prior to the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R3*/
data _F_R3 ;
    set _F_R3a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate-365*2;
    lookend = studyStartDate -1;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R3,
    ds_out=_F_R4a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );
    
%freq(data=_F_R4a, table=incqtl, title = within 2 years prior to studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T4*/
data _F_T4;
    set _F_R4a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;


/*5. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within two year since the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R4*/
data _F_R4 ;
    set _F_R4a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate+1;
    lookend = studyStartDate + 365*2;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R4,
    ds_out=_F_R5a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );
    
%freq(data=_F_R5a, table=incqtl, title = within 2 years since studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T5*/
data _F_T5;
    set _F_R5a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;


/*6. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within three year prior to the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R5*/
data _F_R5 ;
    set _F_R5a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate-365*3;
    lookend = studyStartDate -1;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R5,
    ds_out=_F_R6a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );
    
%freq(data=_F_R6a, table=incqtl, title = within 3 years prior to studystart);
/*those having incqtl info go to _F_T6*/
data _F_T6;
    set _F_R6a;
    if incqtl ne . and incqtl ne 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;


/*5. for those missing incqtl in above, income quintile within three year since the study start date*/
/*those not having incqtl info go to _F_R6*/
data _F_R6 ;
    set _F_R6a;
    if incqtl = . or incqtl =9;
    keep key_hsn studyStartDate lookstart lookend ;
    lookstart= studyStartDate+1;
    lookend = studyStartDate + 365*3;
    format lookstart date9. lookend date9.;
run;

%GEO_INCQTL_assign(
    ds_in =_F_R6,
    ds_out=_F_R7a,
    strt_dt_var=lookstart,
    end_dt_var=lookend,
    geo_file=&PHRS_Resi_cleanFile,
    incl_incqtl_var=Y
    );


/*all of the patients in F_R7a go to _F_T6*/
data _F_T7;
    set _F_R7a;
    if incqtl = . then incqtl = 9;
    drop lookend lookstart;
run;
%freq(data=_F_T7, table=incqtl, title = within 3 years since studystart);

data _F_T;
    set _F_T1 - _F_T7;
run;

%freq(data=_F_T, table=incqtl, title = all);


data remotet._F_R;
    set _F_T;
run;

children.name: F Covariates_Class
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s

data _null_;run;

/*_F covariates.
[_RD]
*/


%let theStudyID=key_hsn;
%let hospdxdate = adm_date;
%let physiciandxdate = dos;

%let EData=_E_class;
%let FTarget=_F_class;

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\&EData..zip),
    srcFile=%str(&EData..sas7bdat)
);
/*%print(data=&EData.);*/

/*_FA
For records in data set &EData., define the primary factors (Model 1: No exposure or Exposure;
Model 2: No exposure or 1st or 2nd generation DMD exposure; Model 3: No exposure or exposure by individual DMD class).
[Note:] these vars are period specific.
*/
data _FA;
    set &EData.;
    format X1_M1_Any $4.;
    if Exposure_Status ne 'd' then X1_M1_Any='null';else X1_M1_Any='yes';
    rename Generation_short = X1_M2_Generations;
    rename class_short = X1_M3_Classes;
run;

/*%freq(data=_FA, table=X1_M2_Generations);*/

/*make a variable to indicate the exposure to any DMT during follow up, regardless of segments*/
%distinct(data=_FA, target=_FA1, vars=%str(&theStudyID, x1_M1_Any), filters=%str(X1_M1_Any='yes'));
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_FA,
    t2=_FA1,
    target=_FA2,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifc(t2.&theStudyID = '', 'null', 'yes') as x31_M4_WholeFW),
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    jtype=left
);


/*_FB, time-varying variables.

_FBA. For records in data set &EData., determine patient's age at beginning (SegStartDate) of each segment (period)
*/
data _FB;
    set _FA2;
    X2_Age = INT(yrdif(Birth, SegStartDate, "AGE"));
run;

/*_FC, time-fixed variables
*/

/*_FCA sex and starting calendar year */
data _FCA;
    set _FB;
    rename Sex= X1_Sex;
    rename First_admin_code_Year = X3_StudyStartYear;
run;

/*_FCB income quintile
[_Note]
The income quitile is prepared on remote server by program "F_R". The results are saved in data set _F_R, which was downloaded and
    saved in the local target folder (libname = localt).
The income quintile info is available until mid 2017. Individuals newly immigrated to SK after Jun 30, 2017 won't
have income quintile info.
*/
%sort(data=localt._F_R, target= _FCB1, sorter=&theStudyID incqtl);
data _FCB2;
    set _FCB1;
    by &theStudyID incqtl;
    if first.&theStudyID;
    keep &theStudyID incqtl;
    if incqtl =. then incqtl=9;
run;
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_FB,
    t2=_FCB2,
    target=_FCB,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.INCQTL=., 9, t2.incqtl) as X4_SES),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);
            /* test proportion of cohort membes missing SES status
                %distinct(data=_FCB, target=test, vars=%str(&theStudyID, X4_SES));
                %freq(data=test, table=X4_SES);
            */
/*_FCC comorbidities

*/

/*ICD code list of the comorbidities
[_Note]
the BC code *50B is not included
*/
/*mental conditions (anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder)*/
%let ICD9_MSB_MH = %str('296', '298','300','311');
%let ICD9_HOSP_MH = %str('3000', '3002', '2960', '2961', '29604', '29614', '2964', '29644', '2965', '2965', '29654', '2966', '2967', '2968', '2962', '2963', '2980', '3004', '311');
%let ICD10_MH=%str('F40', 'F41', 'F31', 'F32', 'F33', 'F34');
/*Hypertension*/
%let ICD9_HN= %str('401', '402', '403', '404', '405');
%let ICD10_HN=%str('I10', 'I11', 'I12', 'I13', 'I15');
/*Hyperlipidemia*/
%let ICD9_HL=%str('272');
%let ICD10_HL=%str('E780', 'E782', 'E784', 'E785');
/*Chronic Lung Disease*/
%let ICD9_CL=%str('493', '491', '492', '496');
%let ICD10_CL=%str('J40', 'J42', 'J43', 'J44', 'J45', 'J46');
/*Diabetes*/
%let ICD9_DB=%str('250');
%let ICD10_DB=%str('E10', 'E11', 'E12', 'E13', 'E14');
/*Epilepsy*/
%let ICD9_EP=%str('345');
%let ICD10_EP=%str('G40', 'G41');
/*Ischemic Heart Disease*/
%let ICD9_IH=%str('410', '411', '412', '413', '414');
%let ICD10_IH=%str('I20', 'I21', 'I22', 'I23', 'I24', 'I25');
/*Cancer: 140-172, 174-209, C00-C43, C45-C97*/
/*added according to the new protocol: P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\INITIAL MODEL PLAN FOR DRUMS-Aim-1-GEE-Physician-visitsv_28June_FINAL.docx*/
%let ICD9_CA=%str('140','141','142','143','144','145','146','147','148','149','150','151','152','153','154','155','156','157','158','159','160','161','162','163','164','165','166','167','168','169','170','171','172','174','175','176','177','178','179','180','181','182','183','184','185','186','187','188','189','190','191','192','193','194','195','196','197','198','199','200','201','202','203','204','205','206','207','208','209');
%let ICD10_CA=%str('C00','C01','C02','C03','C04','C05','C06','C07','C08','C09','C10','C11','C12','C13','C14','C15','C16','C17','C18','C19','C20','C21','C22','C23','C24','C25','C26','C27','C28','C29','C30','C31','C32','C33','C34','C35','C36','C37','C38','C39','C40','C41','C42','C43','C45','C46','C47','C48','C49','C50','C51','C52','C53','C54','C55','C56','C57','C58','C59','C60','C61','C62','C63','C64','C65','C66','C67','C68','C69','C70','C71','C72','C73','C74','C75','C76','C77','C78','C79','C80','C81','C82','C83','C84','C85','C86','C87','C88','C89','C90','C91','C92','C93','C94','C95','C96','C97');

/*_FCCA the first dx of comorbidities from hopsital file*/
/*_FCCA0 unzip the hospital file*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_hosp.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_hosp.sas7bdat)
);

/*_FCCA1
Get hospitalization records of patient in data set _C*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_hosp,
    t2=localt._C,
    target=_FCCA1,
    vars=t1.*,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);


/*FCCA2 get the admission date of the first ICD code for each comorbidity*/
    /*0. Create an empty target file*/
data _FCCA;
    format &theStudyID $11. coMorb $20. coMorbDate date9.;
    delete;
run;
%Macro getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=, theICD9s=, theICD10s=, theCoMorb=, Target=, debug=);

    %local data theICD9s theICD10s theCoMorb Target debug;

    /*1. Select hospital records with a matched ICD code*/
    data getComorb_Hosp_tmp1;
        set &data;
        array dxs $ dx_code_1 - dx_code_25;
        array cdxs $ conv_dx_code_1 - conv_dx_code_25;
        format coMorb $20.;
        do i = 1 to 25;
                if dxs(i) in: (&theICD10s) then do;
                    coMorb = symget('theComorb');
                    output;
                    leave;
                end;
                if cdxs(i) in: (&theICD9s) then do;
                    coMorb = symget('theComorb');
                    output;
                    leave;
                end;
        end;
        keep &theStudyID &hospdxdate comorb;
    run;
    /*2. Select all dx of different dates, this part is changed so as to have all records of dx, and later used to determine
        whether there are dx between 1 year prior to the index_date, and start date of a specific period*/
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=getComorb_Hosp_tmp1,
        target=getComorb_Hosp_tmp2,
        distinct=1,
        vars=%str(&theStudyID, comorb, &hospdxdate as coMorbDate),
        groupby = %str(&theStudyID, comorb)
    );
    /*3. Attach results to the target file*/
    data ⌖
        set &target getComorb_Hosp_tmp2;
    run;

    %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
        proc datasets nolist;
            delete getComorb_Hosp_tmp:;
        run;
    %end;
%mend getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS;
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_HOSP_MH,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_MH, theCoMorb=MH_Mental, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_HN,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_HN, theCoMorb=HN_Hypertension, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_HL,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_HL, theCoMorb=HL_Hyperlipidemia, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_CL,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_CL, theCoMorb=CL_ChronicLungDz, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_DB,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_DB, theCoMorb=DB_Diabetes, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_EP,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_EP, theCoMorb=EP_Eplilepsy, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_IH,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_IH, theCoMorb=IH_IschemicHeartDz, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
%getComorb_Hosp_DRUMS(data=_FCCA1, theICD9s=&ICD9_CA,
    theICD10s=&ICD10_CA, theCoMorb=CA_Cancer, Target=_FCCA, debug=);
/*%freq(data=_FCCA, table=CoMorb);*/

/*_FCCB, the first dx of comorbidities from physician service file*/
/*_FCCB0 unzip the physician service file*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localDataPath.\master_msb.zip),
    srcFile=%str(master_msb.sas7bdat)
);

/*_FCCB1
Get hospitalization records of patient in data set _C*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_msb,
    t2=localt._C,
    target=_FCCB1,
    vars=t1.*,
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

/*FCCB2 get the service date of the first ICD code for each comorbidity*/
/*0. Create an empty target file*/
data _FCCB;
    format &theStudyID $11. coMorb $20. coMorbDate date9.;
    delete;
run;
%Macro getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=, theICD9s=, theCoMorb=, Target=, debug=);

    %local data theICD9s theCoMorb Target debug;

    /*1. Select physician service records with a matched ICD code*/
    data getComorb_MSB_tmp1;
        set &data;
        format coMorb $20.;
        if diag in: (&theICD9s) then do;
            coMorb = symget('theComorb');
            output;
        end;
        keep &theStudyID &physiciandxdate comorb;
    run;
    /*2. Select the earliest date of diagnosis, this part is changed so as to have all records of dx, and later used to determine
        whether there are dx between 1 year prior to the index_date, and start date of a specific period*/
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=getComorb_MSB_tmp1,
        target=getComorb_MSB_tmp2,
        vars=%str(&theStudyID, comorb, &physiciandxdate as coMorbDate),
        groupby = %str(&theStudyID, comorb)
    );
    /*3. Attach results to the target file*/
    data ⌖
        set &target getComorb_MSB_tmp2;
    run;

    %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
        proc datasets nolist;
            delete getComorb_MSB_tmp:;
        run;
    %end;
%mend getComorb_MSB_DRUMS;
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_MSB_MH,
    theCoMorb=MH_Mental, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_HN,
    theCoMorb=HN_Hypertension, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_HL,
    theCoMorb=HL_Hyperlipidemia, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_CL,
    theCoMorb=CL_ChronicLungDz, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_DB,
    theCoMorb=DB_Diabetes, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_EP,
    theCoMorb=EP_Eplilepsy, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_IH,
    theCoMorb=IH_IschemicHeartDz, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
%getComorb_MSB_DRUMS(data=_FCCB1, theICD9s=&ICD9_CA,
    theCoMorb=CA_Cancer, Target=_FCCB, debug=);
/*%freq(data=_FCCB, table=CoMorb);*/

/*_FCCC combine data set _FCCA and data set _FCCB, for each patient, keep the earlist date of comorbidity diagnosis*/
/*1. Combine the data*/
data _FCCC1;
    set _FCCA _FCCB;
run;
/*2. Select the earliest date of diagnosis, this part is changed so as to have all records of dx, and later used to determine
        whether there are dx between 1 year prior to the index_date, and start date of a specific period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_FCCC1,
    target=_FCCC,
    vars=%str(&theStudyID, comorb, coMorbDate),
    groupby = %str(&theStudyID, comorb)
);
/*%freq(data=_FCCC, table=CoMorb);*/

/*_FCCD number of comorbidity at baseline (within 365 days prior to the studystartdate)*/
/*_FCCD1
Join data set _FCB, and data set _FCCC,
[_Note]
The protocol said to trace back for one year prior to the studystartdate. However, patients may have the first diagnosis of comorbidity way earlier than 1 year.
    Therefore the following is to trace back for 100 years.
*/

/*Get the comorbidities before the StudyStartDate*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCB,
    t2=_FCCC,
    target=_FCCD1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate, t2.CoMorb), /*, t2.CoMorbDate*/
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.CoMorbDate between t1.StudyStartDate-365*1 and t1.StudyStartDate-1)
);

/*_FCCD2, count total number of comorbidities at baseline*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD1,
    target=_FCCD2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate, count(t1.CoMorb) as N_CoMorb_Baseline),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate)
);

/*_FCCD3, link the date set _FCB, and date set FCCD2, add N_CoMorb_Baseline to data set _FCB.
    For those not having comorbidities at baseline, let N_CoMorb_Baseline=0.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCB,
    t2=_FCCD2,
    target=_FCCD3,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.N_CoMorb_Baseline=., 0, t2.N_CoMorb_Baseline) as N_CoMorb_Baseline),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

/*_FCCD4, make categories for number of comorbidities at baseline*/
data _FCCD;
    set _FCCD3;
    X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT =N_CoMorb_Baseline;
    if N_CoMorb_Baseline > 3 then X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT = 4;
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCD, table=X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT);*/

/*_FCCE number of comorbidity at each period*/
/*_FCCE1
Join data set _FCCD, and data set _FCCC,
[_Note]
The protocol said to trace back for one year.
Question:
However, patients may have the first diagnosis of comorbidity way earlier than 1 year?
*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD,
    t2=_FCCC,
    target=_FCCE1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t2.CoMorb),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.CoMorbDate between t1.StudyStartDate-365*1 and t1.SegStartDate-1)
);

/*_FCCE2, count total number of comorbidities for each segment*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCE1,
    target=_FCCE2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, count(t1.CoMorb) as N_CoMorb_Seg),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate)
);

/*_FCCE3, link the date set _FCCD, and date set FCCE2, add N_CoMorb_Seg to data set _FCB.
    For those not having comorbidities at each segment, let N_CoMorb_Seg=0.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD,
    t2=_FCCE2,
    target=_FCCE3,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.N_CoMorb_Seg=., 0, t2.N_CoMorb_Seg) as N_CoMorb_Seg),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);

/*_FCCE4, make categories for number of comorbidities at baseline*/
data _FCCE;
    set _FCCE3;
    X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT =N_CoMorb_Seg;
    if N_CoMorb_Seg > 3 then X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT = 4;
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCE, table=X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT);*/

/*_FCCF status of each comorbidity at baseline*/
data _FCCF1;
    set _FCCD1;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    coMorb_Short =scan(coMorb, 1, "_");
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCF1, table=coMorb_Short);*/

data coMorbCodes;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    input coMorb_short $ @@;
    coMorbID=_N_;
    coMorbVar='X' || strip(coMorbID+6) || '_CMB_B_' || coMorb_short;
    cards;
MH HN HL CL DB EP IH CA
;

/*_FCCF2, linke the above two to add the coMorbVars*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCF1,
    t2=coMorbCodes,
    target=_FCCF2,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.coMorbVar, 1 as CNT),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=coMorb_Short,
    orderby = %str(&theStudyID)
);

/* Transpose data set _FCCF2 to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_FCCF2,
    target=_FCCF3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID StudyStartDate,
    colhead = coMorbVar,
    contents=CNT
);

/*_FCCF3 link data set _FCCF2 back to _FCCE*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCE,
    t2=_FCCF3,
    target=_FCCF4,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID StudyStartDate
);

/*Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data _FCCF;
    set _FCCF4;
    array theXs
        X7_CMB_B_MH
        X8_CMB_B_HN
        X9_CMB_B_HL
        X10_CMB_B_CL
        X11_CMB_B_DB
        X12_CMB_B_EP
        X13_CMB_B_IH
        X14_CMB_B_CA
    ;
    do i = 1 to dim(theXs);
        if theXs(i) =. then theXs(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;


/*_FCCG status of each comorbidity at each period*/
data _FCCG1;
    set _FCCE1;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    coMorb_Short =scan(coMorb, 1, "_");
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCF1, table=coMorb_Short);*/

data coMorbCodes2;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    input coMorb_short $ @@;
    coMorbID=_N_;
    coMorbVar='X' || strip(coMorbID+13) || '_CMB_P_' || coMorb_short;
    cards;
MH HN HL CL DB EP IH CA
;


/*_FCCG2, linke the above two to add the coMorbVars*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCG1,
    t2=coMorbCodes2,
    target=_FCCG2,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.coMorbVar, 1 as CNT),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=coMorb_Short,
    orderby = %str(&theStudyID)
);

/* Transpose data set _FCCG2 to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_FCCG2,
    target=_FCCG3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate,
    colhead = coMorbVar,
    contents=CNT
);

/*_FCCG4 link data set _FCCG2 back to _FCCF*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCF,
    t2=_FCCG3,
    target=_FCCG4,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);

/*_FCCG5. Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data _FC;
    set _FCCG4;
    array theXs
        X14_CMB_P_MH
        X15_CMB_P_HN
        X16_CMB_P_HL
        X17_CMB_P_CL
        X18_CMB_P_DB
        X19_CMB_P_EP
        X20_CMB_P_IH
        X21_CMB_P_CA
    ;
    do i = 1 to dim(theXs);
        if theXs(i) =. then theXs(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;

/*_FD. adding variables compatible to the team template
Ref.P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\map data structure dummy and _F 20190630.xlsx
*/
%sort(data=_FC, sorter=&theStudyID First_admin_code_date SegStartDate SegEndDate );
data &FTarget;
    set _Fc;
    format
    ID $11.
    Index_date yymmdd10.
    DMD_No_DMD $5.
    Calendar_year 8.
    Calendar_year_CAT $11.
    PY best32.
    LOG_PY best32.
    Sex1 $3.
    DOB yymmdd10.
    Study_end yymmdd10.
    Follow_up best32.
    Period_N 8.
    Stop_Interval yymmdd10.
    Start_Interval yymmdd10.
    DMD_No_Ind $20.
    DMD_No_First_Second $8.
    Physician_claims best32.
    NS best32.
    GS best32.
    Genmed best32.
    OnG best32.
    Ophtal best32.
    GP BEST32.
    Physiatrist BEST32.
    Uro BEST32.
    Ortho BEST32.
    PSY BEST32.
    Derm BEST32.
    DMD_Ever $5.
    Age Best32.
    SES 8.
    Comorb_count Best32.
    Mental $10.
    COPD $10.
    Lipid $10.
    HTN $10.
    IHD $10.
    DM $10.
    Epilepsy $10.
    Cancer $10.00
;
    by &theStudyID First_admin_code_date SegStartDate SegEndDate;
    ID=&theStudyID;
    Index_date =StudyStartDate;/*The studyStartDate is the index_date in my version. It differs from the first_admin_code_year in
                                                    that for patients < 18 on first_admin date, the StudyStartDate was moved forward to the date of 18th birthday*/
    if X1_M1_Any = 'yes' then     DMD_No_DMD = 'Yes';else DMD_No_DMD='No';
    Calendar_year = year(SegStartDate);
    select ;
        when ( Calendar_year le 1999) Calendar_year_CAT='1996-1999';
        when ( 2000 le Calendar_year le 2004) Calendar_year_CAT='2000-2004';
        when ( 2005 le Calendar_year le 2009) Calendar_year_CAT='2005-2009';
        when ( 2010 le Calendar_year le 2014) Calendar_year_CAT='2010-2014';
        when ( 2015 le Calendar_year le 2018) Calendar_year_CAT='2015-2018';
        otherwise Calendar_year_CAT='Wrong';
    end;
    PY=((SegEndDate - SegStartDate) + 1)/ 365.24;
    LOG_PY = log(py);
    sex1 = sex; drop sex; rename sex1=Sex;
    DOB = Birth;
    Study_end =StudyEndDate;
    Follow_up=((StudyEndDate - StudyStartDate) + 1 )/ 365.24;
    if first.&theStudyID then Period_N = 1;    else Period_N+1;
    Stop_Interval = SegEndDate;
    Start_Interval = SegStartDate;
    select (X1_M3_Classes);
        when ( 'Alemtuzumab') DMD_No_Ind='Alemtuzumab';
        when ( 'Fingolimod') DMD_No_Ind='Fingolimod';
        when ( 'Fumarate') DMD_No_Ind='Dimethyl fumarate';
        when ( 'Glatiramer') DMD_No_Ind='Glatiramer acetate';
        when ( 'IFNB') DMD_No_Ind='Beta-interferon';
        when ( 'Natalizumab') DMD_No_Ind='Natalizumab';
        when ( 'Teriflunomide') DMD_No_Ind='Teriflunomide';
        when ( 'null') DMD_No_Ind='No';
        when ( 'Daclizumab') DMD_No_Ind='Daclizumab';
        when ( 'Ocrelizumab ') DMD_No_Ind='Ocrelizumab ';
        otherwise DMD_No_Ind='Wrong';
    end;
    select (X1_M2_Generations);
        when ( 'First') DMD_No_First_Second='First';
        when ( 'Second') DMD_No_First_Second='Second';
        when ( 'null') DMD_No_First_Second='No';
        otherwise DMD_No_First_Second='Wrong';
    end;
    Physician_claims = N_Encounters_Total;
    NS=N_Encounters_NUS;
    GS=N_Encounters_GNS;
    Genmed=N_Encounters_INT;
    OnG=N_Encounters_ONG;
    Ophtal=N_Encounters_OPH;
    GP=N_Encounters_PCP;
    Physiatrist=N_Encounters_PHY;
    Uro=N_Encounters_URO;
    Ortho=N_Encounters_OTS;
    PSY=N_Encounters_PSY;
    Derm=N_Encounters_DER;
    if X31_M4_WholeFW = 'yes' then DMD_Ever='Yes';else DMD_Ever='No';
    Age=((SegStartDate - birth) + 1 )/ 365.24 ;
    SES = X4_SES;
    if X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT < 3 then Comorb_count =X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT; else Comorb_count=3;
    if X14_CMB_P_MH=1 then Mental='Presence'; else Mental= 'Absence';
    if X15_CMB_P_HN=1 then COPD='Presence'; else COPD= 'Absence';
    if X17_CMB_P_CL=1 then Lipid='Presence'; else Lipid= 'Absence';
    if X16_CMB_P_HL=1 then HTN='Presence'; else HTN= 'Absence';
    if X20_CMB_P_IH=1 then IHD='Presence'; else IHD= 'Absence';
    if X18_CMB_P_DB=1 then DM='Presence'; else DM= 'Absence';
    if X19_CMB_P_EP=1 then Epilepsy='Presence'; else Epilepsy= 'Absence';
    if X21_CMB_P_CA=1 then Cancer='Presence'; else Cancer= 'Absence';
run;


%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=&FTarget..zip,
    srcFile=&FTarget..sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

///t
