/*%freq(data=_FCCB, table=CoMorb);*/

/*_FCCC combine data set _FCCA and data set _FCCB, for each patient, keep the earlist date of comorbidity diagnosis*/
/*1. Combine the data*/
data _FCCC1;
    set _FCCA _FCCB;
run;
/*2. Select the earliest date of diagnosis, this part is changed so as to have all records of dx, and later used to determine
        whether there are dx between 1 year prior to the index_date, and start date of a specific period*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=_FCCC1,
    target=_FCCC,
    vars=%str(&theStudyID, comorb, coMorbDate),
    groupby = %str(&theStudyID, comorb)
);
/*%freq(data=_FCCC, table=CoMorb);*/

/*_FCCD number of comorbidity at baseline (within 365 days prior to the studystartdate)*/
/*_FCCD1
Join data set _FCB, and data set _FCCC,
[_Note]
The protocol said to trace back for one year prior to the studystartdate. However, patients may have the first diagnosis of comorbidity way earlier than 1 year.
    Therefore the following is to trace back for 100 years.
*/

/*Get the comorbidities before the StudyStartDate*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCB,
    t2=_FCCC,
    target=_FCCD1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate, t2.CoMorb), /*, t2.CoMorbDate*/
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.CoMorbDate between t1.StudyStartDate-365*1 and t1.StudyStartDate-1)
);

/*_FCCD2, count total number of comorbidities at baseline*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD1,
    target=_FCCD2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate, count(t1.CoMorb) as N_CoMorb_Baseline),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.StudyStartDate)
);

/*_FCCD3, link the date set _FCB, and date set FCCD2, add N_CoMorb_Baseline to data set _FCB.
    For those not having comorbidities at baseline, let N_CoMorb_Baseline=0.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCB,
    t2=_FCCD2,
    target=_FCCD3,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.N_CoMorb_Baseline=., 0, t2.N_CoMorb_Baseline) as N_CoMorb_Baseline),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID
);

/*_FCCD4, make categories for number of comorbidities at baseline*/
data _FCCD;
    set _FCCD3;
    X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT =N_CoMorb_Baseline;
    if N_CoMorb_Baseline > 3 then X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT = 4;
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCD, table=X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT);*/

/*_FCCE number of comorbidity at each period*/
/*_FCCE1
Join data set _FCCD, and data set _FCCC,
[_Note]
The protocol said to trace back for one year.
Question:
However, patients may have the first diagnosis of comorbidity way earlier than 1 year?
*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD,
    t2=_FCCC,
    target=_FCCE1,
    distinct=1,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, t2.CoMorb),
    jtype=inner,
    jvars=&theStudyID,
    filters=%str(t2.CoMorbDate between t1.StudyStartDate-365*1 and t1.SegStartDate-1)
);

/*_FCCE2, count total number of comorbidities for each segment*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCE1,
    target=_FCCE2,
    vars=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate, count(t1.CoMorb) as N_CoMorb_Seg),
    Groupby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate),
    Orderby=%str(t1.&theStudyID, t1.SegStartDate, t1.SegEndDate)
);

/*_FCCE3, link the date set _FCCD, and date set FCCE2, add N_CoMorb_Seg to data set _FCB.
    For those not having comorbidities at each segment, let N_CoMorb_Seg=0.
*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCD,
    t2=_FCCE2,
    target=_FCCE3,
    vars=%str(t1.*, ifn(t2.N_CoMorb_Seg=., 0, t2.N_CoMorb_Seg) as N_CoMorb_Seg),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);

/*_FCCE4, make categories for number of comorbidities at baseline*/
data _FCCE;
    set _FCCE3;
    X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT =N_CoMorb_Seg;
    if N_CoMorb_Seg > 3 then X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT = 4;
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCE, table=X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT);*/

/*_FCCF status of each comorbidity at baseline*/
data _FCCF1;
    set _FCCD1;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    coMorb_Short =scan(coMorb, 1, "_");
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCF1, table=coMorb_Short);*/

data coMorbCodes;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    input coMorb_short $ @@;
    coMorbID=_N_;
    coMorbVar='X' || strip(coMorbID+6) || '_CMB_B_' || coMorb_short;
    cards;
MH HN HL CL DB EP IH CA
;

/*_FCCF2, linke the above two to add the coMorbVars*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCF1,
    t2=coMorbCodes,
    target=_FCCF2,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.coMorbVar, 1 as CNT),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=coMorb_Short,
    orderby = %str(&theStudyID)
);

/* Transpose data set _FCCF2 to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_FCCF2,
    target=_FCCF3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID StudyStartDate,
    colhead = coMorbVar,
    contents=CNT
);

/*_FCCF3 link data set _FCCF2 back to _FCCE*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCE,
    t2=_FCCF3,
    target=_FCCF4,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID StudyStartDate
);

/*Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data _FCCF;
    set _FCCF4;
    array theXs
        X7_CMB_B_MH
        X8_CMB_B_HN
        X9_CMB_B_HL
        X10_CMB_B_CL
        X11_CMB_B_DB
        X12_CMB_B_EP
        X13_CMB_B_IH
        X14_CMB_B_CA
    ;
    do i = 1 to dim(theXs);
        if theXs(i) =. then theXs(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;


/*_FCCG status of each comorbidity at each period*/
data _FCCG1;
    set _FCCE1;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    coMorb_Short =scan(coMorb, 1, "_");
run;
/*%freq(data=_FCCF1, table=coMorb_Short);*/

data coMorbCodes2;
    format coMorb_short $2.;
    input coMorb_short $ @@;
    coMorbID=_N_;
    coMorbVar='X' || strip(coMorbID+13) || '_CMB_P_' || coMorb_short;
    cards;
MH HN HL CL DB EP IH CA
;


/*_FCCG2, linke the above two to add the coMorbVars*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCG1,
    t2=coMorbCodes2,
    target=_FCCG2,
    vars=%str(t1.*, t2.coMorbVar, 1 as CNT),
    jtype=left,
    jvars=coMorb_Short,
    orderby = %str(&theStudyID)
);

/* Transpose data set _FCCG2 to have number of encounters in each column of specialty categories*/
%transpose(
    data=_FCCG2,
    target=_FCCG3,
    rowhead =&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate,
    colhead = coMorbVar,
    contents=CNT
);

/*_FCCG4 link data set _FCCG2 back to _FCCF*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1= _FCCF,
    t2=_FCCG3,
    target=_FCCG4,
    vars=*,
    jtype=left,
    jvars=&theStudyID SegStartDate SegEndDate
);

/*_FCCG5. Replace the missing value in encounter columns with 0*/
data _FC;
    set _FCCG4;
    array theXs
        X14_CMB_P_MH
        X15_CMB_P_HN
        X16_CMB_P_HL
        X17_CMB_P_CL
        X18_CMB_P_DB
        X19_CMB_P_EP
        X20_CMB_P_IH
        X21_CMB_P_CA
    ;
    do i = 1 to dim(theXs);
        if theXs(i) =. then theXs(i)=0;
    end;
    drop i;
run;

/*_FD. adding variables compatible to the team template
Ref.P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\map data structure dummy and _F 20190630.xlsx
*/
%sort(data=_FC, sorter=&theStudyID First_admin_code_date SegStartDate SegEndDate );
data _F;
    set _Fc;
    format
    ID $11.
    Index_date yymmdd10.
    DMD_No_DMD $5.
    Calendar_year 8.
    Calendar_year_CAT $11.
    PY best32.
    LOG_PY best32.
    Sex1 $3.
    DOB yymmdd10.
    Study_end yymmdd10.
    Follow_up best32.
    Period_N 8.
    Stop_Interval yymmdd10.
    Start_Interval yymmdd10.
    DMD_No_Ind $20.
    DMD_No_First_Second $8.
    Physician_claims best32.
    NS best32.
    GS best32.
    Genmed best32.
    OnG best32.
    Ophtal best32.
    GP BEST32.
    Physiatrist BEST32.
    Uro BEST32.
    Ortho BEST32.
    PSY BEST32.
    Derm BEST32.
    DMD_Ever $5.
    Age Best32.
    SES 8.
    Comorb_count Best32.
    Mental $10.
    COPD $10.
    Lipid $10.
    HTN $10.
    IHD $10.
    DM $10.
    Epilepsy $10.
    Cancer $10.00
;
    by &theStudyID First_admin_code_date SegStartDate SegEndDate;
    ID=&theStudyID;
    Index_date =StudyStartDate;/*The studyStartDate is the index_date in my version. It differs from the first_admin_code_year in
                                                    that for patients < 18 on first_admin date, the StudyStartDate was moved forward to the date of 18th birthday*/
    if X1_M1_Any = 'yes' then     DMD_No_DMD = 'Yes';else DMD_No_DMD='No';
    Calendar_year = year(SegStartDate);
    select ;
        when ( Calendar_year le 1999) Calendar_year_CAT='1996-1999';
        when ( 2000 le Calendar_year le 2004) Calendar_year_CAT='2000-2004';
        when ( 2005 le Calendar_year le 2009) Calendar_year_CAT='2005-2009';
        when ( 2010 le Calendar_year le 2014) Calendar_year_CAT='2010-2014';
        when ( 2015 le Calendar_year le 2018) Calendar_year_CAT='2015-2018';
        otherwise Calendar_year_CAT='Wrong';
    end;
    PY=((SegEndDate - SegStartDate) + 1)/ 365.24;
    LOG_PY = log(py);
    sex1 = sex; drop sex; rename sex1=Sex;
    DOB = Birth;
    Study_end =StudyEndDate;
    Follow_up=((StudyEndDate - StudyStartDate) + 1 )/ 365.24;
    if first.&theStudyID then Period_N = 1;    else Period_N+1;
    Stop_Interval = SegEndDate;
    Start_Interval = SegStartDate;
    select (X1_M3_Classes);
        when ( 'Alemtuzumab') DMD_No_Ind='Alemtuzumab';
        when ( 'Fingolimod') DMD_No_Ind='Fingolimod';
        when ( 'Fumarate') DMD_No_Ind='Dimethyl fumarate';
        when ( 'Glatiramer') DMD_No_Ind='Glatiramer acetate';
        when ( 'IFNB') DMD_No_Ind='Beta-interferon';
        when ( 'Natalizumab') DMD_No_Ind='Natalizumab';
        when ( 'Teriflunomide') DMD_No_Ind='Teriflunomide';
        when ( 'null') DMD_No_Ind='No';
        when ( 'Daclizumab') DMD_No_Ind='Daclizumab';
        when ( 'Ocrelizumab ') DMD_No_Ind='Ocrelizumab ';
        otherwise DMD_No_Ind='Wrong';
    end;
    select (X1_M2_Generations);
        when ( 'First') DMD_No_First_Second='First';
        when ( 'Second') DMD_No_First_Second='Second';
        when ( 'null') DMD_No_First_Second='No';
        otherwise DMD_No_First_Second='Wrong';
    end;
    Physician_claims = N_Encounters_Total;
    NS=N_Encounters_NUS;
    GS=N_Encounters_GNS;
    Genmed=N_Encounters_INT;
    OnG=N_Encounters_ONG;
    Ophtal=N_Encounters_OPH;
    GP=N_Encounters_PCP;
    Physiatrist=N_Encounters_PHY;
    Uro=N_Encounters_URO;
    Ortho=N_Encounters_OTS;
    PSY=N_Encounters_PSY;
    Derm=N_Encounters_DER;
    if X31_M4_WholeFW = 'yes' then DMD_Ever='Yes';else DMD_Ever='No';
    Age=((SegStartDate - birth) + 1 )/ 365.24 ;
    SES = X4_SES;
    if X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT < 3 then Comorb_count =X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT; else Comorb_count=3;
    if X14_CMB_P_MH=1 then Mental='Presence'; else Mental= 'Absence';
    if X15_CMB_P_HN=1 then COPD='Presence'; else COPD= 'Absence';
    if X17_CMB_P_CL=1 then Lipid='Presence'; else Lipid= 'Absence';
    if X16_CMB_P_HL=1 then HTN='Presence'; else HTN= 'Absence';
    if X20_CMB_P_IH=1 then IHD='Presence'; else IHD= 'Absence';
    if X18_CMB_P_DB=1 then DM='Presence'; else DM= 'Absence';
    if X19_CMB_P_EP=1 then Epilepsy='Presence'; else Epilepsy= 'Absence';
    if X21_CMB_P_CA=1 then Cancer='Presence'; else Cancer= 'Absence';
run;


%vbsZip(
    tgtDir=&localTargetPath,
    zipFile=_F.zip,
    srcFile=_F.sas7bdat,
    srcDir=
);

children.name: AIM1 Report Dummy
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*DRUMS******************************************************************************************
Site: Saskatchewan
Analyst: Shenzhen YAO

The following program was adapted from the SAS code provided by the DRUMS team in the mail from
to on 2019-06-28
The original code file was saved at:
P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot
************************************************************************************************/
data _null_;run;

/*Routing SAS log to an external file --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let Aim1ReportPath =P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\Dummy\;
%let theLogFile=&Aim1ReportPath.drums_log.txt;
%put >>> theLogFile= &theLogFile;
filename theLog "&theLogFile";
proc printto log=theLog;run;

/*define the source data (either the dummy data, or the real data) -- Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let theData=DRUMS_Dummy;

/*Part 0. Import data**************************************************/
/*PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = 'DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV' OUT = DRUMS DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let srcPath = P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\;
%let srcFile = DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV;
%let srcFull = &srcPath.&srcFile;
%put >>> srcFull= &srcFull;

/*this part is to import the dummy data from the csv file to a SAS data set
    It'll only work when theData = DRUMS_Dummy (case insensitive).
    This is to prevent confusion when load dummy or real data.
    -- Shenzhen 20190702
*/
%macro getDummyData(src=);
    %local src;
    %if %lowcase(&src) = drums_dummy %then %do;
        PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = "&srcFull" OUT = &src DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;
    %end;
%mend getDummyData;
%getDummyData(src=&theData);

/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part A. Summary 1 & 2**************************************************/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET &theData; WHERE PERIOD_N = 1; RUN;
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY1 QUANTILES = SUMMARY2;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY1; SET SUMMARY1; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;
DATA SUMMARY2; SET SUMMARY2; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;

/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum1= &Aim1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV; /*changing 'MENAS' to 'MEANS'*/
%let OutCSV_Sum2 = &Aim1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum1= &OutCSV_Sum1;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum2= &OutCSV_Sum2;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum2" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part B. Summary 3 & 4**************************************************/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; CLASS DMD_EVER; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY3 QUANTILES = SUMMARY4;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY3; SET SUMMARY3; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;
DATA SUMMARY4; SET SUMMARY4; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum3= &Aim1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%let OutCSV_Sum4 = &Aim1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum3= &OutCSV_Sum3;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum4 = &OutCSV_Sum4;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum3" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum4" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part C. Tabel 1**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;
TABLE SEX*DMD_EVER SES*DMD_EVER COMORB_COUNT*DMD_EVER MENTAL*DMD_EVER HTN*DMD_EVER
LIPID*DMD_EVER COPD*DMD_EVER DM*DMD_EVER EPILEPSY*DMD_EVER IHD*DMD_EVER CANCER*DMD_EVER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT*DMD_EVER /NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE1;RUN;
DATA TABLE1; SET TABLE1; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11"; VAR_TEMP = CATT(SEX,SES,COMORB_COUNT,MENTAL,HTN,LIPID,COPD,DM,EPILEPSY,IHD,CANCER,CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT); VAR_NAMES = COMPRESS(VAR_TEMP,'.');
DROP _TYPE_ _TABLE_ SEX SES COMORB_COUNT MENTAL HTN LIPID COPD DM EPILEPSY IHD CANCER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT VAR_TEMP; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Table1= &Aim1ReportPath.CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV;
PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Table1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part D. Summary 5 & 6**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = &theData;
ODS results off;/*ODS output to report is turned off as PROC FREQ produces a huge table. --Shenzhen*/
WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_NO_IND/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE2;RUN;
ODS results on;
DATA TABLE2; SET TABLE2; COUNTS = Frequency; IF Frequency >1 THEN COUNTS = 1; KEEP DMD_No_Ind COUNTS; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11";RUN;
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = TABLE2;VAR COUNTS; CLASS DMD_No_Ind; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY5;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY5; SET SUMMARY5; KEEP DMD_No_Ind Label2 cValue2; WHERE Label2 = "Sum Observations"; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY5 OUTFILE = "EVER_DMD_IND MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum5= &Aim1ReportPath.EVER_DMD_IND MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum5 = &OutCSV_Sum5;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY5 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum5" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
PROC FREQ DATA = &theData;
ODS results off;/*ODS output to report is turned off as PROC FREQ produces a huge table. --Shenzhen*/
WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_No_First_Second/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE3;RUN;
ODS results on;
DATA TABLE3; SET TABLE3; COUNTS = Frequency; IF Frequency >1 THEN COUNTS = 1; KEEP DMD_No_First_Second COUNTS; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11";RUN;
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = TABLE3;VAR COUNTS; CLASS DMD_No_First_Second; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY6;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY6; SET SUMMARY6; KEEP DMD_No_First_Second Label2 cValue2; WHERE Label2 = "Sum Observations"; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY6 OUTFILE = "EVER_DMD_First_Second MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum6= &Aim1ReportPath.EVER_DMD_First_Second MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum6 = &OutCSV_Sum6;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY6 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum6" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part E. PDF**************************************************/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET DRUMS_BASELINE;AGE_INT = ROUND(AGE); RUN;
/*ODS PDF FILE = "BARPLOT_AGE_AT_INDEX_INTEGER.PDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutPDF = &Aim1ReportPath.BARPLOT_AGE_AT_INDEX_INTEGER.PDF;
ODS PDF FILE = "&OutPDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;
ODS GRAPHICS / WIDTH= 15 IN HEIGHT= 3 IN ;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes"; VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_YES"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;WHERE DMD_EVER = "No"; VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_No"; RUN;
ODS PDF CLOSE;QUIT;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Routing SAS log back to the default place*/
proc printto; run;
s///

children.name: H_AIM1 Real Report_any
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
data _null_;run;
/*DRUMS******************************************************************************************
Site: Saskatchewan
Analyst: Shenzhen YAO

The following program was adapted from the SAS code provided by the DRUMS team in the mail from
to on 2019-06-28
The original code file was saved at:
P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot
************************************************************************************************/
%let FData=_F_any;

/*Routing SAS log to an external file --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*%let targetPilot1ReportPath =P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\Dummy\;*/
%let targetPilot1ReportPath =P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\Real&Fdata\;
%let theLogFile=&targetPilot1ReportPath.drums_log.txt;
%put >>> theLogFile= &theLogFile;
filename theLog "&theLogFile";
/*proc printto log=theLog;run;*/

/*Part 0. Import data**************************************************/
/*Get the real data*/

%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\&FData..zip),
    srcFile=%str(&FData..sas7bdat)
);
%print(data=&FData.)

/*use the real data instead -- Shenzhen 20190702*/
%let theData=&FData.;

/*get the dummy data*/
/*PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = 'DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV' OUT = DRUMS DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let srcDummyPath = P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\;
%let srcFile = DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV;
%let srcFull = &srcDummyPath.&srcFile;
%put >>> srcFull= &srcFull;
/*PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = "&srcFull" OUT = DRUMSDUMMY DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;*/

/*this part is to import the dummy data from the csv file to a SAS data set
    It'll only work when theData = DRUMS_Dummy (case insensitive).
    This is to prevent confusion when load dummy or real data.
    -- Shenzhen 20190702
*/
%macro getDummyData(src=);
    %local src;
    %if %lowcase(&src) = drums_dummy %then %do;
        PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = "&srcFull" OUT = &src DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;
    %end;
%mend getDummyData;
%getDummyData(src=&theData);

/*A file is created to map the two datasets:
P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\map data structure dummy and _F 20190630.xlsx
*/
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/


/*Part A. Summary 1 & 2**************************************************/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET &theData; WHERE PERIOD_N = 1; RUN; /*original line*/
/*DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET &theData; AGE_INT = Round(Age);AGE = AGE; FOLLOW_UP=FOLLOW_UP;WHERE PERIOD_N = 1; RUN; */
/*add integer age and follow up*/

PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY1 QUANTILES = SUMMARY2;RUN;/*original line*/
DATA SUMMARY1; SET SUMMARY1; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;
DATA SUMMARY2; SET SUMMARY2; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;

/*Add number of cohort members in summary1*/
proc sql;
    create table _tmp01 as
    select count(distinct ID) as Npt
    from DRUMS_BASELINE;
quit;
Proc sql;
    create table SUMMARY1_withNpt as
    select t1.*, t2.Npt
    from summary1 t1 cross join _tmp01 t2
    ;
quit;

DATA SUMMARY2; SET SUMMARY2; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;

/*report # of distinct individuals behind the median, Q1 and Q3*/
%macro getDistinctNPt (data=, sumtable=, target=, debug=);
    %local data sumtable target nRows theVar debug;

        /*create an empty table*/
        data ⌖
            delete;
        run;

        /*get a distinct list of varnames*/
        proc sql noprint;
            create table getdistinctNpt_tmp2 as
            select distinct varname
            from &sumtable;
        quit;
        /*determine the # of vars in getdistinctNpt_tmp2*/
        proc sql noprint;
            select count(*) format 20. into :nRows
             from getdistinctNpt_tmp2;
        quit;
        %if &debug=1 %then %put >>> nRows = &nRows;

        /*loop for each varname, from summary 2, get rows with the current varname*/
        %do i = 1 %to &nRows;
            /*get a slice of the varnames from getdistinctNpt_tmp2*/

            data getdistinctNpt_tmp3;
                set getdistinctNpt_tmp2 (firstobs=&i obs=&i);
                call symput('theVar', strip(VarName));
            run;

            %if &debug=1 %then %put >>> the current variable = &theVar;
    
            /*get the records in the summary table (e.g., summary 2) of the current VarName*/
            data getdistinctNpt_tmp4;
                set &sumtable;
                if strip(Varname)=symget('theVar');
            run;

            /*count the distinct number of patients of the selected var, and by levels of the selected var    */
            proc sql;
                create table getdistinctNpt_tmp5 as
                    select distinct
                    t2.*,
                    count(distinct t1.ID) as N_Pt
                from &data t1 inner join getdistinctNpt_tmp4 t2
                on (t1.&theVar = t2.estimate)
                group by t2.Varname, t2.Quantile
                ;
            quit;

            /*append results into the target table*/
            data ⌖
                set &target getdistinctNpt_tmp5;
            run;
        %end;

        %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete getdistinctNpt_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;

%mend getdistinctNpt;
%getDistinctNPt(data=DRUMS_BASELINE, sumtable=SUMMARY2, target=SUMMARY2_withNPT, debug=);


/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum1= &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV;
%let OutCSV_Sum2 = &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum1= &OutCSV_Sum1;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum2= &OutCSV_Sum2;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum2" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum2" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN; /*use the data set with N patients instead*/
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part B. Summary 3 & 4**************************************************/
/*PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; CLASS DMD_EVER; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY3 QUANTILES = SUMMARY4;RUN;*/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; CLASS DMD_EVER; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY3 QUANTILES = SUMMARY4;RUN;

DATA SUMMARY3; SET SUMMARY3; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;
DATA SUMMARY4; SET SUMMARY4; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;


/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum3= &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%let OutCSV_Sum4 = &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum3= &OutCSV_Sum3;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum4 = &OutCSV_Sum4;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum3" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;/*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum4" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;/*original line*/
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part C. Tabel 1**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;
TABLE SEX*DMD_EVER SES*DMD_EVER COMORB_COUNT*DMD_EVER MENTAL*DMD_EVER HTN*DMD_EVER
LIPID*DMD_EVER COPD*DMD_EVER DM*DMD_EVER EPILEPSY*DMD_EVER IHD*DMD_EVER CANCER*DMD_EVER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT*DMD_EVER /NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE1;RUN;
DATA TABLE1; SET TABLE1; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11"; VAR_TEMP = CATT(SEX,SES,COMORB_COUNT,MENTAL,HTN,LIPID,COPD,DM,EPILEPSY,IHD,CANCER,CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT); VAR_NAMES = COMPRESS(VAR_TEMP,'.');
DROP _TYPE_ _TABLE_ SEX SES COMORB_COUNT MENTAL HTN LIPID COPD DM EPILEPSY IHD CANCER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT VAR_TEMP; RUN;

/*As the source data is from Baseline, each cohort member only appears once. As such, the # in the var 'Frequency' is the # of distinct patients
    -- Shenzhen 20190703*/

/*The Table_1 contains small cells and should be suppressed.
    1. As these are cross tables, a small cell, even suppressed, can be back calculated horizontally or vertically.
        This means that once a small cell occurs, the whole cross table has to be suppressed.
        [Comment:] Seems that we have to apply for releasing small cell results. Or there will be many suppressions, making Table 1 not informative.
    2. the numeric values should be changed to char values, so as to indicate those suppressed
*/
/*1. First, transpose the data so that the freq by DMD_EVER groups are listed in the same row.
    That way, it'll be easier to sum the total horizontally, and vertically.
    These summaries will be used to determine suppression and masking.
*/
proc sort data=TABLE1 out=_tmp1;
    by table var_names ;
run;
proc transpose data = _tmp1 out=_tmp2;
    by Table Var_names;
    id DMD_EVER;
    var Frequency;
run;
/*2. For each table, sort by freq in the DMD_EVER = Yes group. In this cohort, the Yes group is more likely to have small cells.
    For rows of the same table, those with the smallest freq comes first
*/
proc sort data=_tmp2;
    by table Yes;
run;
/*3. Next, the number of levels of the current row will be counted. That way, if a small cell exists, we'll know how far is
    the current row away from the small cell.
    The suppression rule stresses that at least two levels should be suppressed. The calculation in this part helps identify
        the level next the level with the small cell. Such next level will be suppressed in the following steps.
*/
data _tmp3;
    set _tmp2;
    by table Yes;
    if first.table then N_levels =1;
    else N_levels +1;
    rename Yes=Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes No = Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
run;
/*3. Now, perform the suppression and masking for small cells.
    Suppression is to suppress the cell with 1-5 individuals
    Masking is to mask the neighboring cells of the small cell (both vertical and horizontal), so that the suppressed cannot be back calculated
*/
data _tmp4;
    set _tmp3;
    by table Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
    /*initially for each table, set everything to 0*/
    if first.table then do;
        sum_sup_v1=0;sum_sup_v2=0;
        sum_sup_h=sum_sup_v1 + sum_sup_v2;
        sup=0;
    end;
    /*For small cells (Freq between 1 and 5):
        1) add the suppressed freq into the sum of suppressed (this is for later steps to check if the total suppressed/masked nubmer is greated than 6)
        2) in the columns S1 or S2 (each for DMD_EVER = yes, DMD_EVER = no group, respectively, indicate 's' standing for suppressed
        3) change the freq to . (suppress the freq)
        4) Indicate that a suppression starts (Sup=1)
    */
    /*approved for reporting small cells, no need to suppress*/
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes < -16 then do;
        sum_sup_v1+Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
        s1 = 's';
        Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
        sup=1;
    end;
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes < -16 then do;
        sum_sup_v2+ Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
        s2 = 's';
        Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        sup=1;
    end;
    /*Within the same table, the small cells always comes first (as level 1). To suppress at least two levels, level 2 should
        also be suppressed.However, level 3 does not have, unless the totally suppressed/masked is still < 6. So starting from level 3, the Suppression will be raisded
        (let Sup return to the value of 0).
    */
    if N_levels > 2 and sum_sup_v1 > 5 and sum_sup_v2> 5 and sum_sup_h > 5 then sup=0;else sup+0;
    /*In the current level (current row), if suppression occurs (Sup=1), the neighboring column should be masked
        To mask the neighboring cell in the same row:
        1) add the masked freq into the sum of suppressed (this is for later steps to check if the total suppressed/masked number is greated than 6)
        2) in the columns S1 or S2 (each for DMD_EVER = yes, DMD_EVER = no group, respectively, indicate 'm' standing for masked
        3) change the freq to . (mask the freq)
        The above 3 actions are however only to take when the neighboring cell itself is not suppressed. Otherwise there is no need to mask again
    */
    if sup=1 then do;
        if s1 ne 's' then do;
                sum_sup_v1+Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
                s1='m';
                Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
        end;
        if s2 ne 's' then do;
                sum_sup_v2+Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
                s2='m';
                Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        end;
    end;
    /*lastly, when the current row is required for suppressing or masking, calculate the overall sum of suppressed/masked
        of the current table*/
    if s1 ne '' and s2 ne '' then do;
        sum_sup_h + sum_sup_v1+sum_sup_v2;
    end;
run;

/*Finally, rearrange the table so as to be conform with the orignal requirement*/
data _tmp5;
    set _tmp4;
    do i = 1 to 2;
        if i =1 then do;
            Frequency = Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
            Suppress_Mark = s1;
            DMD_Ever = 'Yes';
            output;
        end;
        if i =2 then do;
            Frequency = Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
            Suppress_Mark = s2;
            DMD_Ever = 'No';
            output;
        end;
    end;
    keep Table DMD_Ever Frequency Var_Names Suppress_Mark;
run;
/*We can repeat the above for the column missing. but for SK data, there is no missing values. So the column will be simply added*/
data Table1_Suppressed;
    retain Table DMD_Ever Frequency Missing VAR_NAMES;
    set _tmp5;
    Missing=.;
run;
/*Sort the tables by original levels*/
proc sort data=Table1_Suppressed;
    by Table Var_names;
run;

/*PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Table1= &targetPilot1ReportPath.CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Table1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-07-03*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = Table1_Suppressed OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Table1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part D. Summary 5 & 6**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = &theData;
ODS results off;/*ODS output to report is turned off as PROC FREQ produces a huge table. --Shenzhen 20190630*/
WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_NO_IND/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE2;RUN;
ODS results on;
DATA TABLE2; SET TABLE2; COUNTS = Frequency; IF Frequency >1 THEN COUNTS = 1; KEEP DMD_No_Ind COUNTS; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11";RUN;
/*The process in Table2 ensures that each cohort member only gets counted for once.
As such, the 'sum obs' in summary 5 are countings of distinct cohort members --Shenzhen 20190703*/

-- Shenzhen 20190703*/

quit;

/*The process in Table2 ensures that each cohort member only gets counted for once.
As such, the 'sum obs' in summary 5 are countings of distinct cohort members --Shenzhen 20190703*/

WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_No_First_Second/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE3;RUN;

/*Part E. PDF**************************************************/

    As it is from baseline, each cohort member only appear once. As such, the # of frequency is the # of distinct patients*/

                SUPR_DMD_EVER_No='m';
        end;
        Npt_Total=.;
        SUPR_Total='m';
    end;
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_No < -6 then do;
        Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        SUPR_DMD_EVER_No='s';
        if SUPR_DMD_EVER_Yes ne 's' then do;
                Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
                SUPR_DMD_EVER_Yes='m';
        end;
        Npt_Total=.;
        SUPR_Total='m';
    end;
run;

/*Part F, by age groups*/

DATA DRUMS_BASELINE2;
    SET DRUMS_BASELINE;
    format AGE_GRP $10.;
    select ;
        when ( AGE_INT le 30) AGE_GRP='00-30';
        when ( 31 le AGE_INT le 35) AGE_GRP='31-35';
        when ( 36 le AGE_INT le 40) AGE_GRP='36-40';
        when ( 41 le AGE_INT le 45) AGE_GRP='41-45';
        when ( 46 le AGE_INT le 50) AGE_GRP='46-50';
        when ( 51 le AGE_INT le 55) AGE_GRP='51-55';
        when ( 56 le AGE_INT le 60) AGE_GRP='56-60';
        when ( 61 le AGE_INT le 65) AGE_GRP='61-65';
        when ( 66 le AGE_INT le 70) AGE_GRP='66-70';
        when ( 71 le AGE_INT le 75) AGE_GRP='71-75';
        when ( 76 le AGE_INT le 80) AGE_GRP='76-80';
        when ( AGE_INT gt 80) AGE_GRP='>80';
        otherwise AGE_GRP='Wrong';
    end;
RUN;

ODS PDF FILE = "&OutPDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;

data _null_;run;
/*DRUMS******************************************************************************************
Site: Saskatchewan
Analyst: Shenzhen YAO

The following program was adapted from the SAS code provided by the DRUMS team in the mail from
to on 2019-06-28
The original code file was saved at:
P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot
************************************************************************************************/

/*Routing SAS log to an external file --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*%let targetPilot1ReportPath =P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\Dummy\;*/
%let targetPilot1ReportPath =P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\Real\;
%let theLogFile=&targetPilot1ReportPath.drums_log.txt;
%put >>> theLogFile= &theLogFile;
filename theLog "&theLogFile";
/*proc printto log=theLog;run;*/

/*Part 0. Import data**************************************************/
/*Get the real data*/
%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\_F.zip),
    srcFile=%str(_F.sas7bdat)
);
%print(data=_F)

/*use the real data instead -- Shenzhen 20190702*/
%let theData=_F;

/*get the dummy data*/
/*PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = 'DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV' OUT = DRUMS DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let srcDummyPath = P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Documentation\Researcher - Analyst Documentation\Doc from the project team\AIM1 Pilot\;
%let srcFile = DUMMY DATA FOR DRUMS MSP.CSV;
%let srcFull = &srcDummyPath.&srcFile;
%put >>> srcFull= &srcFull;
/*PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = "&srcFull" OUT = DRUMSDUMMY DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;*/

/*this part is to import the dummy data from the csv file to a SAS data set
    It'll only work when theData = DRUMS_Dummy (case insensitive).
    This is to prevent confusion when load dummy or real data.
    -- Shenzhen 20190702
*/
%macro getDummyData(src=);
    %local src;
    %if %lowcase(&src) = drums_dummy %then %do;
        PROC IMPORT DATAFILE = "&srcFull" OUT = &src DBMS = CSV REPLACE;GUESSINGROWS=MAX; RUN;
    %end;
%mend getDummyData;
%getDummyData(src=&theData);

/*A file is created to map the two datasets:
P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports\AIM 1 Pilot\map data structure dummy and _F 20190630.xlsx
*/

/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part A. Summary 1 & 2**************************************************/
/*DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET &theData; WHERE PERIOD_N = 1; RUN;*/ /*original line*/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET &theData; AGE_INT = Round(Age);AGE = AGE; FOLLOW_UP=FOLLOW_UP;WHERE PERIOD_N = 1; RUN; /*add integer age and follow up*/

/*PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY1 QUANTILES = SUMMARY2;RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY1 QUANTILES = SUMMARY2;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY1; SET SUMMARY1; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;

/*Add number of cohort members in summary1*/
proc sql;
    create table _tmp01 as
    select count(distinct ID) as Npt
    from DRUMS_BASELINE;
quit;
Proc sql;
    create table SUMMARY1_withNpt as
    select t1.*, t2.Npt
    from summary1 t1 cross join _tmp01 t2
    ;
quit;

DATA SUMMARY2; SET SUMMARY2; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;

/*report # of distinct individuals behind the median, Q1 and Q3*/
%macro getDistinctNPt (data=, sumtable=, target=, debug=);
    %local data sumtable target nRows theVar debug;

        /*create an empty table*/
        data ⌖
            delete;
        run;

        /*get a distinct list of varnames*/
        proc sql noprint;
            create table getdistinctNpt_tmp2 as
            select distinct varname
            from &sumtable;
        quit;
        /*determine the # of vars in getdistinctNpt_tmp2*/
        proc sql noprint;
            select count(*) format 20. into :nRows
             from getdistinctNpt_tmp2;
        quit;
        %if &debug=1 %then %put >>> nRows = &nRows;

        /*loop for each varname, from summary 2, get rows with the current varname*/
        %do i = 1 %to &nRows;
            /*get a slice of the varnames from getdistinctNpt_tmp2*/

            data getdistinctNpt_tmp3;
                set getdistinctNpt_tmp2 (firstobs=&i obs=&i);
                call symput('theVar', strip(VarName));
            run;

            %if &debug=1 %then %put >>> the current variable = &theVar;
    
            /*get the records in the summary table (e.g., summary 2) of the current VarName*/
            data getdistinctNpt_tmp4;
                set &sumtable;
                if strip(Varname)=symget('theVar');
            run;

            /*count the distinct number of patients of the selected var, and by levels of the selected var    */
            proc sql;
                create table getdistinctNpt_tmp5 as
                    select distinct
                    t2.*,
                    count(distinct t1.ID) as N_Pt
                from &data t1 inner join getdistinctNpt_tmp4 t2
                on (t1.&theVar = t2.estimate)
                group by t2.Varname, t2.Quantile
                ;
            quit;

            /*append results into the target table*/
            data ⌖
                set &target getdistinctNpt_tmp5;
            run;
        %end;

        %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete getdistinctNpt_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;

%mend getdistinctNpt;
%getDistinctNPt(data=DRUMS_BASELINE, sumtable=SUMMARY2, target=SUMMARY2_withNPT, debug=);


/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum1= &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_ALL MSP.CSV;
%let OutCSV_Sum2 = &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_ALL MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum1= &OutCSV_Sum1;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum2= &OutCSV_Sum2;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY1_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum2" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY2_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum2" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN; /*use the data set with N patients instead*/
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part B. Summary 3 & 4**************************************************/
/*PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; CLASS DMD_EVER; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY3 QUANTILES = SUMMARY4;RUN;*/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VAR AGE FOLLOW_UP; CLASS DMD_EVER; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY3 QUANTILES = SUMMARY4;RUN;

DATA SUMMARY3; SET SUMMARY3; WHERE LABEL1 IN ("Mean","Std Deviation"); DROP LABEL2 CVALUE2 NVALUE2; RUN;
/*Add number of cohort members to summary3*/
proc sql;
    create table _tmp02 as
    select DMD_EVER, count(distinct ID) as Npt
    from DRUMS_BASELINE
    group by DMD_EVER
    ;
quit;
Proc sql;
    create table SUMMARY3_withNpt as
    select t1.*, t2.Npt
    from summary3 t1 inner join _tmp02 t2
    on (t1.DMD_EVER=t2.DMD_EVER)
    ;
quit;

DATA SUMMARY4; SET SUMMARY4; WHERE QUANTILE IN ("50% Median","25% Q1","75% Q3"); RUN;
/*in Summary table 4, add number of distinct patients*/
%getDistinctNPt(data=DRUMS_BASELINE, sumtable=SUMMARY4, target=SUMMARY4_withNPT);

/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "MENAS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Sum3= &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEANS_SD_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%let OutCSV_Sum4 = &targetPilot1ReportPath.MEDIAN_IQR_DMD_EVER MSP.CSV;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum3= &OutCSV_Sum3;
%put >>>OutCSV_Sum4 = &OutCSV_Sum4;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum3" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY3_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum3" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum4" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original line*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY4_withNPT OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum4" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part C. Tabel 1**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;
TABLE SEX*DMD_EVER SES*DMD_EVER COMORB_COUNT*DMD_EVER MENTAL*DMD_EVER HTN*DMD_EVER
LIPID*DMD_EVER COPD*DMD_EVER DM*DMD_EVER EPILEPSY*DMD_EVER IHD*DMD_EVER CANCER*DMD_EVER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT*DMD_EVER /NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE1;RUN;
DATA TABLE1; SET TABLE1; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11"; VAR_TEMP = CATT(SEX,SES,COMORB_COUNT,MENTAL,HTN,LIPID,COPD,DM,EPILEPSY,IHD,CANCER,CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT); VAR_NAMES = COMPRESS(VAR_TEMP,'.');
DROP _TYPE_ _TABLE_ SEX SES COMORB_COUNT MENTAL HTN LIPID COPD DM EPILEPSY IHD CANCER CALENDAR_YEAR_CAT VAR_TEMP; RUN;

/*As the source data is from Baseline, each cohort member only appears once. As such, the # in the var 'Frequency' is the # of distinct patients
    -- Shenzhen 20190703*/

/*The Table_1 contains small cells and should be suppressed.
    1. As these are cross tables, a small cell, even suppressed, can be back calculated horizontally or vertically.
        This means that once a small cell occurs, the whole cross table has to be suppressed.
        [Comment:] Seems that we have to apply for releasing small cell results. Or there will be many suppressions, making Table 1 not informative.
    2. the numeric values should be changed to char values, so as to indicate those suppressed
*/
/*1. First, transpose the data so that the freq by DMD_EVER groups are listed in the same row.
    That way, it'll be easier to sum the total horizontally, and vertically.
    These summaries will be used to determine suppression and masking.
*/
proc sort data=TABLE1 out=_tmp1;
    by table var_names ;
run;
proc transpose data = _tmp1 out=_tmp2;
    by Table Var_names;
    id DMD_EVER;
    var Frequency;
run;
/*2. For each table, sort by freq in the DMD_EVER = Yes group. In this cohort, the Yes group is more likely to have small cells.
    For rows of the same table, those with the smallest freq comes first
*/
proc sort data=_tmp2;
    by table Yes;
run;
/*3. Next, the number of levels of the current row will be counted. That way, if a small cell exists, we'll know how far is
    the current row away from the small cell.
    The suppression rule stresses that at least two levels should be suppressed. The calculation in this part helps identify
        the level next the level with the small cell. Such next level will be suppressed in the following steps.
*/
data _tmp3;
    set _tmp2;
    by table Yes;
    if first.table then N_levels =1;
    else N_levels +1;
    rename Yes=Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes No = Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
run;
/*3. Now, perform the suppression and masking for small cells.
    Suppression is to suppress the cell with 1-5 individuals
    Masking is to mask the neighboring cells of the small cell (both vertical and horizontal), so that the suppressed cannot be back calculated
*/
data _tmp4;
    set _tmp3;
    by table Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
    /*initially for each table, set everything to 0*/
    if first.table then do;
        sum_sup_v1=0;sum_sup_v2=0;
        sum_sup_h=sum_sup_v1 + sum_sup_v2;
        sup=0;
    end;
    /*For small cells (Freq between 1 and 5):
        1) add the suppressed freq into the sum of suppressed (this is for later steps to check if the total suppressed/masked nubmer is greated than 6)
        2) in the columns S1 or S2 (each for DMD_EVER = yes, DMD_EVER = no group, respectively, indicate 's' standing for suppressed
        3) change the freq to . (suppress the freq)
        4) Indicate that a suppression starts (Sup=1)
    */
    /*approved for reporting small cells, no need to suppress*/
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes < -16 then do;
        sum_sup_v1+Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
        s1 = 's';
        Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
        sup=1;
    end;
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes < -16 then do;
        sum_sup_v2+ Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
        s2 = 's';
        Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        sup=1;
    end;
    /*Within the same table, the small cells always comes first (as level 1). To suppress at least two levels, level 2 should
        also be suppressed.However, level 3 does not have, unless the totally suppressed/masked is still < 6. So starting from level 3, the Suppression will be raisded
        (let Sup return to the value of 0).
    */
    if N_levels > 2 and sum_sup_v1 > 5 and sum_sup_v2> 5 and sum_sup_h > 5 then sup=0;else sup+0;
    /*In the current level (current row), if suppression occurs (Sup=1), the neighboring column should be masked
        To mask the neighboring cell in the same row:
        1) add the masked freq into the sum of suppressed (this is for later steps to check if the total suppressed/masked number is greated than 6)
        2) in the columns S1 or S2 (each for DMD_EVER = yes, DMD_EVER = no group, respectively, indicate 'm' standing for masked
        3) change the freq to . (mask the freq)
        The above 3 actions are however only to take when the neighboring cell itself is not suppressed. Otherwise there is no need to mask again
    */
    if sup=1 then do;
        if s1 ne 's' then do;
                sum_sup_v1+Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
                s1='m';
                Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
        end;
        if s2 ne 's' then do;
                sum_sup_v2+Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
                s2='m';
                Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        end;
    end;
    /*lastly, when the current row is required for suppressing or masking, calculate the overall sum of suppressed/masked
        of the current table*/
    if s1 ne '' and s2 ne '' then do;
        sum_sup_h + sum_sup_v1+sum_sup_v2;
    end;
run;

/*Finally, rearrange the table so as to be conform with the orignal requirement*/
data _tmp5;
    set _tmp4;
    do i = 1 to 2;
        if i =1 then do;
            Frequency = Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes;
            Suppress_Mark = s1;
            DMD_Ever = 'Yes';
            output;
        end;
        if i =2 then do;
            Frequency = Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
            Suppress_Mark = s2;
            DMD_Ever = 'No';
            output;
        end;
    end;
    keep Table DMD_Ever Frequency Var_Names Suppress_Mark;
run;
/*We can repeat the above for the column missing. but for SK data, there is no missing values. So the column will be simply added*/
data Table1_Suppressed;
    retain Table DMD_Ever Frequency Missing VAR_NAMES;
    set _tmp5;
    Missing=.;
run;
/*Sort the tables by original levels*/
proc sort data=Table1_Suppressed;
    by Table Var_names;
run;

/*PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutCSV_Table1= &targetPilot1ReportPath.CROSS_TABLE MSP.CSV;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = TABLE1 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Table1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-07-03*/
PROC EXPORT DATA = Table1_Suppressed OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Table1" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part D. Summary 5 & 6**************************************************/
PROC FREQ DATA = &theData;
ODS results off;/*ODS output to report is turned off as PROC FREQ produces a huge table. --Shenzhen 20190630*/
WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_NO_IND/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE2;RUN;
ODS results on;
DATA TABLE2; SET TABLE2; COUNTS = Frequency; IF Frequency >1 THEN COUNTS = 1; KEEP DMD_No_Ind COUNTS; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11";RUN;
/*The process in Table2 ensures that each cohort member only gets counted for once.
As such, the 'sum obs' in summary 5 are countings of distinct cohort members --Shenzhen 20190703*/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = TABLE2;VAR COUNTS; CLASS DMD_No_Ind; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY5;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY5; SET SUMMARY5; KEEP DMD_No_Ind Label2 cValue2; WHERE Label2 = "Sum Observations"; RUN;
/*PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY5 OUTFILE = "EVER_DMD_IND MSP.CSV" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/

/*What is it in sum5? is it about # of distinct patients ever received DMD per DMD class? The following is to double confirm
-- Shenzhen 20190703*/
/*
proc sql;
    create table test1 as

    from &theData

quit;

%let OutCSV_Sum5= &targetPilot1ReportPath.EVER_DMD_IND MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum5 = &OutCSV_Sum5;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY5 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum5" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*The process in Table2 ensures that each cohort member only gets counted for once.
As such, the 'sum obs' in summary 5 are countings of distinct cohort members --Shenzhen 20190703*/
PROC FREQ DATA = &theData;
ODS results off;/*ODS output to report is turned off as PROC FREQ produces a huge table. --Shenzhen 20190630*/
WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes";TABLE ID*DMD_No_First_Second/NOCOL NOROW NOPERCENT; ODS OUTPUT CROSSTABFREQS = TABLE3;RUN;
ODS results on;
DATA TABLE3; SET TABLE3; COUNTS = Frequency; IF Frequency >1 THEN COUNTS = 1; KEEP DMD_No_First_Second COUNTS; WHERE _TYPE_ = "11";RUN;
/*The process in Table3 ensures that each cohort member only gets counted for once.
As such, the 'sum obs' in summary 6 are countings of distinct cohort members --Shenzhen 20190703*/
PROC UNIVARIATE DATA = TABLE3;VAR COUNTS; CLASS DMD_No_First_Second; ODS OUTPUT MOMENTS = SUMMARY6;RUN;
DATA SUMMARY6; SET SUMMARY6; KEEP DMD_No_First_Second Label2 cValue2; WHERE Label2 = "Sum Observations"; RUN;
/*What is it in sum6? is it about # of distinct patients ever received DMD per generation? The following is to double confirm
-- Shenzhen 20190703*/

proc sql;
    create table test2 as

quit;

%let OutCSV_Sum6= &targetPilot1ReportPath.EVER_DMD_First_Second MSP.CSV;
%put >>> OutCSV_Sum6 = &OutCSV_Sum6;
PROC EXPORT DATA = SUMMARY6 OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_Sum6" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;
/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part E. PDF**************************************************/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE; SET DRUMS_BASELINE;AGE_INT = ROUND(AGE); RUN;
/*ODS PDF FILE = "BARPLOT_AGE_AT_INDEX_INTEGER.PDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;*//*original code --Shenzhen 2019-06-30*/
%let OutPDF = &targetPilot1ReportPath.BARPLOT_AGE_AT_INDEX_INTEGER.PDF;
ODS PDF FILE = "&OutPDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;
ODS GRAPHICS / WIDTH= 15 IN HEIGHT= 3 IN ;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes"; VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_YES"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE;WHERE DMD_EVER = "No"; VBAR AGE_INT / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_No"; RUN;
ODS PDF CLOSE;QUIT;




/*This part seems to have # of patients by Age_INT, overall and by DMD_EVER group.
    As it is from baseline, each cohort member only appear once. As such, the # of frequency is the # of distinct patients*/
proc sql;
    create table _tmp11 as
    select AGE_INT, DMD_EVER, count(AGE_INT) as N_pt
    from DRUMS_BASELINE
    group by AGE_INT ,DMD_EVER
    order by AGE_INT
    ;
quit;

proc transpose data = _tmp11 out=_tmp12;
    by AGE_INT;
    id DMD_EVER;
    var N_pt;
run;
data _tmp13;
    set _tmp12;
    Npt_Total = sum(Yes, No);
    rename Yes=Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes No = Npt_DMD_EVER_No;
    drop _name_;
run;

data AgeDist_ForPDF_Suppressed;
    set _tmp13;
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes < -6 then do;
        Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
        SUPR_DMD_EVER_Yes='s';
        if SUPR_DMD_EVER_No ne 's' then do;
                Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
                SUPR_DMD_EVER_No='m';
        end;
        Npt_Total=.;
        SUPR_Total='m';
    end;
    if -10 < Npt_DMD_EVER_No < -6 then do;
        Npt_DMD_EVER_No=.;
        SUPR_DMD_EVER_No='s';
        if SUPR_DMD_EVER_Yes ne 's' then do;
                Npt_DMD_EVER_Yes=.;
                SUPR_DMD_EVER_Yes='m';
        end;
        Npt_Total=.;
        SUPR_Total='m';
    end;
run;

/*create an additional table for age distributions*/
%let OutCSV_AgeDist= &targetPilot1ReportPath.AgeDist.CSV;
PROC EXPORT DATA = AgeDist_ForPDF_Suppressed OUTFILE = "&OutCSV_AgeDist" DBMS = CSV REPLACE; RUN;

/*******end of the current Part ***************************************/

/*Part F, by age groups*/



/*end of this part**/
DATA DRUMS_BASELINE2;
    SET DRUMS_BASELINE;
    format AGE_GRP $10.;
    select ;
        when ( AGE_INT le 30) AGE_GRP='00-30';
        when ( 31 le AGE_INT le 35) AGE_GRP='31-35';
        when ( 36 le AGE_INT le 40) AGE_GRP='36-40';
        when ( 41 le AGE_INT le 45) AGE_GRP='41-45';
        when ( 46 le AGE_INT le 50) AGE_GRP='46-50';
        when ( 51 le AGE_INT le 55) AGE_GRP='51-55';
        when ( 56 le AGE_INT le 60) AGE_GRP='56-60';
        when ( 61 le AGE_INT le 65) AGE_GRP='61-65';
        when ( 66 le AGE_INT le 70) AGE_GRP='66-70';
        when ( 71 le AGE_INT le 75) AGE_GRP='71-75';
        when ( 76 le AGE_INT le 80) AGE_GRP='76-80';
        when ( AGE_INT gt 80) AGE_GRP='>80';
        otherwise AGE_GRP='Wrong';
    end;
RUN;
%let OutPDF = &targetPilot1ReportPath.BARPLOT_AGEGROUP_AT_INDEX.PDF;
ODS PDF FILE = "&OutPDF" STARTPAGE=NEVER;
ODS GRAPHICS / WIDTH= 15 IN HEIGHT= 3 IN ;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE2;VBAR AGE_GRP / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE2;WHERE DMD_EVER = "Yes"; VBAR AGE_GRP / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_YES"; RUN;
PROC SGPLOT DATA = DRUMS_BASELINE2;WHERE DMD_EVER = "No"; VBAR AGE_GRP / DATASKIN=GLOSS; XAXIS DISPLAY = (NOLABEL NOTICKS); YAXIS GRID; TITLE "AGE AT INDEX DMD_EVER_No"; RUN;
ODS PDF CLOSE;QUIT;

children.name: G Stat Models
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*_G Statistic models*/
data _null_;run;

%let theStudyID=key_hsn;


%vbsUnzip(
    tgtDir=,
    zipFile=%str(&localTargetPath.\_F.zip),
    srcFile=%str(_F.sas7bdat)
);
%print(data=_F)


/*_GA prepare data*/
data _GA;
    set _F;
    Y1_N_ECNT_T = N_Encounters_Total;
    time =( SegEndDate - SegStartDate) /365.24;
    log_time = log(time);
    keep &theStudyID Y1: X: log_time;
run;


/*_GB Negbin models */

proc genmod data=_GA ;
        class X1_M1_Any (ref="null") &theStudyID / param=effect;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M1_Any /type3 dist=negbin offset=log_time ;
        estimate "X1 receiving anyDMD yes vs no" X1_M1_Any 1 -1 /exp;
        repeated subject=&theStudyID /type=exch modelse printmle mcovb ecovb;
run;quit;
proc genmod data=_GA ;
        class X1_M2_Generations (ref="null") &theStudyID / param=effect;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M2_Generations /type3 dist=negbin offset=log_time ;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD first generations vs no" X1_M2_Generations 1 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD second vs no" X1_M2_Generations 0 1 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD first vs second" X1_M2_Generations 1 -1 0 /exp;
        repeated subject=&theStudyID /type=exch modelse printmle mcovb ecovb;
run;quit;
proc genmod data=_GA ;
        class X1_M3_Classes (ref="null") &theStudyID / param=effect;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M3_Classes /type3 dist=negbin offset=log_time ;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Alemtuzumab vs no" X1_M3_Classes 1    0    0    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Fingolimod vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0 1    0    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Fumarate vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    1    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Glatiramer vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    1    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD IFNB vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    0    1    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Natalizumab vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    0    0    1 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Teriflunomide vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0     0    0    0    0    0 1 -1 /exp;
        repeated subject=&theStudyID /type=exch modelse printmle mcovb ecovb;
run;quit;


proc genmod data=_GA ;
        class
        &theStudyID
        X1_M3_Classes (ref="null")
        X4_SES (ref="1")
        X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT (ref='0')
        X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT (ref='0')
        X7_CMB_B_MH (ref='0')
        X8_CMB_B_HN (ref='0')
        X9_CMB_B_HL (ref='0')
        X10_CMB_B_CL (ref='0')
        X11_CMB_B_DB (ref='0')
        X12_CMB_B_EP (ref='0')
        X13_CMB_B_IH (ref='0')
        X14_CMB_P_MH (ref='0')
        X15_CMB_P_HN (ref='0')
        X16_CMB_P_HL (ref='0')
        X17_CMB_P_CL (ref='0')
        X18_CMB_P_DB (ref='0')
        X19_CMB_P_EP (ref='0')
        X20_CMB_P_IH (ref='0')
            / param=effect;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M3_Classes
                X2_Age
                X4_SES
                X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT
                X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT
                X7_CMB_B_MH
                X8_CMB_B_HN
                X9_CMB_B_HL
                X10_CMB_B_CL
                X11_CMB_B_DB
                X12_CMB_B_EP
                X13_CMB_B_IH
                X14_CMB_P_MH
                X15_CMB_P_HN
                X16_CMB_P_HL
                X17_CMB_P_CL
                X18_CMB_P_DB
                X19_CMB_P_EP
                X20_CMB_P_IH

            /type3 dist=negbin offset=log_time ;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Alemtuzumab vs no" X1_M3_Classes 1    0    0    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Fingolimod vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0 1    0    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Fumarate vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    1    0    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Glatiramer vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    1    0    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD IFNB vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    0    1    0 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Natalizumab vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0    0    0    0    0    1 0 -1 /exp;
        estimate "X1 receiving DMD Teriflunomide vs no" X1_M3_Classes 0     0    0    0    0    0 1 -1 /exp;
        repeated subject=&theStudyID /type=exch modelse printmle mcovb ecovb;
run;quit;

/*beware of multicolinearity*/
proc glm data=_GA;
        class
        &theStudyID
        X1_M3_Classes (ref="null")
        X4_SES (ref="1")
        X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT (ref='0')
        X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT (ref='0')
        X7_CMB_B_MH (ref='0')
        X8_CMB_B_HN (ref='0')
        X9_CMB_B_HL (ref='0')
        X10_CMB_B_CL (ref='0')
        X11_CMB_B_DB (ref='0')
        X12_CMB_B_EP (ref='0')
        X13_CMB_B_IH (ref='0')
        X14_CMB_P_MH
        X15_CMB_P_HN
        X16_CMB_P_HL
        X17_CMB_P_CL
        X18_CMB_P_DB
        X19_CMB_P_EP
        X20_CMB_P_IH
        ;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M3_Classes
                X2_Age
                X4_SES
                X5_NCoMB_Base_CAT
                X6_NCoMB_Seg_CAT
                X7_CMB_B_MH
                X8_CMB_B_HN
                X9_CMB_B_HL
                X10_CMB_B_CL
                X11_CMB_B_DB
                X12_CMB_B_EP
                X13_CMB_B_IH
                X14_CMB_P_MH
                X15_CMB_P_HN
                X16_CMB_P_HL
                X17_CMB_P_CL
                X18_CMB_P_DB
                X19_CMB_P_EP
                X20_CMB_P_IH
        /tolerance
        ;
run;

///t

/*G2 /*_GC Zero Inflated NegBin (ZINB) models
    The GEE (repeated terms) does not take zero-inflated models.
    
*/
%macro notrun;
proc means data = _GA mean std min max var;
var Y1_N_ECNT_T;
run;

ods graphics / width=4in height=3in border=off;
proc sgplot data = _GA;
histogram Y1_N_ECNT_T /binwidth=1;
run;
ods graphics off;

proc freq data = _GA;
tables X1_M1_Any;
run;

proc means data = _GA mean var n nway;
class X1_M1_Any;
var Y1_N_ECNT_T;
run;


proc sort data = _GA;
by descending X1_M1_Any;
run;

proc genmod data=_GA ;
        class X1_M1_Any (ref="null") &theStudyID / param=effect;
        model Y1_N_ECNT_T =X1_M1_Any /type3 dist=zinb offset=log_time ;
        zeromodel X1_M1_Any;
/*        estimate "X1 receiving anyDMD yes vs no" X1_M1_Any 1 -1 /exp;*/
        repeated subject=&theStudyID /type=exch modelse printmle mcovb ecovb;
run;quit;

/*MS claims from hosp within a PHRS gap*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._BA,
    t2=test3,
    target=test4,
    vars=*,
    jtype=inner,
    jterm=%str(
            t1.key_hsn = t2.key_hsn and
            (
            t1.epiadm_date between t2.coverStart and t2.coverEnd
                    or
            t1.epidschg_date between t2.coverStart and t2.coverEnd
            or
            (t2.coverStart < t1.epiadm_date and t2.coverend > t1.epidschg_date)
            )
        )
);

/*MS claims from MSB within a PHRS gap*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=localt._BB,
    t2=test3,
    target=test5,
    vars=*,
    jtype=inner,
    jterm=%str(
            t1.key_hsn = t2.key_hsn and
            (
            t1.dxDate between t2.coverStart and t2.coverEnd
            )
        )
);

%print(data=master_msb);
/*to reconfirm, check the original msb data*/
%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_msb,
    t2=test3,
    target=test6,
    vars=*,
    jtype=inner,
    jterm=%str(
            t1.key_hsn = t2.key_hsn and
            (
            t1.dos between t2.coverStart and t2.coverEnd
            )
        )
);

/*to confirm again, thse coverage gaps can be seen in the original PHRS file*/

%sqljoinv2(
    t1=master_phrs_cov,
    t2=test3,
    target=test6,
    vars=*,
    jtype=inner,
    jterm=%str(
            t1.key_hsn = t2.key_hsn
        ),
    order=%str(t1.key_hsn, t1.eff_date, t1.exp_date)
);
