children.name: DB1 3.1a.2.1.2.1  Report cohort characteristics
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*DB1
3.1a.2.1.2.1
Report cohort characteristics
For this report, each column is for a specified subgroup (or all) of the cohort. The following report is done by column
    In this program, the report is about the subgroup of which Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0
*/
data _null_;
    run;

%let theStudyID=key_hsn;
%let theServeDate=Rx_ddddd;
%let theCohortReportPath=%str(P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports);
%let theCohortReportFile=%str(Cohort-characteristics-DRUMS-Aug2018v10-SK.xlsx);

%let theSheet=%str(Cohort 1a&1b-demogr-SK);
%let CloseXls=;

/*All the variables for reporting is in dataset DA, which is prepared in program DA*/
/*%print(data=localt.DA);*/



    %let theData=localt.DA;
    %let theReportCol=4;
    %let theSubgroupCondition=%str(if Cohort1a_ID_DMD_onlyYN=0);

    data theReportingData;
        set &theData;
        &theSubgroupCondition;
    run;

    /*1. row4, # of members in the selected group*/
    %let theRowN=4;
    %nobs(data=theReportingData);
    data DB1;
        N1=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=db1;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*2. row5, # of members by sex, i.e., female and male*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %let theReportVar=sex;
    %let theRowN=5;
    Data DB2a;
        &theReportVar='F';output;
        &theReportVar='M';output;
    run;
    %freq(data=theReportingData noprint, table=&theReportVar, option=%str(out=db2b));
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=DB2a,
        t2=DB2b,
        target=%str(DB2 (drop = &theReportVar)),
        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
        jtype=left,
        jvars=&theReportVar
    );
    %let reportTable=db2;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );
    
    /*3. row8, # of members not missing 'First_admin_code_date*/
    %let theRowN=8;
    data DB3a;
        set theReportingData;
        if First_admin_code_date ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=DB3a);
    data DB3;
        N2=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=db3;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*4. row9, # of members missing 'First_admin_code_date (which is the difference between DB1 and DB3*/
    %let theRowN=9;
    data DB4;
        merge db1 db3;
        n_missing= n1-n2;
        keep n_missing;
    run;
    %let reportTable=db4;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*5. row10, mean, SD, median(IQR) of age at 'First_admin_code_date'*/
    %let theRowN=10;
    /*5.1 get mean SD median IQR of age on "First_admin_code_date"*/
    %GetMeanStats(
        data=theReportingData,
        where=,
        groupVars=,
        theVar=age_first_admin_code_date,
        theStats=mean median p25 p75,
        target=db5a,
        debug=
    );
    /*5.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
    data db5b1;
        set db5a;
        keep mean;
        rename mean =col;
    run;
    data db5b2;
        set db5a;
        keep std;
        rename std =col;
    run;
    data db5b;
        set db5b1 db5b2;
    run;
    /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
        In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
        */
    %let reportTable=db5b;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*5.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
    data db5c;
        set db5a;
        format col $200.;
        keep col;
        col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
    run;
    %let reportTable=db5c;
    %let theRowN=12;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*5.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
    data db5d1;
        format col $200.;
        col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p75)';
    run;
    data db5d2;
        set db5a;
        col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
        keep col;
    run;
    data db5d;
        set db5d1 db5d2;
    run;
    %let reportTable=db5d;
    %let theRowN=11;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*6. row13, # of members not missing 'Age_First_admin_code_date*/
    %let theRowN=13;
    data DB6a;
        set theReportingData;
        if Age_First_admin_code_date ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=DB6a);
    data DB6;
        N2=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=db6;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*7. row15, # of members categorized by calender year at 'First_admin_code_date' (i.e., the var 'First_admin_code_date' created in program AE)*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %let theReportVar=First_admin_code_Year;
    %let theRowN=15;
    Data DB7a;
        format &theReportVar._CAT $20.;
        id=1;
        &theReportVar._CAT='pre-1990';output;
        id=2;
        &theReportVar._CAT='1990-1994';output;
        id=3;
        &theReportVar._CAT='1995-1999';output;
        id=4;
        &theReportVar._CAT='2000-2004';output;        
        id=5;
        &theReportVar._CAT='2005-2009';output;
        id=6;
        &theReportVar._CAT='2010-2014';output;
        id=7;
        &theReportVar._CAT='2015-2018';output;
    run;
    %MakeCategories(
        Data=theReportingData,
        theVar=&theReportVar,
        theTargetVar=&theReportVar._CAT,
        theCutOffs=1990 1995 2000 2005 2010 2015 ,
        dlmt=,
        debug=,
        target=DB7b,
        CloseSide=left
        );
    %freq(data=DB7b noprint, table=&theReportVar._CAT, option=%str(out=db7c));
    /*compress the spaces*/
    data db7d;
        set db7c;
        &theReportVar._CAT=compress(&theReportVar._CAT, " ");
    run;
    /*the level '1996 - 1999' is different from the level '1995 - 1999' in the template, change it back to the level as in the template*/
    data db7e;
        set db7d;
        if &theReportVar._CAT = '1996-1999' then &theReportVar._CAT ='1995-1999';
    run;
    /*link to the template to report # of individuals by each level*/
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=DB7a,
        t2=db7e,
        target=%str(DB7 (drop=id &theReportVar._CAT) ),
        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
        jtype=left,
        jvars=&theReportVar._CAT,
        orderby=id
    );
    %let reportTable=DB7;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*8. row22, # of members not missing 'First_admin_code_year*/
    %let theRowN=22;
    data DB8a;
        set theReportingData;
        if First_admin_code_Year ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=DB8a);
    data DB8;
        N2=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=db8;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*9. row24, mean, SD, median(IQR) of 'First_to_last_admin_date'*/
    %let theRowN=24;
    /*9.1 get mean SD median IQR of age on "First_to_last_admin_date"*/
    %GetMeanStats(
        data=theReportingData,
        where=,
        groupVars=,
        theVar=First_to_last_admin_date,
        theStats=mean median p25 p75,
        target=db9a,
        debug=
    );
    /*9.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
    data db9b1;
        set db9a;
        keep mean;
        rename mean =col;
    run;
    data db9b2;
        set db9a;
        keep std;
        rename std =col;
    run;
    data db9b;
        set db9b1 db9b2;
    run;
    /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
        In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
        */
    %let reportTable=db9b;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*9.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
    data db9c;
        set db9a;
        format col $200.;
        keep col;
        col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
    run;
    %let reportTable=db9c;
    %let theRowN=26;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*9.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
    data db9d1;
        format col $200.;
        col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p75)';
    run;
    data db9d2;
        set db9a;
        col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
        keep col;
    run;
    data db9d;
        set db9d1 db9d2;
    run;
    %let reportTable=db9d;
    %let theRowN=25;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*there is no 10. (the number 10 was skipped by accident)*/

    /*11. row27, # of members not missing 'First_to_last_admin_date'*/
    %let theRowN=27;
    data DB11a;
        set theReportingData;
        if First_to_last_admin_date ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=DB11a);
    data DB11;
        N2=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=db11;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );


    /*12. row29, # of members by Any record of MS-specific disease-modifying drug, i.e., AnyDMD_FollowUp*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %let theReportVar=AnyDMD_FollowUp;
    %let theRowN=29;
    Data DB12a;
        &theReportVar=1;output;
        &theReportVar=0;output;
    run;
    %freq(data=theReportingData noprint, table=&theReportVar, option=%str(out=db12b));
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=DB12a,
        t2=DB12b,
        target=%str(DB12 (drop = &theReportVar)),
        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
        jtype=left,
        jvars=&theReportVar,
        order=&theReportVar desc
    );
    %let reportTable=db12;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    /*14. row31-46, # of members receiving a specific subclass of DMD, e.g., AnyIFNB_FollowUp, etc*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %macro ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=, theRowN=, debug=);
    /*    %let theReportVar=AnyIFNB_FollowUp;*/
    /*    %let theRowN=31;*/
        %local theReportVar theRowN debug;

        Data ReportNRecieveSub_tmp1;
            set theReportingData;
            if &theReportVar=1;
        run;
        %nobs(data=ReportNRecieveSub_tmp1);
        data ReportNRecieveSub_tmp2;
            N=&nobs;
        run;
        %let nobs=;

        %let reportTable=ReportNRecieveSub_tmp2;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete ReportNRecieveSub_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;
    %mend ReportNRecieveSub;
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=AnyIFNB_FollowUp, theRowN=31, debug=1);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=IFNB1B_FollowUp, theRowN=32, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=IFNB1ASC_FollowUp, theRowN=33, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=IFNB1AIM_FollowUp, theRowN=34, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=EXTA_FollowUp, theRowN=35, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=PEGI_FollowUp, theRowN=36, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=AnyGLAT_FollowUp, theRowN=37, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=GLAT20_FollowUp, theRowN=38, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=GLAT40_FollowUp, theRowN=39, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Nata_FollowUp, theRowN=40, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Fing_FollowUp, theRowN=41, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Dime_FollowUp, theRowN=42, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Teri_FollowUp, theRowN=43, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Alem_FollowUp, theRowN=44, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Dacl_FollowUp, theRowN=45, debug=);
    %ReportNRecieveSub(theReportVar=Ocre_FollowUp, theRowN=46, debug=);


    /*15. Loop for selected subClass of DMD, and report # of users by sex and calendarYear;
        age statistics and FirstRx_to_last_admin_date statistics (mean, sd, median (IQR))*/
%macro ReportUserBySubClass(
            theSub=,
            theStartRow_sex=,
            theStartRow_Age=,
            theStartRow_Year=,
            theStartRow_Rx=,
            yearCutOff=,
            changeCatLines=,
            yearCatLines=,
            debug=
);

    %local theSub theStartRow_Sex theStartRow_Age theStartRow_Year yearCutoff changeCatLines theStartRow_Rx
                yearCatLines debug;

        /*15.1, determine the subClass of DMD*/
        data theSubData;
            set theReportingData;
            if &theSub._FollowUP=1;
        run;


        /*15.2. row = &theStartRow_Sex, # of members by sex, i.e., female and male*/
        /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
        %let theReportVar=sex;
        %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Sex;
        Data RptUsrSubCls_tmp1a;
            &theReportVar='F';output;
            &theReportVar='M';output;
        run;
        %freq(data=theSubData noprint, table=&theReportVar, option=%str(out=RptUsrSubCls_tmp1b));
        %sqljoinv2(
            t1=RptUsrSubCls_tmp1a,
            t2=RptUsrSubCls_tmp1b,
            target=%str(RptUsrSubCls_tmp1 (drop = &theReportVar)),
            vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
            jtype=left,
            jvars=&theReportVar
        );
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp1;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.3. row=theStartRow_Age, mean, SD, median(IQR) of age at 'First_admin_code_date'*/
        %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Age;
        /*15.3.1 get mean SD median IQR of age on "First_admin_code_date"*/
        %GetMeanStats(
            data=theSubData,
            where=,
            groupVars=,
            theVar=age_first_admin_code_date,
            theStats=mean median p25 p75,
            target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a,
            debug=
        );
        /*15.3.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            keep mean;
            rename mean =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2c;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            keep std;
            rename std =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2d;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2b RptUsrSubCls_tmp2c;
        run;
        /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
            In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
            */
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp2d;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.3.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp3;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            format col $200.;
            keep col;
            col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp3;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Age + 2);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.3.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4a;
            format col $200.;
            col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p75)';
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
            keep col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp4a RptUsrSubCls_tmp4b;
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp4;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Age +1);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

    /*15.4. row=&theStartRow_Year, # of members categorized by calender year at 'First_admin_code_Year'
        ( the var 'First_admin_code_date' created in program AE)*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %let theReportVar=First_admin_code_Year;
    %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Year;
    Data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5a;
        format &theReportVar._CAT $20.;
        &yearCatLines;
    run;

    %MakeCategories(
        Data=theSubData,
        theVar=&theReportVar,
        theTargetVar=&theReportVar._CAT,
        theCutOffs=&yearCutOff ,
        dlmt=,
        debug=,
        target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5b,
        CloseSide=left
        );
    %freq(data=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5b noprint, table=&theReportVar._CAT, option=%str(out=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5c));
    /*compress the spaces*/
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5d;
        set RptUsrSubCls_tmp5c;
        &theReportVar._CAT=compress(&theReportVar._CAT, " ");
    run;
    /*change the cat name, e.g., the level '1996 - 1999' is different from the level '1995 - 1999' in the template, change it back to the level as in the template*/
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5e;
        set RptUsrSubCls_tmp5d;
        &changeCatLines;
    run;
    /*link to the template to report # of individuals by each level*/
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5a,
        t2=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5e,
        target=%str(RptUsrSubCls_tmp5 (drop=id &theReportVar._CAT) ),
        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
        jtype=left,
        jvars=&theReportVar._CAT,
        orderby=id
    );
    %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

        /*15.5 row=theStartRow_Rx, mean, SD, median(IQR) of age at &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End,
            e.g., 'AnyIFNB_Yrs1stRx2End'*/
        %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Rx;
        /*15.5.1 get mean SD median IQR of &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End*/
        %GetMeanStats(
            data=theSubData,
            where=,
            groupVars=,
            theVar=&theSub._Yrs1stRx2End,
            theStats=mean median p25 p75,
            target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a,
            debug=
        );
        /*15.5.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            keep mean;
            rename mean =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6c;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            keep std;
            rename std =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6d;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6b RptUsrSubCls_tmp6c;
        run;
        /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
            In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
            */
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp6d;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.5.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp7;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            format col $200.;
            keep col;
            col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp7;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx + 2);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.5.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8a;
            format col $200.;
            col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p75)';
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
            keep col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp8a RptUsrSubCls_tmp8b;
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp8;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx +1);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

    /*15.6 row=, # of members not missing 'First_to_last_admin_date'*/
    %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx+3);
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp9a;
        set theSubData;
        if &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=RptUsrSubCls_tmp9a);
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp9;
        N=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp9;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete RptUsrSubCls_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;

%mend ReportUserBySubClass;

            target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a,
            debug=
        );
        /*15.3.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            keep mean;
            rename mean =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2c;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            keep std;
            rename std =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp2d;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2b RptUsrSubCls_tmp2c;
        run;
        /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
            In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
            */
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp2d;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.3.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp3;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            format col $200.;
            keep col;
            col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp3;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Age + 2);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.3.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4a;
            format col $200.;
            col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p50)';
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp2a;
            col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
            keep col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp4;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp4a RptUsrSubCls_tmp4b;
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp4;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Age +1);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );


    /*15.4. row=&theStartRow_Year, # of members categorized by calender year at 'First_admin_code_Year'
        ( the var 'First_admin_code_date' created in program AE)*/
    /*Note, to avoid missing values for a level, always create a template with all levels*/
    %let theReportVar=First_admin_code_Year;
    %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Year;
    Data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5a;
        format &theReportVar._CAT $20.;
        &yearCatLines;
    run;

    %MakeCategories(
        Data=theSubData,
        theVar=&theReportVar,
        theTargetVar=&theReportVar._CAT,
        theCutOffs=&yearCutOff ,
        dlmt=,
        debug=,
        target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5b,
        CloseSide=left
        );
    %freq(data=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5b noprint, table=&theReportVar._CAT, option=%str(out=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5c));
    /*compress the spaces*/
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5d;
        set RptUsrSubCls_tmp5c;
        &theReportVar._CAT=compress(&theReportVar._CAT, " ");
    run;
    /*change the cat name, e.g., the level '1996 - 1999' is different from the level '1995 - 1999' in the template, change it back to the level as in the template*/
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp5e;
        set RptUsrSubCls_tmp5d;
        &changeCatLines;
    run;
    /*link to the template to report # of individuals by each level*/
    %sqljoinv2(
        t1=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5a,
        t2=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5e,
        target=%str(RptUsrSubCls_tmp5 (drop=id &theReportVar._CAT) ),
        vars=%str(t1.*, t2.count),
        jtype=left,
        jvars=&theReportVar._CAT,
        orderby=id
    );
    %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp5;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

        /*15.5 row=theStartRow_Rx, mean, SD, median(IQR) of age at &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End,
            e.g., 'AnyIFNB_Yrs1stRx2End'*/
        %let theRowN=&theStartRow_Rx;
        /*15.5.1 get mean SD median IQR of &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End*/
        %GetMeanStats(
            data=theSubData,
            where=,
            groupVars=,
            theVar=&theSub._Yrs1stRx2End,
            theStats=mean median p25 p75,
            target=RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a,
            debug=
        );
        /*15.5.2 get mean and SD, and rearrange them into rows in the same table, report mean and SD*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            keep mean;
            rename mean =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6c;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            keep std;
            rename std =col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp6d;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6b RptUsrSubCls_tmp6c;
        run;
        /*report mean and SD, note that mean and SD are reported separately from median and IQR
            In so, all decimal places of the mean and SD are kept, which is favored for future meta analyses
            */
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp6d;
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.5.3 get median and IQR, and rearrange them as median (IQR) in the same row, and then report*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp7;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            format col $200.;
            keep col;
            col=strip(median) || '(' || strip(p25) || "," || strip(p75) || ')';
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp7;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx + 2);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=&theReportCol,
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

        /*15.5.4 report the number of patients with exactly the median age (as requested by privacy regulations)*/
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8a;
            format col $200.;
            col='N_patients_at_median(p25,p50)';
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8b;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp6a;
            col= strip(put(N_Patients_median, 8.)) || '(' || strip(put(N_Patients_p25, 8.)) || "," || strip(put(N_Patients_p75, 8.)) || ')';
            keep col;
        run;
        data RptUsrSubCls_tmp8;
            set RptUsrSubCls_tmp8a RptUsrSubCls_tmp8b;
        run;
        %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp8;
        %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx +1);
        %SASToXlsRange(
                xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
                xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
                data=&reportTable,
                SheetName=&theSheet,
                cellRow=&theRowN,
                cellCol=%eval(&theReportCol+3),
                selectSheet=1,
                waitSec=3,
                removeChar=,
                debug=,
                closeFile=&CloseXls
        );

    /*15.6 row=, # of members not missing 'First_to_last_admin_date'*/
    %let theRowN=%eval(&theStartRow_Rx+3);
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp9a;
        set theSubData;
        if &theSub._Yrs1stRx2End ne .;
    run;
    %nobs(data=RptUsrSubCls_tmp9a);
    data RptUsrSubCls_tmp9;
        N=&nobs;
    run;
    %let nobs=;
    %let reportTable=RptUsrSubCls_tmp9;
    %SASToXlsRange(
            xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
            xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
            data=&reportTable,
            SheetName=&theSheet,
            cellRow=&theRowN,
            cellCol=&theReportCol,
            selectSheet=1,
            waitSec=3,
            removeChar=,
            debug=,
            closeFile=&CloseXls
    );

    %if &debug ne 1 %then %do;
            proc datasets nolist;
                delete RptUsrSubCls_tmp:;
            run;
        %end;

children.name: Q DA1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
Question:What if a patient start 2 diff class of drugs on the same date? Are the use of DMDs mutually exclusive?
t///

children.name: DAA.Qtest1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
DA.Q1DAA. 3.1a.2.1.QTest1Tests for Q_DA1What if a patient start 2 diff class of drugs on the same date? Are the use of DMDs mutually exclusive?[Why]The following is to illustrate the patterns of start/receiving DMD medication groups during the follow up[End of Why]1. for all patients in DA (the final cohort with covariate info, in particular, the firstRxDate_Flwp of specified MD DMD groups. Transpose the data into rows with patient id, the DMD group, and the firstRxDate_Flwp receiving a medication of the select DMD group during follow up2. sort the above data by studyID, thefirstRxDate_Flwps, and DMDgroup, and assign a shortCode for the DMD groups3. determine the patterns of receiving different groups of DMDs during follow up
t///

children.name: DAA.Qtest1
children.NodeDescription:
///t
///s
/*
DAA.Q1
DAA. 3.1a.2.1.QTest1
Tests for Q_DA1
*/


data _null_;run;


%let theStudyID=key_hsn;


/*1. for all patients in DA (the final cohort with covariate info, in particular, the firstRxDate_Flwp of specified MD DMD groups
    transpose the data into rows with patient id, the DMD group, and the firstRxDate_Flwp receiving a medication of the select DMD group
    during follow up
*/
data DAA1;
    set localt.da;
    do DMDGroup='AnyIFNB', 'AnyGLAT', 'NATA', 'FING', 'DIME', 'TERI', 'DACL', 'OCRE', 'ALEM';
        theVarNameStr=strip(DMDGroup) || '_firstRxDate_Flwp';        
        /*Output if the specified firstRxDate_Flwp is not null
            Note
            1) it does not work to have lines such as:
                if thefirstRxDate_Flwp ne . then do;.... end;
            When the if line is executed (), thefirstRxDate_Flwp is not created yet (values for
            thefirstRxDate_Flwp are saved in a temp variable before outputing into the target data set). Consequently
            the if lines cannot find values of thefirstRxDate_Flwp for all records, and no rows will be kept.
            the correct way is to check the original values in vars like 'AnyIFNB_firstRxDate_Flwp', or the derivatives from such values.
            2) the function VVALUEX() always returns values in character type, and may have healding or trailing spaces.
        */
        if strip(vvaluex(theVarNameStr)) ne '' and strip(vvaluex(theVarNameStr)) ne '.' then do;
            thefirstRxDate_Flwp=input(vvaluex(theVarNameStr), anydtdte12.);
            output;
        end;
    end;
/*    format thefirstRxDate_Flwp date9.;*/
    format thefirstRxDate_Flwp date9.;
    keep &theStudyID theVarNameStr DMDGroup thefirstRxDate_Flwp ;
run;
/*%freq(data=DAA1, table=DMDGroup);*/

/*2. sort the above data by studyID, thefirstRxDate_Flwps, and DMDgroup, and assign a shortCode for the DMD groups*/
data DAA2;
    set DAA1;
    select ;
        when (DMDGroup='AnyIFNB') ShortDMDGrp='I';
        when (DMDGroup= 'AnyGLAT') ShortDMDGrp='G';
        when (DMDGroup= 'NATA') ShortDMDGrp='N';
        when (DMDGroup= 'FING') ShortDMDGrp='F';
        when (DMDGroup= 'DIME') ShortDMDGrp='M';
        when (DMDGroup= 'TERI') ShortDMDGrp= 'T';
        when (DMDGroup= 'DACL') ShortDMDGrp= 'C';
        when (DMDGroup= 'OCRE') ShortDMDGrp= 'O';
        when (DMDGroup= 'ALEM') ShortDMDGrp= 'A';
        otherwise ShortDMDGrp= '9';
    end;
run;
%sort(data=DAA2, sorter=&theStudyID thefirstRxDate_Flwp DMDgroup);
/*%distinct(data=DAA2, target=DAA5, vars=ShortDMDGrp, orderby=ShortDMDGrp);*/

/*3. determine the patterns of receiving different groups of DMDs during follow up*/
Data localt.DAA;
    set DAA2;
    format thePattern $100.;
    by &theStudyID thefirstRxDate_Flwp DMDgroup;
    /*for the first record of each patient,
            save the short code of DMDgrp into the var thePattern
            save the firstRxDate_Flwp into the currentDate (theCurDate)
            remember the values in thePattern and theCurDate (retain)*/
    if first.&theStudyID then do;
        thePattern=ShortDMDGrp;
        theCurDate=thefirstRxDate_Flwp;
        retain thePattern theCurDate;
    end;
    /*if it is not the first record of the patient*/
    else do;
        /*if thefirstRxDate_Flwp is the same as the remembered (retained) theCurDate:*/
        if thefirstRxDate_Flwp = theCurDate then do;
            /*Concatenate the shortCode of DMD group to the existing values of thePattern
                with a prefix of '_' to indicate that the current DMD group and the previous DMD group were received on the same date*/
            thePattern=strip(thePattern) || '-' || strip(ShortDMDGrp);
        end;
        /*if thefirstRxDate_Flwp is not the same as the remembered (retained) theCurDate:*/
        else do;
            /*concatenate the short code of DMDgrp to the existing values in thePattern
                update the value of theCurDate with the firstRxDate_Flwp    */
            thePattern=strip(thePattern) || strip(ShortDMDGrp);
            theCurDate=thefirstRxDate_Flwp;
        end;
    end;
    format theCurDate date9.;
    drop theCurDate;
    /*for each patient only keep the last row,which contains all the patterns of the same patient*/
    if last.&theStudyID;
run;
%freq(data=localt.DAA noprint, table=thePattern, order=freq, option=%str(out=DAA3));
data DAA4;
    set DAA3;
    percent=percent/100;
run;
data DAA5;
    format ftnote $300.;
    ftnote = 'A=Alemtuzumab;F=Fingolimod;G=Glatiramer acetat;I=Beta-interferon(IFNB);M=Dimethyl fumarate;N=Natalizumab;T=Teriflunomide';
    output;
    ftnote = 'Examples. Pattern=I: patients only received medications of the beta-interferon (IFNB) class during follow-up;Pattern = IG: patients received IFNB, and then Glatiramer acetat during follow-up;Pattern=I_G:patients started IFNB and Glatiramer acetat on the same date during follow up (such patterns that patients started two DMD classes on the same date were not observed in the SK site)';
    output;
run;

%let theCohortReportPath=%str(P:\DRUMS(EvansC)_Bio18-83\Output\Reports);
%let theCohortReportFile=%str(Cohort-characteristics-DRUMS-Aug2018v10-SK.xlsx);

%let theSheet=%str(Pattern_FirstRx_Followup);
%let CloseXls=;

%SASToXlsRange(
        xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
        xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
        data=DAA4,
        SheetName=&theSheet,
        cellRow=5,
        cellCol=1,
        selectSheet=1,
        waitSec=,
        removeChar=,
        debug=,
        closeFile=&CloseXls
);

%SASToXlsRange(
        xlsFilePath=&theCohortReportPath,
        xlsFileName=&theCohortReportFile,
        data=DAA5,
        SheetName=&theSheet,
        cellRow=2,
        cellCol=2,
        selectSheet=1,
        waitSec=,
        removeChar=,
        debug=,
        closeFile=&CloseXls
);

children.NodeDescription:
///t
Learning 1VNAME VVALUE VVALUExdata DAA1;set localt.da;do DMDGroup='AnyIFNB', 'AnyGLAT', 'NATA', 'FING', 'DIME', 'TERI', 'DACL', 'OCRE', 'ALEM';theVarNameStr=strip(DMDGroup) || '_firstRxDate';/*Output if the specified firstRxDate is not nullNote 1) it does not work to have lines such as:if theFirstRxDate ne . then do;.... end;When the if line is executed (),  theFirstRxDate is not created yet (values fortheFirstRxDate are saved in a temp variable before outputing into the target data set). Consequentlythe if lines cannot find values of theFirstRxDate for all records, and no rows will be kept.the correct way is to check the original values in vars like 'AnyIFNB_firstRxDate', or the derivatives from such values.2) the function VVALUEX() always returns values in character type, and may have healding or trailing spaces. */if strip(vvaluex(theVarNameStr)) ne '' and strip(vvaluex(theVarNameStr)) ne '.' then do;theFirstRxDate=input(vvaluex(theVarNameStr), anydtdte12.);output;end;end;/*format theFirstRxDate date9.;*/format theFirstRxDate date9.;keep &;theStudyID theVarNameStr DMDGroup theFirstRxDate ;run;Learning 2/*calcuate which var first */Wrong1 (the order maters) :data _db3a;set _db2;by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;output;if first.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studyenddate and the stop of current claim (which is the last within the study period)*/if adj_stop < studyEndDate then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = studyEndDate;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;output;end;end;if last.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studystartdate and the start of current claim (which is the first within the study period)*/if adj_start > studyStartDate then do;adj_start = studyStartDate;adj_stop = adj_start -1; /*Wrong!, as the adj_start value has been changed*/Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;output;end;end;run;Wrong 2(the output order confounds the correct setting of dates, Add heading and trailing unexposed periods in separate steps, each time, re-sort the data);Data _db3a;set _db2;by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;output;if first.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studyenddate and the stop of current claim (which is the last within the study period)*/if adj_stop < studyEndDate then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = studyEndDate;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;output;end;end;if last.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studystartdate and the start of current claim (which is the first within the study period)*/if adj_start > studyStartDate then do;adj_stop = adj_start -1; /*calculate adj_stop first, as the adj_start value will be changed*/adj_start = studyStartDate;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;output;end;end;run;correct:data _db3a;set _db2;if key_hsn = '06335354647';by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;output;if first.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studyenddate and the stop of current claim (which is the last within the study period)*/if adj_stop < studyEndDate then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = studyEndDate;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;mark='t';output;end;end;run;/*2. insert unexposed periods between: the last claim and the studyenddate*/%sort(data=_db3a, sorter=%str(&;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop));data _db3b;set _db3a;by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;output;if last.&;theStudyID then do;/*insert an unexposed period if there is a gap between studystartdate and the start of current claim (which is the first within the study period)*/if adj_start > studyStartDate then do;adj_stop = adj_start -1; /*calculate adj_stop first, as the adj_start value will be changed*/adj_start = studyStartDate;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;mark='h';output;end;end;run;Learning 3:Whether to use lag or retain:Correct:data _db3c;set _db3b;lagAdjSart = lag(adj_start);by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;if first.&;theStudyID then do;lagAdjSart = adj_start;output;end;else do;output;/*if there is a gap between adj_stop and the next claim's adj start (preAdjStart)insert an unexposed period*/if  lagAdjSart -adj_stop > 1 then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = lagAdjSart -1;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;mark='s';output;end;lagAdjSart=adj_start;end;format lagAdjSart date9.;run;Wrong1 (is it the same as above, if so it is correct):data _db3b;set _db3a;lagAdjStart=lag(adj_start);by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;if first.&;theStudyID then do;lagAdjStart = adj_start;output;end;else do;output;/*if there is a gap between adj_stop and the next claim's adj start (lagAdjStart)insert an unexposed period*/if adj_stop < lagAdjStart then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = lagAdjStart -1;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;output;end;end;format lagAdjStart date9.;run;Wrong2 (redundent period between the last claim and the study end):data _db3b;set _db3a;retain preAdjStart;by &;theStudyID descending adj_start descending adj_stop;if first.&;theStudyID then do;preAdjStart = adj_start;output;end;else do;output;/*if there is a gap between adj_stop and the next claim's adj start (preAdjStart)insert an unexposed period*/if adj_stop - preAdjStart > 1 then do;adj_start = adj_stop +1;/*calculate adj_start first, as the adj_stop value will be changed*/adj_stop = preAdjStart -1;Rx_ddddd =.;Class_short ='null';generation_short='null';supplydays=.;mark='s';output;end;preAdjStart=adj_start;end;format preAdjStart date9.;run;Learning 4: cleaning overlappingWrong:data _db2d;set _db2c;by &;theStudyID descending start descending stop;if not first.&;theStudyID then do; /*the first record should not be changed*/if adj_stop > lagStart then do;adj_stop = lagStart -1;end;end;run;correct:data _db2d;set _db2c;by &;theStudyID descending start descending stop;if not first.&;theStudyID then do; /*the first record should not be changed*/if adj_stop >= lagStart then do;adj_stop = lagStart -1;end;end;run;Learning 5: handling the gap between the last claim and the study end:Wrong:data _Db2b;set _Db2a;lagstart=lag(start);by &;theStudyID descending start descending stop;if first.&;theStudyID then do;lagstart = start;gap=0;end;else do;gap = lagstart - stop -1;end;format lagstart date9.;run;Correct:data _Db2b;set _Db2a;lagstart=lag(start);by &;theStudyID descending start descending stop;if first.&;theStudyID then do;lagstart = start;gap=StudyEndDate - stop -1;end;else do;gap = lagstart - stop -1;end;format lagstart date9.;run;/*if a gap is between 0 and 89, extend the stop date by + 89 daysif a gap is 90 or more, add a grace period by + 30 days[Comment]There might be a potential problem here. Is it fair that - for a gap within 90 days, add 89 days (treat as continuously covered)- for a gap of 90 days and beyond, add 30 days (grace period)*/data _db2c;set _db2b;adj_stop=stop;if 0 <= gap < 90 then do;adj_stop = stop + 89;end;else do;if gap ge 90 then do;adj_stop = stop + 30;end;end;format adj_stop date9.;run;Learning 7: using the var names before renamingWrong:data _db5;retain &;theStudyID studyStartDate studyEndDate NSeg_Any exposure_status segStartDate_Any segEndDate_Any;set _db5a;by &;theStudyID  extend_adj_start  adj_stop;if last.extend_adj_start;drop adj_start  Class_Short Generation_short lag_exposure_status;rename extend_adj_start = segStartDate_Any adj_stop = segEndDate_Any;run;Correct:data _db5;retain &;theStudyID studyStartDate studyEndDate NSeg_Any exposure_status extend_adj_start segEndDate_Any;set _db5a;by &;theStudyID  extend_adj_start  adj_stop;if last.extend_adj_start;drop adj_start  Class_Short Generation_short lag_exposure_status;rename extend_adj_start = segStartDate_Any adj_stop = segEndDate_Any;run;

///t
Q.DA2How does missing non-adjudicated pharmacy claims affect the AnyDMD_firstRxDate_Flwp during the follow up period 
t///

children.name: DAB.Qtest2
children.NodeDescription:
///t
DA.Q2DAB. 3.1a.2.1.QTest2Tests for Q_DA2How does missing non-adjudicated pharmacy claims affect the AnyDMD_firstRxDate_Flwp during the follow up period [Why]The impact will be in two folds:1) It affects the First_Admin_Code_Date (as tested in AEB.Qtest2)2) It affects the firstRxDate during flow up (AnyDMD_firstRxDate_Flwp)It is complicated to gauge both folds of impact at this moment. Comparing to the cohort from complete data, both the First_admin_code_date, and the AnyDMD_firstRxDate_flwp may chnage, making it difficult to interpret. In general, the follow up should start when all data is available. In other words, the cases should be excluded if in time when data were not completely available (including the look back window).[End of Why]

/* macro puts quotes around words;*/
%macro checkquotes(list);
    %local i clist token;
    %let clist=;

    %do i=1 %to %sysfunc(countw(&list));
        %let token = %sysfunc(compress(%scan(&list,&i),%str(%'%")));
        %let clist = &clist %sysfunc(quote(&token));
    %end;

    &clist
%mend;

quit; /*02JAN1996    21DEC2013*/

/*create preg_delivery_date(s) variable*/
data pregnancy3;
    set pregnancy2;
    by key_hsn;
    pregnancy=1;

    if adm_date=. then
        preg_delivery_date=dos_1;
    else if dos_1=. then
        preg_delivery_date=adm_date;
    else preg_delivery_date=min(adm_date, dos_1);
    format preg_delivery_date date9.;
    preg_year_prior=preg_delivery_date-365;
    format preg_year_prior date9.;
    preg_delivery_post_date=preg_delivery_date+365;
    format preg_delivery_post_date date9.;
run;

by key_hsn preg_delivery_date;

/*merge with drug file and creat preg_stop_date variable: if pregnancy=1: select the lastest date of preg_year_prior or supply_ends
some patients have different exit_date when their supply_end_date later than perg_year_prior and choose the last one before preg_ICD_date*/


proc sql noprint;
    create table pregnancy4 as
        select a.*, b.* from
            AIMS.pregnancy a, AIMS.MS_DRUG_INDEX b
        where a.key_hsn=b.key_hsn
            order by key_hsn, preg_year_prior, supply_end;
quit;


data test;
    set pregnancy4;
    where index_date
    keep key_hsn index_date supply_end preg_year_prior preg_delivery_date preg_stop_date;
run;

data pregnancy5;
    set pregnancy4;
    where index_date
    if preg_year_prior ne . then
        preg_stop_date=max ( preg_year_prior, supply_end);
    else preg_stop_date=.;
    format preg_stop_date date9.;
    keep key_hsn index_date supply_end preg_year_prior preg_delivery_date preg_stop_date;
run;

data test;
    set pregnancy5;

    if preg_stop_date=.;
run;

proc sql;
    create table Pregnancy6 as
        select distinct key_hsn, preg_delivery_date, preg_stop_date
            from pregnancy5;
quit;/*208 keys: 1 patients have no drug use before preg_ICD_date*/


/*for each pregnancy claim, choose the last supply or preg_delivery_date to be the max_preg_stop_date */
proc sql;
    create table Pregnancy7 as
        select distinct key_hsn, preg_delivery_date, max(preg_stop_date) as max_preg_stop_date format date9.
            from pregnancy6
            group by key_hsn, preg_delivery_date;
quit;/*208 keys: 1 patients have no drug use before preg_ICD_date*/

proc sort data=pregnancy7;
    by key_hsn max_preg_stop_date;
run;

/*select the first max_preg_stop_date as the earliest_preg_stop_date, will be used for the exit_date identification*/
data pregnancy8;
    set pregnancy7;
    by key_hsn;
    earliest_preg_stop_date=max_preg_stop_date;

    if last.key_hsn;
    keep key_hsn earliest_preg_stop_date;
run;

/* merge back to drug file, make sure everyone has a no missing preg_stop_date;*/
data pregnancy9;
    merge ms_drug pregnancy8;
    by key_hsn;
    if earliest_preg_stop_date=. then earliest_preg_stop_date='31Dec9999'd;
    format earliest_preg_stop_date date9.;
    keep key_hsn earliest_preg_stop_date;
run;

data test;
set pregnancy9;
if earliest_preg_stop_date ne '31Dec9999'd;
run;

/*test how many case no drug after preg_year_prior;*/
data test;
    set pregnancy9;

    if earliest_preg_stop_date=preg_year_prior and preg_year_prior ne .;
run;/*25 keys*/

quit;

    study_end='30Jun2013'd;

run;

data all_stop2;
    set all_stop;

        if stop[i]=. then

    drop i;

data ms_drug_index_exit2;
    set ms_drug_index_exit;

    if din in (&din_Betaseron_q) then
        drug='Betaseron';
    else if din in (&din_Extavia_q) then
        drug='Extavia';
    else if din in (&din_Tysabri_q) then
        drug='Tysabri';
    else if din in (&din_Gilenya_q) then
        drug='Gilenya';
    else if din in (&din_Rebif_q) then
        drug='Rebif';
    else if din in (&din_Avonex_q) then
        drug='Avonex';
    else if din in (&din_Copaxone_q) then
        drug='Copaxone';
    else drug='missing';

    if supply_end=rx_ddddd>= index_date;
run;

/*key_hsn= 63645334610 had only one dispensation and supply_end>exit_date, exit_date - index_date<90*/

if key_hsn='63645334610';

data test;

/*gap variable*/
data ms_drug_index_exit2;
    set ms_drug_index_exit2;
    by key_hsn;
    pre_key=lag(key_hsn);
    pre_supply=lag(supply_end);
    pre_drug=lag(drug);

    /*    first drug dispensation*/
    if first.key_hsn then
        do;
            pre_key = '';
            pre_supply =.;
            pre_drug='';
            initial_IMD=drug;
        end;

    format pre_supply date9.;
    gap=rx_ddddd-pre_supply;

    /*    last drug dispensation before exit_date*/
    if last.key_hsn then
        do;
            last_supply_end=supply_end;
            last_gap= exit_date- supply_end;
        end;
    else
        do;
            last_gap= .;
            last_supply_end=.;
        end;

    format last_supply_end date9.;

    /*    only one drug dispensation*/
    if first.key_hsn and last.key_hsn then
        disc_first_disp=1;
    else disc_first_disp=0;

    /*    identify the gaps >90*/
    if gap>90 then
        big_gap=1;
    else big_gap=0;
run;

data ms_drug_index_exit3;
    set ms_drug_index_exit2;
    by key_hsn;
    drop initial_IMD;
run;



/*assign the initial_IMD to every record*/
data ms_drug_index_exit4;
    set ms_drug_index_exit2;
    by key_hsn;

    if initial_IMD ne '';
    keep key_hsn initial_IMD;
run;



data AIMS.ms_drug_index_exit;
    merge ms_drug_index_exit3 ms_drug_index_exit4;
    by key_hsn;

run;

end;

data stop;
set AIMS.stop;
keep key_hsn persistence_time_initial persistence_time_any censor;
run;

proc sort data=stop;
by key_hsn;
run;


proc sort data=AIMS.analyses_file;
by key_hsn;
run;


data cox;
merge AIMS.analyses_file (in=id) AIMS.stop;
by key_hsn;
if id;
run;

/*diagnosis from cihi*/
%Extract_CIHI( ds_in = &hosp_file,
    ds_out=AIMS.MS_demyelinating_CIHI_extract,
    adms_start_date='01Jan1980'd,
    adms_end_date=&cihi_end_date,
    ICD_field_list=1-25,

    ICD9_exact_list=&ICD9_MS_demyelinating,
    ICD10_list=,
    ICD10_exact_list=&ICD10_MS_demyelinating,
    hsn_file=AIMS.analyses_file
    );/* 3066 obs 1297 key_hsn*/
proc sql;
    create table key_MS_demyelinating as
        select distinct key_hsn
            from AIMS.MS_demyelinating_CIHI_extract;
quit;

proc sql;
    create table test as
        select distinct min(adm_date) as min_adm_date format date9., max(adm_date) as max_adm_date format date9.
            from AIMS.MS_demyelinating_CIHI_extract;
quit;/*15APR1996    24MAR2014*/


/*nobody has records before 1996, so keep all of them to identify the death */

/*identify the number of patients who die during study among the final cohort population*/


data analyses_file_death;
    merge AIMS.analyses_file (in=id) clean13.VERF_DTHS_JFM13_02OCT2013;
    by key_hsn;

    if id;
run;

proc sort data=analyses_file_death out=analyses_file_death2 (keep=key_hsn index_date best_dt);
    by key_hsn best_dt;
    where best_dt>index_date;
run;/* 57 obs */

data analyses_file_death3 (rename=(best_dt=death_date));
    set analyses_file_death2;
    by key_hsn;

    if first.key_hsn;
    keep key_hsn index_date best_dt;
run;/*57 obs*/


proc sql;
    create table test as
        select distinct min(adm_date) as min_adm_date format date9., max(adm_date) as max_adm_date format date9.
            from &hosp_file;
quit;/*15APR1996    24MAR2014*/

%Extract_CIHI( ds_in = &hosp_file,
    ds_out=AIMS.analyses_file_any_diag_hosp,
    adms_start_date='01Jan1980'd,
    adms_end_date=&cihi_end_date,
    ICD_field_list=1-25,

    ICD9_exact_list=,
    ICD10_list=,
    ICD10_exact_list=,
    hsn_file=AIMS.analyses_file
    );/* 6884 obs 1297 key_hsn*/


proc sql;
    create table key as
        select distinct key_hsn
            from AIMS.analyses_file_any_diag_hosp;
quit;

data analyses_file_any_diag_hosp2;
set AIMS.analyses_file_any_diag_hosp;
if index_date+366<=adm_date<=index_date+730;
run;

/*452 obs 253 key_hsn*/

proc sql;
    create table key_analyses_file_hosp2 as
        select distinct key_hsn
            from analyses_file_any_diag_hosp2;
quit;
proc sort data=analyses_file_any_diag_hosp2;
by key_hsn adm_date;
run;

data analyses_file_any_diag_hosp3;
    set analyses_file_any_diag_hosp2;
    by key_hsn;
    lag_adm=lag(adm_date);
    lag_dschg=lag(DSCHG_DATE);
    lag_key_hsn=lag(key_hsn);
    gap=adm_date-lag_dschg;

    if DSCHG_DATE=adm_date then
        stay=0;
    else stay=1;
    lag_stay=lag(stay);
    retain _adm_date;

    if first.key_hsn then
        do
        _adm_date=adm_date;
            new_adm_date=_adm_date;
            back_to_back=0;
        end;
    else
        do;
            if gap<2 then
                do
                back_to_back=1;
                    new_adm_date=_adm_date;
                end;
            else
                do back_to_back=0;
                    new_adm_date=adm_date;
                    _adm_date=adm_date;
                end;
        end;

    format new_adm_date lag_adm lag_dschg lag_new_adm_date _adm_date new_adm_date yymmdd10.;
    keep key_hsn gap index_date lag_key_hsn lag_adm lag_dschg adm_DATE DSCHG_DATE back_to_back stay lag_stay _adm_date new_adm_date;
run;

proc sql;
create table analyses_file_any_diag_hosp4 as
select distinct key_hsn, sum(stay) as total_stay,new_adm_date
from analyses_file_any_diag_hosp3
group by key_hsn, new_adm_date;
quit;


data analyses_file_any_diag_hosp5;
set analyses_file_any_diag_hosp4;
if total_stay>0 ;
run;


proc sql;
create table analyses_file_any_diag_hosp6 as
select distinct key_hsn, count (distinct new_adm_date) as any_diag_inpatients_adm
from analyses_file_any_diag_hosp5
group by key_hsn;
quit;


data analyses_file_any_diag_hosp7;
set analyses_file_any_diag_hosp4;
if total_stay=0 ;
run;


proc sql;
create table analyses_file_any_diag_hosp8 as
select distinct key_hsn, count (distinct new_adm_date) as any_diag_day_adm
from analyses_file_any_diag_hosp7
group by key_hsn;
quit;


data any_diag_adm;
merge analyses_file_any_diag_hosp6 analyses_file_any_diag_hosp8;
by key_hsn;
run;

/*merge all admission variables*/
data all_admission;
merge AIMS.analyses_file (in=id) any_diag_adm primary_diag_adm;
by key_hsn;
if id;
run;

data all_admission2;
set all_admission;
if any_diag_day_adm=. then any_diag_day_adm=0;
if any_diag_inpatients_adm=. then any_diag_inpatients_adm=0;
if primary_diag_day_adm=. then primary_diag_day_adm=0;
if primary_diag_inpatients_adm=. then primary_diag_inpatients_adm=0;
any_diag_both=any_diag_day_adm+any_diag_inpatients_adm;
primary_diag_both=primary_diag_day_adm+primary_diag_inpatients_adm;
run;

proc freq data=all_admission2;
table any_diag_day_adm any_diag_inpatients_adm primary_diag_day_adm primary_diag_inpatients_adm
any_diag_both primary_diag_both;
run;

/* coverage_days calculate to identify the offset variable*/
data all_admission3;
set all_admission2;
index_366=index_date+366;
index_730=index_date+730;
run;

%coverage_days (xtrc_dt='08OCT2014'd,
ds_in =all_admission3,
ds_out=all_admission3,
strt_dt_var=index_366,
end_dt_var=index_730,
def_strt_dt=07DEC1994,
def_end_dt=&sysdate9,
cvrg_strt_dt_var=eff_date,
cvrg_end_dt_var=exp_date );

data AIMS.analyses_file_possion;
set all_admission3;
logcvg=log(CVGdays/365);

if any_diag_day_adm>=1 then c_any_diag_day_adm=1; else c_any_diag_day_adm=0;
if any_diag_inpatients_adm>=1 then c_any_diag_inpatients_adm=1; else c_any_diag_inpatients_adm=0;
if primary_diag_day_adm >=1 then c_primary_diag_day_adm=1; else c_primary_diag_day_adm=0;
if primary_diag_inpatients_adm>=1 then c_primary_diag_inpatients_adm=1;else c_primary_diag_inpatients_adm=0;
if any_diag_both>=1 then c_any_diag_both=1;else c_any_diag_both=0;
if primary_diag_both>=1 then c_primary_diag_both=1;else c_primary_diag_both=0;

run;



proc freq data=AIMS.analyses_file_possion;
table logcvg any_diag_day_adm any_diag_inpatients_adm primary_diag_day_adm primary_diag_inpatients_adm
any_diag_both primary_diag_both c_any_diag_day_adm c_any_diag_inpatients_adm c_primary_diag_day_adm c_primary_diag_inpatients_adm
c_any_diag_both c_primary_diag_both;
run;

/*test the overdispersion*/
data fit;
set fit (where=(criterion='Scaled Pearson X2'));
format pvalue pvalue6.4;
pvalue=1-probchi(value,df);
run;

proc print data=fit noobs;
var criterion value df pvalue;
run;
/*output reveals a p-value <0.0001 indicating rejection of null hypothesis of no overdispersion at the most commonly use confidence levels*/

/*another method for the assessing the goodness-of-fit of model*/
/*first: observe the value of the largest count and the sample size and save them into macro variables*/
proc means data=AIMS.analyses_file_possion noprint;
var total_hosp;
output out=maxcount max=max n=n;
run;

data _null_;
set maxcount;
call symput('N',N);
call symput('max',max);
run;

%let max=%sysfunc(strip(&max));

/*next use the model predications and the estimated zero-inflation probabilities that are stored in the output data zip to compute the */
/*conditional probabilities*/
data zip(drop=i);
set zip;
lambda=pred/(1-pzero);
array ep{0:&max} ep0-ep&max;
array c(0:&max) c0-c&max;
do i=1 to &max;
if i=0 then ep{i}=pzero+(1-pzero)*pdf('POISSON',i,lambda);
else ep{i}= (1-pzero)*pdf('POISSON',i,lambda);
c{i}=ifn(total_hosp=i,1,0);
end;
run;

proc means data=zip noprint;
var ep0-ep&max c0-c&max;
output out=ep(drop=_type_ _freq_) mean(ep0-ep&max)=ep0-ep&max;
output out=p(drop=_type_ _freq_) mean(c0-c&max)=ep0-ep&max;
run;

proc transpose data=ep out=ep(rename=(col1=zip) drop=_name_);
run;


proc transpose data=p out=p(rename=(col1=p) drop=_name_);
run;

data zipprob;
    merge ep p;
    zipdiff=p-zip;
    total_hosp=_n_-1;
    label zip='ZIP Probabilities'
        p='Relative Frequencies'
        zipdiff='Observed minus Predicted';
run;

proc sgplot data=zipprob;
scatter x=total_hosp y=p/
markerattrs=(symbol=circlefilled size=5px color=blue);
scatter x=total_hosp y=zip/
markerattrs=(symbol=trianglefilled size=5px color=red);
xaxis type=discrete;
run;

proc sgplot data=zipprob;
series x=total_hosp y=zipdiff/
lineattrs=(pattern=shortdash color=blue)
markers markerattrs=(symbol=circlefilled size=5px color=blue);
refline 0/axis=y;
xaxis type=discrete;
run;

/*above two plots shows that the zip model account for the excess zeros quite well and*/
/*that the zip distribution reasonably captures the shape od fistribution of the relative freq*/

/*COHORT FOLLOW UP DAYS*/

PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE FU AS
SELECT * FROM AIMS.MS_INDEX_EXIT_DATE AS A
WHERE A.KEY_HSN IN (SELECT KEY_HSN FROM AIMS.analyses_file);
QUIT;


PROC MEANS DATA=FU N MEAN STD MEDIAN P25 P50 P75 RANGE;
VAR FOLLOW_UP_DAYS;
RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=FU;
TABLE FOLLOW_UP_DAYS;
RUN;

/*updated: Feb 17 2016. Frequency check*/

data din_check_list;
set aims.ATC_CODES_UPDATED;
if ATC4 in('C10AA' 'H03AA' 'C09AA' 'C09CA');
RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=din_check_list;
TABLE ATC4;
RUN;

%Extract_Drug(xtrc_start_dt='06APR2006'd,
    xtrc_end_dt='15OCT2015'd,
    excl_xtrc_dt=,
    ds_out=ATC_FREQ,
    alldin_file=&alldinfile,
    hsn_list=,
    hsn_file=AIMS.ANALYSES_FILE,
    din_list=,
    din_file=din_check_list,
    genname_list=,
    genname_file=,
    strt_dt='01Jan2001'd,
    end_dt= '30JUN2015'd); /*31463 obs key_hsn*/

    
PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE TT2 AS
SELECT MIN(RX_DDDDD) AS MIN_DATE FORMAT=DATE9., MAX(RX_DDDDD) AS MAX_DATE FORMAT=DATE9. FROM ATC_FREQ;
QUIT;
/*04JAN2001    30JUN2015*/


    PROC SORT DATA=ATC_FREQ;
    BY DIN;
    RUN;

    
    PROC SORT DATA=aims.ATC_CODES_UPDATED;
    BY DIN;
    RUN;

    DATA ATC_FREQ2;
    MERGE ATC_FREQ (IN=ID) aims.ATC_CODES_UPDATED;
    BY DIN;
    IF ID;
    RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=ATC_FREQ2;
TABLE ATC4 ;
RUN;

DATA ATC_FREQ3;
SET ATC_FREQ2;
IF ATC4 NE '';
RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=ATC_FREQ3;
TABLE ATC4 ;
RUN;

PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE TT AS
SELECT DISTINCT KEY_HSN FROM ATC_FREQ3;
QUIT;
/* 500 OF 1297 HAD atc4 CODE*/

/*OVERALL*/
PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE ALL_HSN AS
SELECT DISTINCT KEY_HSN FROM AIMS.MS_Drug_extract;
QUIT;
/*1443*/

%Extract_Drug(xtrc_start_dt='06APR2006'd,
    xtrc_end_dt='15OCT2015'd,
    excl_xtrc_dt=,
    ds_out=ALL_ATC_FREQ,
    alldin_file=&alldinfile,
    hsn_list=,
    hsn_file=ALL_HSN,
    din_list=,
    din_file=din_check_list,
    genname_list=,
    genname_file=,
    strt_dt='01Jan2001'd,
    end_dt= '30JUN2015'd); /*107011 obs key_hsn*/

    

PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE TT2 AS
SELECT MIN(RX_DDDDD) AS MIN_DATE FORMAT=DATE9., MAX(RX_DDDDD) AS MAX_DATE FORMAT=DATE9. FROM ALL_ATC_FREQ;
QUIT;
/*04JAN2001    30JUN2015*/


    PROC SORT DATA=ALL_ATC_FREQ;
    BY DIN;
    RUN;

    
    PROC SORT DATA=aims.ATC_CODES_UPDATED;
    BY DIN;
    RUN;

    DATA ALL_ATC_FREQ2;
    MERGE ALL_ATC_FREQ (IN=ID) aims.ATC_CODES_UPDATED;
    BY DIN;
    IF ID;
    RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=ALL_ATC_FREQ2;
TABLE ATC4 ;
RUN;

DATA ALL_ATC_FREQ3;
SET ALL_ATC_FREQ2;
IF ATC4 NE '';
RUN;

PROC FREQ DATA=ALL_ATC_FREQ3;
TABLE ATC4 ;
RUN;

/*'C10AA' 'H03AA' 'C09AA' 'C09CA'*/
DATA ALL_ATC_FREQ4;
SET ALL_ATC_FREQ3;
IF ATC4='C10AA' THEN C10AA=1; ELSE C10AA=0;
IF ATC4='H03AA' THEN H03AA=1; ELSE H03AA=0;
IF ATC4='C09AA' OR ATC4='C09CA' THEN C09AA_C09CA=1; ELSE C09AA_C09CA=0;
IF ATC4='C09AA' THEN C09AA=1; ELSE C09AA=0;
IF ATC4='C09CA' THEN C09CA=1; ELSE C09CA=0;

RUN;

PROC SQL;
CREATE TABLE ALL_ATC_FREQ5 AS
SELECT DISTINCT KEY_HSN, SUM(C10AA) AS TOTAL_C10AA, SUM(H03AA) AS TOTAL_H03AA, SUM(C09AA_C09CA) AS TOTAL_C09AA_C09CA,
SUM(C09AA) AS TOTAL_C09AA, SUM(C09CA) AS TOTAL_C09CA FROM ALL_ATC_FREQ4
GROUP BY KEY_HSN;
QUIT;
